SUMMARY:
Aun asÃ­, tenemos que poner en la mesa que la propuesta del Partido Revolucionario Institucional (PRI) de no recibir dinero pÃºblico y nada mÃ¡s mantenerse del privado es una pÃ©sima idea que desgranarÃ© a continuaciÃ³n.
Con esta iniciativa del PRI les vamos a abrir la puerta para que el cochinero sea mayÃºsculo.
Pero ojo, esto no es algo que el INE haya decidido, fueron los mismos partidos y sus representantes en el Congreso quienes lo votaron en la Ley General de Partidos PolÃ­ticos.
**Nota, esto no quiere decir que los otros sean unas blancas palomitas, nada mÃ¡s hay unos que tienen mÃ¡s colmillo que otros**Muchos aquÃ­ dirÃ¡n: "pues mientras no sea con nuestro dinero que hagan lo que quieran, de todas maneras ya usan dinero sucio".
De verdad Â¿crees que los van a llevar ante la justicia para que paguen por lo que hicieron?
TEXT:
Entiendo que despuÃ©s de esta afirmaciÃ³n quieras despotricar en mi contra y decirme todas las barbaridades que se te estÃ¡n ocurriendo, pues la clase polÃ­tica mexicana y en especÃ­fico los partidos polÃ­ticos han demostrado ser una rÃ©mora que chupa dinero pÃºblico a borbotones, no rinde cuentas y, regularmente, lo usa para llenar los bolsillos de unos cuantos. AhÃ­ estÃ¡ el caso de las tarjetas Monex, las multas constantes al Partido Verde o los desvÃ­os de dinero pÃºblico de los estados a las campaÃ±as electorales.

Aun asÃ­, tenemos que poner en la mesa que la propuesta del Partido Revolucionario Institucional (PRI) de no recibir dinero pÃºblico y nada mÃ¡s mantenerse del privado es una pÃ©sima idea que desgranarÃ© a continuaciÃ³n.

En principio, tienes que tomar en cuenta que esta iniciativa saliÃ³ del PRI y ellos pertenecen al dark side, son los malosos que nos han robado y violado los derechos por aÃ±os, como por ejemplo con el fraude electoral de 1988, la masacre de indÃ­genas en Acteal en 1997, recibir una casa blanca de tu amigo contratista como lo hizo Enrique PeÃ±a Nieto y hasta desfalcar a un estado completo como lo ocurrido en Veracruz con el exgobernador Javier Duarte. AsÃ­ que, no seas inocente: algo se traen entre manos al decir que no recibirÃ¡n dinero pÃºblico. Pues no son buena onda, no ven por su paÃ­s y menos por acabar con la corrupciÃ³n ya que han sido parte de ella por aÃ±os, no por nada somos el paÃ­s mÃ¡s corrupto de AmÃ©rica Latina.

Con esta iniciativa del PRI les vamos a abrir la puerta para que el cochinero sea mayÃºsculo.

Aclarado eso, ahora vamos a la discusiÃ³n del dinero.

En 2018, los partidos polÃ­ticos recibirÃ¡n 6 mil 778 millones de pesos para gasto ordinario y de campaÃ±a â€“mÃ¡s lo que reciban por las elecciones estatales-, el presupuesto mÃ¡s alto de la historia del Instituto Nacional Electoral. Pero ojo, esto no es algo que el INE haya decidido, fueron los mismos partidos y sus representantes en el Congreso quienes lo votaron en la Ley General de Partidos PolÃ­ticos. En efecto, es un dineral que NO se merecen.

Peeero la soluciÃ³n no es dejar que los partidos polÃ­ticos se financien con dinero privado, pues en primera los mÃ¡sters para conseguir dinero de privados, dÃ­gase de empresarios, lÃ­deres sindicales, cuotas partidistas y en ocasiones dinero sucio del crimen organizado o del presupuesto de los estados son los propios priistas. Por ejemplo, actualmente existe una investigaciÃ³n de la FiscalÃ­a Especializada para la AtenciÃ³n de Delitos Electorales donde investigan a varios candidatos por el presunto uso de dinero ilÃ­cito y al ex gobernador Javier Duarte tambiÃ©n lo investigan por haber desviado recursos pÃºblicos para campaÃ±as.

**Nota, esto no quiere decir que los otros sean unas blancas palomitas, nada mÃ¡s hay unos que tienen mÃ¡s colmillo que otros**

Muchos aquÃ­ dirÃ¡n: "pues mientras no sea con nuestro dinero que hagan lo que quieran, de todas maneras ya usan dinero sucio". Pues quÃ© creen: no, esto es una pÃ©sima, pÃ©sima idea. En un panorama hipotÃ©tico, digamos que un presidente municipal en Nayarit, llega a ese puesto porque tuvo mucho dinero en su campaÃ±a y regalÃ³ billetes o todos los que votaron por Ã©l. Pero resulta que ese dinero saliÃ³ del crimen organizado, el cual obvio se va a querer cobrar el "favorcito" de alguna manera. O sea, gracias a recibir dinero privado, quienes viven en esa comunidad seguro se verÃ¡n afectados por deberle un favor al narco.

Otro ejemplo menos radical, un candidato a gobernador recibe millones de una empresa minera, con eso, hace una campaÃ±ota en su estado y gana. Ahora, le debe un "favorcito" a la empresa, la cual casualmente estÃ¡ involucrada en un escÃ¡ndalo de contaminaciÃ³n de un rÃ­o local y muerte de varias personas por beber de su agua. De verdad Â¿crees que los van a llevar ante la justicia para que paguen por lo que hicieron?

En nuestro paÃ­s los candidatos y candidatas estÃ¡n acostumbradas a violar la ley y si de por sÃ­ al INE le ha costado un trabajal fiscalizar lo que ya reciben de dinero pÃºblico y privado, con esta iniciativa del PRI les vamos a abrir la puerta para que el cochinero sea mayÃºsculo.

Entonces, sÃ­, reduzcÃ¡mosles el presupuesto pÃºblico y privado al mÃ­nimo, Ãºnicamente para que puedan operar en un paÃ­s austero pero no, no dejemos que pase la propuesta priista.

*Este contenido representa la opiniÃ³n del autor y no necesariamente la de HuffPost MÃ©xico.
TITLE: Yo sÃ­ quiero que les paguemos a los partidos (antes de insultarme, lÃ©eme)

SUMMARY:
Personal branding expertMuslim Fashion And Muslim Clothing Is Not A Uniform: How Diverse Is The Modest Fashion Industry?
student, community activist, aspiring journalistWhat Is Up With Women's Clothes Sizes?
Founder of make-up brand Studio 10Five Irritating Outdated Features On 'Women's' Clothing As well as periods, childbirth and just general inequality all over the world - women really don't have it that easy.
If that's not enough, we have to put up with rubbish (and even useless) features on women's wear.
But both times I had to really, really try hard to keep them safe from bodily fluids, wine or spaghetti bolognese sauce.
TEXT:
Distractive Or Attractive? Nowadays, when one walks into a clothing retailer, we can be overwhelmed by the plethora of styles, fabrics and colours. Begin by just perusing, and if something takes your eye, inspect the item further. Does it look right and feel right? Yes, by feeling the item, we often make a connection. Does it appear to be well made and do the details appear congruent? Personal branding expert

Muslim Fashion And Muslim Clothing Is Not A Uniform: How Diverse Is The Modest Fashion Industry? Offering a professional platform to exalt modest fashion designers in London was no coincidence. Organiser of LMFW, Franka Soeria said, "London is one of the trendiest places for modest fashion" in the West with a large supportive community. student, community activist, aspiring journalist

What Is Up With Women's Clothes Sizes? What is vanity sizing? In short, it's a marketing tool. Clothing companies wanted to compliment shoppers by reducing the sizes to make women feel they're a size or two smaller than they really were. Co-Founder and Director of Gender Free World

From The Catwalk To Your Wardrobe, The Trends For S/S17 With blue skies and warmer weather finally starting to make an appearance, it's time to refresh our wardrobes, replacing heavy fabrics and dark colours with lighter tones and softer textures to compliment the longer days and brighter nights. Celebrity stylist, mum, fashion lover

Too Old For Zara? How Dare You! I love fashion. It might be considered a frippery to many but it's part of my identity, my passion and my time. Fashion matters and can make a real difference not only to how you look, but how you feel. Founder of make-up brand Studio 10

Five Irritating Outdated Features On 'Women's' Clothing As well as periods, childbirth and just general inequality all over the world - women really don't have it that easy. If that's not enough, we have to put up with rubbish (and even useless) features on women's wear. It's like the person in charge of all women's wear said "Let's make the clothes as impractical and low quality as possible compared to men's clothes... just for a laugh!" Co-Founder and Director of Gender Free World

I Dread Clothes Shopping - Shops Need To Start Representing All Women I look in the mirror and stare at the parts of my body that don't match what I feel the ideal body looks like. I hope that when the zip is done up, suddenly I'll be transformed into one of the women I see in fashion adverts or on Instagram. Obviously, I'm disappointed. I pull and pinch the bits of skin that form rolls over waistbands, and that's when the tears start. Blogs Assistant, HuffPost UK

Bell Sleeves: Seven Times You'll Seriously Regret Wearing Them This week alone I wore two items of clothing with large, wafty sleeves in the name of being a bit summery. But both times I had to really, really try hard to keep them safe from bodily fluids, wine or spaghetti bolognese sauce. Here are seven times bell sleeves proved completely impractical... Lifestyle Writer at HuffPost UK

We Were Able To Create A Fashion Label Available To All - Things Aren't So Easy These Days Early on in building our first brand we developed a philosophy that went "Red or Dead would be the world's first affordable designer label for people that grew up not knowing what design was and if they did couldn't have afforded it anyway" Admittedly this was a bit of a mouthful and ultimately we shortened it to "The first affordable designer label". Iconic designer and Vintage Festival founder

Do Social Norms Determine What You Wear? I was beginning to feel that way with this faux leather skirt. I live in a small Welsh countryside town where the majority wear jeans each day and that is very much the norm and generally the done thing. Blogger

Why The Hell Do People Care What I Wear? For fear of judgement from others, older women tend to play it safe fashion-wise, sticking to a handful of brands that we see our peers wearing and giving up on anything that we perceive to represent 'young fashion'. In truth, many women my age feel that they've lost the right to wear what they want. But, as I've said many times before, and will continue to do so - fashion is ageless! Co-founder of The Posh Rock

Women, Advertising And The Power Of Positive Body Language People relate to and identify with those of their own gender. If the visual portrayal of our gender is so proscribed then perhaps it is no wonder that so many women experience 'Imposter Syndrome' - a belief of being unworthy Founder of feminist British fashion house, Rose & Willard

The History Of The Brogue And Top Styles For AW16 While the majority of brogues sold are still classic and stylishly traditional, the characteristics of brogues, including the perforations, toe-caps and the serrated edges, can now be found combined with trainers, heels and even boots! Sarah is a freelance fashion, beauty and lifestyle writer from the Midlands

I'm With Vogue, Cleavage Is 'Over' (But Can We Please Bring It Back?) Plunging, cutaway and Bardot necklines, cut-out backs, delicate straps and barely-there slip dresses dominate the high street. If you need support your only hopes are strapless bras, sticky 'breast lift' contraptions (FYI these are truly dire) or tit tape and a prayer. Style writer, The Huffington Post UK

I Moved To China, And What I Saw Changed The Way I Think About Clothes Forever But what struck me as I peddled through city after city, each offering a kaleidoscope view into how our clothes, textiles, tiles, electronics to even our door knobs are made, is how disconnected Western people are with the impact of our consumption on communities around the world. Founder Redress, Co-Founder BYT
TITLE: Women's Fashion: Style And Trend News, Galleries And Blogs For Women Of All Ages

SUMMARY:
Hitting stores October 13th, the range is a 'celebration of basics', and the aim was to design products that were clever yet understated with a simple, timeless quality.
"Ypperlig features clean lines, muted colours and classic Scandinavian materials.
"It's one of the most known and used Ikea products, but one that no one appreciates as a design object.
The rest of the collection has a classic Scandinavian feel with light colours and clean design.
While Scandinavian design has always reflected traditional values of functionality, humbleness, simplicity the collection also has modern values like multifunctional items and space saving solutions.
TEXT:
Ikea has teamed up with Danish design company Hay to create a Scandinavian design-inspired collection, YPPERLIG.

Hitting stores October 13th, the range is a 'celebration of basics', and the aim was to design products that were clever yet understated with a simple, timeless quality.

Hay was founded in Copenhagen, Denmark, in 2002 by husband and wife duo Mette and Rolf Hay. Their aim for this project was to make good design accessible to everyone so customers are getting their high-end designer aesthetic at Ikea prices.

"Ypperlig features clean lines, muted colours and classic Scandinavian materials. While each piece can be categorised as a timeless and classic basic made to fit any home, Ikea and Hay have elevated basics into must-have products with a high design value. Hay and Ikea have pushed Scandinavian design to new levels -- enabling us to bring amazing products into everyday homes all at an affordable price," Tiffany Buckins, Head of Interior Design for Ikea Australia, said of the collection.

Standouts from the range include the sofa-bed (pictured above), the steel and timber bookshelf (in the top image) and the timber dining table (below).

The design duo also gave the iconic Ikea bag a makeover. Mette wanted to refresh it while still honouring the original and without changing the size or materials, so she worked with the colours and weaving patterns to create six unique colour ways.

"It's one of the most known and used Ikea products, but one that no one appreciates as a design object. It's a celebration of this iconic product," Mette said in a brand statement.

The rest of the collection has a classic Scandinavian feel with light colours and clean design. While Scandinavian design has always reflected traditional values of functionality, humbleness, simplicity the collection also has modern values like multifunctional items and space saving solutions.
TITLE: A Look At Ikeaâ€™s Latest Designer Collaboration

SUMMARY:
My Wind-Down Ritual When I was younger I was always able to survive on not much sleep or irregular sleep.
Presenter, world traveller, Strictly Come DancerIs Treating Myself The Same As Self Compassion?
My understanding of self-compassion has changed dramatically in the last three months or so.
Up until I really started learning about it, I believed that self-compassion and treating myself were the same thing.
I enjoy the process - no I love the process - as much as the end result.
TEXT:
My Wind-Down Ritual When I was younger I was always able to survive on not much sleep or irregular sleep. But being a junior doctor working night-shifts in my late 20s, was the first time I realised the link between sleep and how it affects my health and the way I feel. Doctor, GP, media personality and fitness expert

How To Fall In Love With A City I travel all the time - mainly for work and chances are a city will feature - even if I am going to the countryside or some far-flung destination - because cities are portals to lots of different places. Presenter, world traveller, Strictly Come Dancer

Is Treating Myself The Same As Self Compassion? My understanding of self-compassion has changed dramatically in the last three months or so. Up until I really started learning about it, I believed that self-compassion and treating myself were the same thing. They're not. There's a world of a difference between the two. Self-compassion is defined by two key features: Sunny Spells and Scattered Showers

Bullet Journalling Isn't Just About Organising My Life, It's Like Therapy For Me What has surprised me the most is how much I've enjoyed time to create and decorate my pages to make them look nice. So many people have commented on how much effort it must take to manually create a diary and if that's what you're thinking then it's 100% not for you. I enjoy the process - no I love the process - as much as the end result. Life Writer, HuffPost UK
TITLE: Downtime

TEXT:
Deux fois par semaine, j'accompagne Chichi (mon fils, NDLR) Ã  son cours de judo. Avant que le cours commence, les enfants ont toujours un peu de temps pour se dÃ©fouler sur le tatami. Cette annÃ©e, mon tout-petit est dans le cours 1. Fini le baby judo. Je pensais que les Ã©lÃ¨ves seraient moins nombreux et plus disciplinÃ©s aussi. Pourtant, ils sont plus de 40 Ã  assister au cours et il y a quelques Ã©lÃ©ments absolument pas disciplinÃ©s.

Durant ce moment dÃ©fouloir oÃ¹ les enfants courent dans tous les sens comme des fourmis affolÃ©es, je suis souvent attristÃ©e de constater toute la violence qui Ã©mane de certains enfants. Il y a ceux qui sautent Ã  3 ou 4 sur un seul enfant, celui qui fait semblant de donner des coups de pied Ã  tout le monde, ceux qui tapent sur la tÃªte des autres ... Peu sont ceux qui s'excusent aprÃ¨s avoir fait mal, mÃªme pendant un petit combat d'entrainement. Il y en a, mais pas assez. Si pendant le cours de judo, le coach est trÃ¨s attentif aux vilains gestes et au manque de respect, avant le cours les enfants font un peu ce qu'ils veulent, sous le regard des parents qui restent.

Je ne vais pas vanter le comportement de Chichi, des dÃ©fauts il en a beaucoup, mais quand il fait mal, il est gÃªnÃ© et il s'excuse. Bien qu'Ã  la maison il puisse Ãªtre trÃ¨s agressif envers son frÃ¨re, sa soeur et parfois mÃªme moi (surtout en ce dÃ©but de CP d'ailleurs), sur le tatami, je ne l'ai jamais observÃ© faire mal volontairement Ã  un autre enfant. Quand il explose (mÃªme Ã  la maison), c'est qu'on l'a bien cherchÃ© avant (ou qu'on l'a fortement frustrÃ©).

Depuis que son meilleur copain ne fait plus de judo, il est un peu moins Ã  l'aise. Heureusement, il y retrouve plusieurs filles de son Ã©cole qui dÃ©butent ce sport cette annÃ©e. Cela le rassure. Ce sont des filles bien motivÃ©es qui Ã©coutent et se donnent Ã  fond dans les minis combats.

Chichi discutait tranquillement avec 2 copines en attendant que le cours dÃ©bute quand un garÃ§on arrive en courant et le pousse fort avec ses 2 mains vers l'avant. Mon tout-petit ne s'y attendait absolument pas. Vue des gradins, la scÃ¨ne m'a paru violente et mon instinct de maman louve a fait un bond. Chichi s'est retrouvÃ© assis sur le tatami et retenait ses larmes. Il m'a avouÃ© que cet acte lui avait donnÃ© envie de quitter le cours et de ne plus jamais revenir. AprÃ¨s avoir poussÃ© Chichi, le petit garÃ§on s'est tournÃ© vers les gradins.

Son pÃ¨re Ã©tait assis presque Ã  cÃ´tÃ© de moi, mais Ã§a, je ne le savais pas. Je ne sais pas s'il voulait voir la rÃ©action de son pÃ¨re ou s'il savait que j'Ã©tais la maman, mais j'ai captÃ© son regard et du haut des gradins, je lui ai bien fait comprendre ma dÃ©sapprobation face Ã  son geste. Je ne l'ai pas lÃ¢chÃ© durant plusieurs minutes et lui me regardait, tranquille. Le pÃ¨re n'a pas bronchÃ©, mÃªme quand j'ai prononcÃ© le prÃ©nom de son fils. Il Ã©tait trop occupÃ© sur son smartphone.

Ce jour-lÃ , il y a un nouveau qui a tapÃ© dans le dos de 3 enfants dont Chichi, comme Ã§a, sans raison. Un autre que Chichi cÃ´toie Ã  l'Ã©cole qui lui a fait une pichenette sur le nez. La derniÃ¨re fois, le garÃ§on avec qui il faisait un combat lui a tapÃ© sur la tÃªte simplement pour s'amuser.

La derniÃ¨re fois, le coach a dÃ» rappeler les notions de respect et d'humilitÃ©, je crois qu'il va devoir rappeler d'autres notions importantes en judo Ã  tous ces enfants surexcitÃ©s. Bizarrement, ce sont toujours des garÃ§ons, jamais des filles.

Vous aussi vous constatez cette violence chez les enfants?

(Le nom de l'auteur a Ã©tÃ© modifiÃ© Ã  sa demande)

SUMMARY:
A market trader banned from selling Knights Templar crusader mugs over fears they could offend Muslims has been invited to crunch talks with council officials, who look set to offer a reprieve.
Vintage book seller Gayle said she had been told the council â€œhad a complaint that the mugs might be offensive to Muslimsâ€.
But now the council appears to have re-considered its approach, summoning Gayle for a meeting with market bosses next week.
Gayle said she had been told the council â€œhad a complaint that the mugs might be offensive to Muslimsâ€.
â€œWe did receive a complaint because someone was offended by the mugs, but we do not find the mugs offensive.
TEXT:
A market trader banned from selling Knights Templar crusader mugs over fears they could offend Muslims has been invited to crunch talks with council officials, who look set to offer a reprieve.

Tina Gayle received an official rebuke and a ban over the coloured printed cups which Charnworth Council in Leicestershire said â€œbreached trading rulesâ€.

Vintage book seller Gayle said she had been told the council â€œhad a complaint that the mugs might be offensive to Muslimsâ€.

SWNS.com Tina Gayle was left dumbfounded by the council's decision

A letter stated she was in breach of trading terms and conditions and had to leave her pitch of three years at Loughborough Vintage Market.

The mugs, also stamped with the Christian chivalric orderâ€™s Latin motto which translates as: â€œNot to us Lord, not to us, but to your name give the gloryâ€, brought a single complaint.

But now the council appears to have re-considered its approach, summoning Gayle for a meeting with market bosses next week.

(Tina Gayle/PA)

The council said it had â€œgot this one wrongâ€, and apologised for the way it handled the matter.

In a statement, it added it was the fact the mugs were not vintage which had been at issue, but this fact had been communicated â€œpoorlyâ€ to Ms Gayle.

Gayle, 57, from Didcot, Oxfordshire, who also travels the country selling Second World War vintage books, said she was â€œappreciativeâ€ for the councilâ€™s change of approach.

â€œIâ€™ve been summoned to a meeting with the markets manager on Thursday. They havenâ€™t apologised to me directly, but have called me to that meeting,â€ she said.

â€œIâ€™m very optimistic.

â€œBut I realise itâ€™s a very big thing for the council to issue a public apology and Iâ€™m appreciative.

â€œShould I be offered my pitch back, Iâ€™ll obviously be very happy.â€

(Tina Gayle/PA)

Her ban had come in the form of a letter handed to her on October 6, after a previous run-in over the sale of some mugs bearing Second World War-era Nazi symbols.

Gayle said she had been told the council â€œhad a complaint that the mugs might be offensive to Muslimsâ€.

She added: â€œThe person who complained wasnâ€™t offended himself, but thought Muslims might be.

â€œIâ€™ve never had a Muslim come into my stall and say they were offended by the mugs.â€

However, Gayle said she has â€œno bad feelingsâ€ towards the council, and understood it had been put in a â€œdilemmaâ€.

The council had previously formally told Gayle to stop selling mugs bearing what it described as â€œNazi symbolsâ€ in August or new items which may cause offence, following a separate complaint.

Market authorities then received the complaint about the Templar mugs, and when Gayle refused to remove them from sale, she was banned.

In a statement reported by the Press Association, the council said: â€œFirstly, we would like to apologise. We are open and honest enough to say we got this one wrong.

â€œWe did receive a complaint because someone was offended by the mugs, but we do not find the mugs offensive.

â€œOur main issue was that it is a vintage market and these items were new when we only want vintage or used items on sale.

â€œWe communicated that poorly to the trader and we will be reviewing how this happened to learn lessons for the future. We will also be speaking to the trader involved.
TITLE: Knights Templar Crusader Mugs Trader Set For Crunch Council Meeting As Officials Backtrack

SUMMARY:
The film, Toilet: Ek Prem Katha, is a commercial film in support of governmental campaigns to improve sanitation in India.
India has a huge population and a major lack of accessible toilets â€“ both in private households and in public spaces.
Clearly, women have specific sanitation needs, for instance, related to menstrual hygiene.
With millions of new toilets, more sanitation workers will be needed to carry out faecal sludge management.
Indeed, the conditions for such workers are often appalling â€“ the media regularly reports on the deaths of sanitation workers who have entered sewers without any protective gear.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

"Lovers built the Taj Mahal for their love. But I couldn't build a loo." So says Keshav, the lead character of a new Bollywood movie, after his wife leaves him for failing to build a toilet in their home. The film, Toilet: Ek Prem Katha, is a commercial film in support of governmental campaigns to improve sanitation in India.

Access to sanitation has attracted more attention in India over the past few years thanks to the Swachh Bharat Mission (Clean India Mission). Launched in 2014, this project seeks to make the country free of "open defecation" â€“ the practice of defecating outside â€“ by 2019. The effort follows the Supreme Court of India which recognised sanitation as a fundamental right in the 1990s, and the UN General Assembly following suit much more recently in recognising sanitation as a distinct human right.

The project will be an immense challenge for India, which was responsible for 60% of the world's open defection five years ago. This is particularly a problem in the country's large rural areas. India has a huge population and a major lack of accessible toilets â€“ both in private households and in public spaces. Roughly half of the rural population are estimated to lack proper access to sanitation. In rural areas, people often go to remote fields to relieve themselves â€“ separate for men and women.

To reach the 2019 goal, the country will need both behaviour change and new infrastructure to succeed. As of now, India appears to be headed towards ensuring that every house has an individual toilet in the next couple of years. But this will only be an important first step in a series needed to ensure the country has interventions covering all dimensions of sanitation.

One of the most important challenges will be to build community and public toilets. In a number of places, community toilets are necessary because building individual toilets at home may not be feasible, for instance, because of lack of space. Also, they are necessary for people without a house, such as homeless people and migrant workers.

The need for community toilets is already recognised as part of current sanitation interventions but is often not implemented. And local authorities often lack the funds to pay someone to undertake the cleaning of the facilities once built.

Attitudes to gender and caste

India has to be careful so that the project does not interfere with its efforts to boost gender equality. Historically, campaigns pushing for more toilets to be built often cite the modesty of women as the main reason â€“ toilets after all prevent women from exposing themselves in public.

This is also problematic as it places the burden of adjustment on women. Indeed, in many households that have built toilets, men do not even necessarily use them. This links with the broader issue of people resisting the introduction of toilets per se.

The regressive nature of such campaigns is now officially recognised with new governmental guidelines urging a rethink of behaviour-change tactics). Yet, much more needs to be done. As long as it is men who plan for toilets, the needs of women are either subsidiary or not taken into account at all.

Clearly, women have specific sanitation needs, for instance, related to menstrual hygiene. This needs to be fully integrated into any goals to boost sanitation â€“ a challenge in a country where periods are associated with shame. Schemes for the provision of sanitary products constitute a definite step forward, but these are limited and environment-friendly disposal facilities and awareness campaigns are even more limited.

Attitudes to caste matter, too. Sanitation work is a very sensitive issue in India because it is mainly carried out by the lowest caste, Dalit â€“ once called "untouchables". People from this caste even carry out manual scavenging, the inhuman practice of manually collecting human excrement from dry latrines to clean them â€“ despite the fact that the practice is prohibited by law.

With millions of new toilets, more sanitation workers will be needed to carry out faecal sludge management. This will be difficult, as such jobs are stigmatised. Indeed, the conditions for such workers are often appalling â€“ the media regularly reports on the deaths of sanitation workers who have entered sewers without any protective gear.

Clearly, one of the challenges India is facing is addressing this social stigma to make sanitation work an acceptable and safe career that is not reserved for a specific group in society. Mechanisation of the process could go some way to help ensure that workers do not need to enter the sewers.

Environmental threat

There are also risks to the environment. At present, the toilets that are built are mostly single pit latrines that will need to be emptied at least once every few years. Where the pits are lined at the bottom, the septage will need to be pumped out more regularly, and there need to be measures in place to ensure that it is not simply disposed of in neighbouring fields or rivers.

Where the pits are not lined, one of the concerns is the impact on groundwater quality. In the state of Kerala, where most houses have an unlined pit on one side of the house and a well used for drinking water on the other side, this is a particular problem. In a context where groundwater is the source of drinking water for around 80% of the population in India, the building of so many new toilets needs to be carefully planned.

Overall, the major progress that has been witnessed in access to sanitation over the past few years is a first step forward. It needs, however, to be linked to a series of other actions and an awareness of the social and cultural dimensions of sanitation. Without this, the country is unlikely to achieve full success.

Philippe Cullet, Professor of international and environmental law, SOAS, University of London

This article was originally published on The Conversation. Read the original article.
TITLE: India's Ambitious Plans To Achieve Sanitation For All Must Look Beyond Building Individual Toilets

SUMMARY:
Former Ukip donor Arron Banks has come under fire from Labour MPs Jess Phillips and Stella Creasy after he attempted to â€˜mansplainâ€™ sexual harassment to a female journalist.
Reacting to a photo of the A-Listers together, Merrick explained: â€œItâ€™s not that straight forwardâ€.
â€œI feel better when men donâ€™t sexually assault or harass women,â€ Strictly Come Dancing star Susan Calman wrote.
pic.twitter.com/tSzNANBckU â€” frances Barber (@francesbarber13) October 12, 2017Thank heavens for all these men, telling us how we should handle sexual harassment.
â€” Dawn Foster (@DawnHFoster) October 13, 2017men: why didn't you speak outwomen: we are speaking outmen: we didn't mean like that pic.twitter.com/f29Nl7RqXN â€” Matthew Champion (@matthewchampion) October 13, 2017
TEXT:
Former Ukip donor Arron Banks has come under fire from Labour MPs Jess Phillips and Stella Creasy after he attempted to â€˜mansplainâ€™ sexual harassment to a female journalist.

Banks, who ploughed more than a million pounds into the party before being suspended in March, caused a Twitter storm when he accused journalist Jane Merrick of â€œa lack of characterâ€ over the way she dealt with harassment from a politician.

The 51-year-old co-founder of the Leave.EU campaign took a swipe at Merrick, editor of The Spoon and a columnist for The Independent, after she claimed she had been forced to â€œsmile and interview a senior Tory who previously lunged at meâ€.

Her statement came amid a wider debate about sexism in Hollywood, with Merrick defending Emma Thompson against claims the actress had condoned the behaviour of media mogul Harvey Weinstein.

Reacting to a photo of the A-Listers together, Merrick explained: â€œItâ€™s not that straight forwardâ€.

But Banks hit back, explaining how she should have dealt with her harasser.

Arron Banks

In a spat that followed, the millionaire dismissed Merrickâ€™s claims that speaking out about the incident could have damaged her career, saying: â€œWhen you confront people and speak the truth you always feel better.â€

Arron Banks

Arron Banks

Banksâ€™ comments sparked widespread controversy online, garnering biting criticism from Labour MP Jess Phillips.

â€œYou are a privileged idiot who knows nothing about being silenced,â€ she wrote.

â€œSome of us fight with our guts, not our money.â€

Jess Phillips

Her views were mirrored by fellow politician Stella Creasy:

Stella Creasy

Other writers, comedians and activists were also quick to slam Banksâ€™ attempts at telling women his best practice tips.

â€œI feel better when men donâ€™t sexually assault or harass women,â€ Strictly Come Dancing star Susan Calman wrote.

â€œOr patronise them. Or blame them.â€

I know who lacks character: men who harass women and the men who excuse it by blaming women for not "confronting" them â€” Claire Phipps (@Claire_Phipps) October 12, 2017

Just what @janemerrick23 and others need right now, a big dose of mansplaining ğŸ™„ CC @jessphillips â€” Mr Benn (@_SpecialBL) October 13, 2017

@janemerrick23 lovely company he keeps. He wants all women to shut up. pic.twitter.com/tSzNANBckU â€” frances Barber (@francesbarber13) October 12, 2017

Thank heavens for all these men, telling us how we should handle sexual harassment. With their expertise everything now seems so simple! â€” Hadley Freeman (@HadleyFreeman) October 13, 2017

Re @janemerrick23's story, the one time I complained about being harassed at an old job, I was told to avoid post-work drinks. â€” Dawn Foster (@DawnHFoster) October 13, 2017

men: why didn't you speak out

women: we are speaking out

men: we didn't mean like that pic.twitter.com/f29Nl7RqXN â€” Matthew Champion (@matthewchampion) October 13, 2017
TITLE: Arron Banks Chastised By Jess Phillips And Stella Creasy For 'Mansplaining' Sexual Harassment Etiquette

TEXT:
Liebe (Ã¤ltere) Dame im Zoo,

Mein Name ist Katarina und ich bin die Mutter der niedlichen Zwillinge und der tollen groÃŸen Schwester, die Sie letztens im Zoo angesprochen haben. Eine Sache wollte ich Ihnen noch unbedingt sagen, aber sie haben mich nicht zu Wort kommen lassen.

Sie sprachen mich einfach an, obwohl Sie sahen, dass ich mit meinem Mann und den Kindern im GesprÃ¤ch war. Dies war Ihnen augenscheinlich nicht bewusst, als sie uns mitten im Satz unterbrachen und fragen, ob die Zwillinge denn eine natÃ¼rliche Geburt gewesen wÃ¤ren. (Nein, wobei Geburt ist Geburt finde ich, schmerzlos ist das auch nicht.)

"NatÃ¼rlich war sie das!" implizierten Sie sofort und sprachen ohne Punkt und Komma weiter. Wie schmerzhaft es denn genau gewesen wÃ¤re, wie lange die Geburt gedauert habe und ob denn alles gut gegangen sei.

Ehrlich gesagt konnten wir es gar nicht fassen

Mein Mann und ich starrten verlegen uns und neben uns das Schild "GroÃŸer Rundgang" an. Wir versuchten, uns freundlich zu verabschieden, aber da hatten Sie schon die HÃ¤nde in unseren Kinderwagen verkrallt und plapperten ungeniert weiter. Ob es denn Geburtsverletzungen gab und ob die Kinder FrÃ¼hchen gewesen wÃ¤ren.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Brief einer Mutter an ihre 5-jÃ¤hrige Tochter: Ich mÃ¶chte, dass du diese 13 Dinge niemals tust

Ehrlich gesagt konnten wir es gar nicht fassen. Sie wurden von Minute zu Minute distanzloser und selbst als wir langsam den Kinderwagen versuchten wegzurollen, krampften sich ihre Finger nur noch fester um den Griff.

(Folgendes Video kÃ¶nnte euch auch interessieren; der Text geht darunter weiter:)

Ein Hirnforscher erklÃ¤rt: Wie Eltern ihren Kindern den wichtigsten Aspekt ihrer Kindheit stehlen

Liebe Ã¤ltere Dame,

ich verstehe, dass Sie das Thema bestimmt brennend interessiert. ABER es geht sie verdammte Sch.... nichts an! Egal was ich Ihnen antworten wÃ¼rde.

ES GEHT SIE NICHTS AN!

Es macht mich wahnsinnig, dass wir anscheinend ein Magnet fÃ¼r distanzlose Menschen sind. Denn Sie sind ja nicht alleine, sondern wir treffen viele Menschen, die so sind wie Sie.

Es greift furchtbar ins Privatleben ein

Unsere Bankberaterin, die, bevor wir uns richtig sortiert hatten, erstmal fragte, wie viele Kilo ich denn in der Schwangerschaft zugenommen hÃ¤tte. Oder die beiden Damen hinter mir in der Kassenschlange, die darÃ¼ber philosophierten, ob wir denn dem Irrglauben aufgesessen wÃ¤ren, dass Stillen eine VerhÃ¼tungsmethode wÃ¤re oder ob wir schlicht nicht aufgepasst hÃ¤tten, wie das mit dem Kinder machen funktioniert.

Ich verstehe wirklich, dass Sie alle Fragen haben.

Aber dann fragen Sie Ihren Partner oder den Brockhaus/Wikipedia/ihren Allgemeinmediziner oder schauen Sie in die "Apotheken Umschau". Weder ich noch mein Mann MÃ–CHTEN uns mit Ihnen zwischen Tiergehegen im Zoo, im Supermarkt neben Margarine und KitKat oder in einer Bank zwischen AnzugtrÃ¤gern Ã¼ber Details Ã¼ber unsere Familienplanung im weitesten Sinne und GeburtsvorgÃ¤nge im speziellen unterhalten. Es greift furchtbar ins Privatleben ein und hinterlÃ¤sst einen ein bisschen Ã¼berfahren und nackt.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Ein Hirnforscher erklÃ¤rt, was Kinder mehr als alles andere von ihren Eltern brauchen

Ich bin eine Person, die professionell eine Rampensau sein kann, aber ich bin so nicht, wenn ich mit meiner Familie im Privaten unterwegs bin.

Liebe Ã¤ltere Dame,

vielleicht wird das ganze fÃ¼r Sie nachvollziehbar, wenn ich Ihnen noch ein paar Fragen stelle:

Haben Sie eigentlich Probleme mit Ihrer Blase? Schaffen Sie es noch immer bis zur Toilette, oder geht auch ab und zu was daneben? Bestimmt, oder? Wie Ã¤rgerlich.

Aber Sie tragen doch bestimmt Inkontinenzeinlagen? Vielleicht sind es auch schon Windeln. Welche Marke kÃ¶nnen Sie denn da empfehlen? Ist der Mann dort hinten Ihrer? Ja?

Wie, auf die Fragen wollen Sie gar nicht antworten?

Sagen Sie mal, Sie wirken noch recht fit, haben Sie und ihr Mann noch manchmal... na Sie wissen schon? Ist das nicht merkwÃ¼rdig, nach so vielen Jahren?

Ja, wir stehen mitten in einem belebten Zoo am Nachmittag, wieso schauen Sie sich denn so um? Ist doch vÃ¶llig in Ordnung, sowas zu fragen.

Wissen Sie, ich bin Mutter und nicht meine Kinder sondern andere Menschen sorgen dafÃ¼r, dass meine Schamgrenze drastisch gesunken ist. Wie, auf die Fragen wollen Sie gar nicht antworten? Zu privat sagen Sie?

Na sowas.

Der Beitrag erschien zuerst bei "Blogprinzessin", dem Blog der Autorin.

____

Ihr habt auch ein spannendes Thema?

Die HuffPost ist eine Debattenplattform fÃ¼r alle Perspektiven. Wenn ihr die Diskussion zu politischen oder gesellschaftlichen Themen vorantreiben wollt, schickt eure Idee an unser Blog-Team unter blog@huffingtonpost.de.

SUMMARY:
Harvey Weinstein is facing more than 20 allegations of sexual misconduct, harassment and assault, and stories continue to trickle out.
But for some men, the takeaway from these allegations is that men should avoid meeting with women.
THINK:If Weinstein had obeyed @VP Pence's rules for meeting with the opposite sex, none of those poor women would ever have been abused.
â€œOn Wall Street, certain senior men have tried to avoid closed-door meetings with junior women.
When men decide to limit their interactions with women in order to â€œprotectâ€ women (and themselves), the only people who lose out are those women.
TEXT:
Harvey Weinstein is facing more than 20 allegations of sexual misconduct, harassment and assault, and stories continue to trickle out. The horrifying allegations have kicked off discussions about the way industries like Hollywood enable abuse, and the shame attached to the big and small violations women deal with on a daily basis. But for some men, the takeaway from these allegations is that men should avoid meeting with women.

Getty/Twitter Ding ding ding! We've found the dumbest take.

On Tuesday night, Seb Gorka, former Deputy Assistant to President Donald Trump, tweeted, â€œIf Weinstein had obeyed @VP Penceâ€™s rules for meeting with the opposite sex, none of those poor women would ever have been abused.â€ (Mike Pence has previously stated that he follows the â€œBilly Graham Rule,â€ and wonâ€™t eat a meal alone with a woman except for his wife or attend events where there is alcohol present without her.)

THINK:



If Weinstein had obeyed @VP Pence's rules for meeting with the opposite sex, none of those poor women would ever have been abused. pic.twitter.com/Kgl9FF7nam â€” Sebastian Gorka DrG (@SebGorka) October 11, 2017

This morning, conservative radio host Erick Erickson wrote a piece asking everyone to â€œrevisit Mike Penceâ€™s rule about meeting with women aloneâ€ in light of the Weinstein allegations. â€œMike Pence could never be accused of wanting to have sex with someone other than his wife in these sorts of situations because he avoids putting himself and the other person into these situations,â€ he wrote.

There are a few obvious problems with the suggestion that men must avoid being alone in a room (or at a restaurant table) with a woman in order to avoid committing sexual harassment â€• or at least avoid charges of harassment.

First, it implies that men are unable to control their own behavior when in the presence of a woman, and that men have no way of gauging the difference between a professional relationship and a sexual or sexually violating one. (Men, you deserve better than that! I believe in your ability to interact with a woman and not harass or assault her!) It also implies that when women agree to a one-on-one professional meeting with a man, they are putting themselves in harmâ€™s way â€• just a hop, skip and a jump away from â€œasking for it.â€

If you think being in the same room with a woman makes it hard to avoid raping or harassing her, perhaps you should stay home. Forever. pic.twitter.com/TN17d1asrN â€” Jessica Valenti (@JessicaValenti) October 11, 2017

Additionally, when men, who tend to still be the gatekeepers of any industry, decide that they must roll back spending time with their woman colleagues or employees, it can have real, lasting impact on those womenâ€™s careers.

A recent New York Times report looked at the ways powerful men across industries have begun scaling back their interactions with female colleagues because of a fear that they might end up facing harassment allegations.

â€œIn Silicon Valley, some male investors have declined one-on-one meetings with women, or rescheduled them from restaurants to conference rooms,â€ reported Claire Cain Miller. â€œOn Wall Street, certain senior men have tried to avoid closed-door meetings with junior women. And in TV news, some male executives have scrupulously minded their words in conversations with female talent.â€

Professional intimacy and relationship-building are key to advancing in any industry. Thatâ€™s how lower-level employees find mentors or sponsors, or find out about new professional challenges. People give opportunities and recognition to people they trust, and that trust is built through person-to-person interaction â€• both at the office and outside of it.

When men decide to limit their interactions with women in order to â€œprotectâ€ women (and themselves), the only people who lose out are those women.
TITLE: No, The Lesson Of Harvey Weinstein Isn't That Men Shouldn't Meet With Women

TITLE: Economy

SUMMARY:
It has followed a by-now familiar pattern:Step 1: A powerful man has a reputation in certain circles for predatory behavior toward women.
However, not every case of alleged sexual harassment or assault spurs mass anger, and not all that do translate into real consequences for the alleged perpetrator.
The same could be said about Bill Cosby, who has not (yet) received any legal consequences for the dozens of sexual assault allegations he faces, but whose legacy and reputation have certainly been destroyed.
This speaks to an ugly truth about our cultural â€œprogressâ€ when it comes to grappling with sexual harassment and assault.
Essentially, the village doesnâ€™t matter if a man is powerful enough to balance out the costs that might be incurred by keeping him around.
TEXT:
It takes a village to bring down a powerful creep.

A solitary accuser is seen as an opportunist, a gold-digger. Twenty accusers cannot be dismissed so easily. The Weinstein saga is a vivid illustration of the dreary principle that only a community can bring down a man who enjoys a certain kind of power.

It took more than 20 women in all for the full measure of Weinsteinâ€™s monstrousness to become known, women who came forward by name with allegations against the Hollywood producer that range from sexual harassment to rape. And thatâ€™s to say nothing of the several women who shared their stories with The New York Times and New Yorker anonymously. (Weinstein, via his representatives, has told the press that â€œany allegations of non-consensual sex are unequivocally denied by Mr. Weinsteinâ€ and that he considered these â€œrelationshipsâ€ to be â€œconsensual.â€)

Had it been a single accuser, Weinstein would not have been ousted from his own company. We can say this with some certainty because Ambra Battilana Gutierrez had gone to the cops with her story in 2015 and was only smeared in the tabloid press for her troubles. Even though the cops had audio in which the mogul admits to having groped Gutierrez, Weinstein was never charged.

A solitary accuser is seen as an opportunist, a gold-digger. Twenty accusers cannot be dismissed so easily. The Weinstein saga is a vivid illustration of the dreary principle that only a community can bring down a man who enjoys a certain kind of power. It has followed a by-now familiar pattern:

Step 1: A powerful man has a reputation in certain circles for predatory behavior toward women.

Step 2: After years of open secrets (and perhaps even individual stories trickling out in the press), a media outlet manages to report out the allegations, tying them all together.

Step 3: Social media signal boosts these allegations, and mass outrage ensues. The pressure leads to a loss of public standing or the loss of a job or maybe a lawsuit.

These high-profile cases signal a shift in womenâ€™s willingness to speak up about sexual harassment and assault, and the cultural reaction to such allegations. This can be attributed to a variety of factors: more transparency surrounding workplace protections, greater media attention to such incidents, and the way social media has changed how we consume and discuss those stories in the first place.

The contagiousness of social media responses can sometimes facilitate swift, sustained outrage. However, not every case of alleged sexual harassment or assault spurs mass anger, and not all that do translate into real consequences for the alleged perpetrator. (See: the President of the United States.) Even in this new era, it takes a critical mass of accusers and witnesses to bring a predatory creep toward the reckoning he deserves. And often the cries have to build up over years, until they are presented in one jarring exhibit.

After all, itâ€™s far simpler to ignore a lone allegation, and thereâ€™s far more room to argue over a singular voiceâ€™s credibility and motivations â€• all of which becomes more difficult when there are five or 15 or 60 eerily similar stories next to each other.

And yet, Trump has faced little-to-no recourse from his supporters and party, outside of some halfhearted condemnations. He was elected to the highest office in the nation. He has proceeded to institute policies that actively hurt women â€• like expanding the global gag rule, allowing states to withhold federal funding from Planned Parenthood, and rolling back protections for women workers and the birth control mandate.

On Monday, RNC chair Ronna Romney McDaniel told Wolf Blitzer that the allegations against Weinstein and Trump are â€œnot even comparable.â€

So, what explains this dissonance?

As Rebecca Traister pointed out in The Cut, Harvey Weinsteinâ€™s power in the entertainment industry was beginning to show signs of waning. The same could be said about Bill Cosby, who has not (yet) received any legal consequences for the dozens of sexual assault allegations he faces, but whose legacy and reputation have certainly been destroyed.

In contrast, Donald Trumpâ€™s star and political power were both on the rise when women began speaking out in large numbers about his allegedly inappropriate conduct. And because the allegations flooded out in the midst of a vicious presidential campaign, it became even easier for Trumpâ€™s supporters to convince themselves that the stories were lies, part of a plot by the unconventional candidateâ€™s many powerful detractors.

This speaks to an ugly truth about our cultural â€œprogressâ€ when it comes to grappling with sexual harassment and assault. We are willing to consider the validity of womenâ€™s narratives of sexual exploitation â€• but only when forced to, and often only when we feel distanced from or oppositional toward the alleged perpetrator.

Essentially, the village doesnâ€™t matter if a man is powerful enough to balance out the costs that might be incurred by keeping him around.

â€œThereâ€™s no evidence that America is unified about how serious and pervasive and damaging sexual violence is,â€ said Kristen Houser, Chief Public Affairs Officer for the NSVRC. â€œWeâ€™re happy to sit back in our seats and say, â€˜Oh gosh, thatâ€™s horrible,â€™ but we as a culture have not yet decided that [sexual violence or misconduct] is a deal breaker. The closer that the perpetrator is to us â€• either in reality or in terms of celebrity and hero worship â€• [it becomes more] difficult to reconcile those things with allegations of wrongdoing.â€
TITLE: Why (Some) Powerful Creeps Are Finally Starting To Face Consequences

The 20-minute footage featuring the American rock band taking to the road with US comedian Ken Jeong, was shared with fans on Facebook.
A script at the beginning of the video says: â€œWith the blessing of Chesterâ€™s family and his bandmates, we share this episode and dedicate it to the memory of Chesterâ€.
The video, which sees the band driving around LA singing a selection of their own hits as well as covers, was recorded in LA on 14 July - six days before the singer took his own life.
Story continues after the video...Carpool Karaoke is a spin-off web series of the popular segment on â€˜The Late Late Showâ€™, originally featuring James Corden.
The segment has seen many of the biggest names in music, including Adele, One Direction, Madonna and Justin Bieber, accompany the host as he drives around LA while singing along to their hits.
TEXT:
The 20-minute footage featuring the American rock band taking to the road with US comedian Ken Jeong, was shared with fans on Facebook.

A script at the beginning of the video says: â€œWith the blessing of Chesterâ€™s family and his bandmates, we share this episode and dedicate it to the memory of Chesterâ€.

The video, which sees the band driving around LA singing a selection of their own hits as well as covers, was recorded in LA on 14 July - six days before the singer took his own life.

Story continues after the video...

Carpool Karaoke is a spin-off web series of the popular segment on â€˜The Late Late Showâ€™, originally featuring James Corden.

The segment has seen many of the biggest names in music, including Adele, One Direction, Madonna and Justin Bieber, accompany the host as he drives around LA while singing along to their hits.

Earlier this year, Apple Music launched a new feature length version of the series with different celebrities standing in for the British actor and preseneter, who serves as executive producer.

Following the news of Chesterâ€™s death, James Corden told the Associated Press: â€œWe will approach it in whichever manner his family or the people that were involved in that episode, however they would like it to be handled.

â€œWe will navigate it as delicately as possible and just adhere to whatever wishes they would want because I donâ€™t think thereâ€™s any other way we could deal with it.â€

RIP: Stars We've Lost In 2017
TITLE: Linkin Park Release â€˜Carpool Karaokeâ€™ Featuring Chester Bennington, Filmed Days Before His Death

TEXT:
An die Frau im Zoo: Ist Ihnen klar, wie sehr Sie mich und meine Familie beschÃ¤mt haben? Sie sprachen mich einfach an, obwohl Sie sahen, dass ich mit meinem Mann und den Kindern im GesprÃ¤ch war. Dies war Ihnen augenscheinlich nicht bewusst, als sie uns mitten im Satz unterbrachen und fragen, ob die Zwillinge denn eine natÃ¼rliche Geburt gewesen wÃ¤ren. GrÃ¼nderin von "Blogprinzessin" und Mutter von drei Kindern

"Kinderkriegen ist in Deutschland ein MinusgeschÃ¤ft": Mehrkindfamilien sind heute existenzbedroht Als Professor, Fachbereichsleiter, Regisseur, Schauspieler, Autor und Filmemacher fÃ¼hre ich ein selbstbestimmtes wie schillerndes Leben mit weit Ã¼berdurchschnittlichem Verdienst - sollte man meinen. Professor fÃ¼r Schauspiel und fÃ¼nffacher Vater

Ich habe ein afghanisches MÃ¤dchen aufgenommen - und begriffen, was deutschen Kindern oft fehlt In der Schule sah ich, wie sie irritiert einen Jungen beobachtete, der kaum eine Banane schÃ¤len konnte. Sie hatte am Morgen vorher einen Granatapfel zerteilt, die Kerne aus den HÃ¤lften geklopft und im Wasserbad die Ãœberreste der Fruchtkammern von den Kernen gelÃ¶st. Journalistin, Elterntrainerin

"Ich fand den leblosen KÃ¶rper meines Vaters": Meine Kindheit in einer heroinsÃ¼chtigen Familie FrÃ¼her hat mich mein Bruder immer mitten in der Nacht geweckt, um gemeinsam Ninjas zu jagen. Im wahrsten Sinne des Wortes. Diese Zeit war etwas Kostbares fÃ¼r mich, ich fÃ¼hlte mich geehrt, weil er mich an diesem Spiel teilnehmen lieÃŸ. AnekdotenerzÃ¤hlerin, Domestically Challenged

Ich bin keine schlechte Mutter, nur weil ich arbeiten gehe - hÃ¶rt auf, mich dafÃ¼r zu verurteilen Ich will weder von einem Mann, noch vom Staat abhÃ¤ngig sein. Doch bei vielen MÃ¼ttern ist das die RealitÃ¤t. WÃ¼rden sie sich trennen, hÃ¤tten sie nichts. Sie haben jahrelang ihrem Mann den RÃ¼cken frei gehalten und sich dabei aufgegeben. Genau das wollte ich nie. alleinerziehende Mutter, Flugbegleiterin, Bloggerin

Brief an mein Kind: Du wirst dich nicht erinnern, aber ich werde es Du wirst dich nicht an die NÃ¤chte erinnern, in denen ich dich in den Schlaf getragen habe, aber ich werde es. Du wirst dich nicht an die Momente erinnern, an denen ich meine Nerven verloren habe - und den Raum kurz verlassen musste, um Luft zu holen, aber ich werde es. Mutter, Bloggerin

Noten machen viele Kinder krank - so kÃ¶nnen Eltern das verhindern SchÃ¤tzen Sie mal, wie hÃ¤ufig wir jede Woche wegen Problemen im Zusammenhang mit der Schulleistung kontaktiert werden! FÃ¼nf Mal? Zehn Mal? Mehr als 20 Mal? Genau! Mehr als 20 Mal klÃ¤ren wir jede Woche vermeintliche StÃ¶rungen im Zusammenhang mit Schulleistungen ab. Kinderarzt

"Was ich in der Beziehung zu meinem Mann am meisten vermisse, seit ich Mutter bin" Es ist nicht so, dass wir einander nicht mehr lieben. Es ist nur so, dass aus uns Liebenden Eltern wurden. Bevor wir Eltern wurden, hast du mich jeden Tag zum Abschied noch innig gekÃ¼sst, bevor du in die Arbeit gegangen bist. Journalistin und Bloggerin

Forscher vermuten: Stress wÃ¤hrend der Schwangerschaft kÃ¶nnte das Demenzrisiko beim Kind erhÃ¶hen Wie der Vater, so der Sohn, heiÃŸt es. Besser wÃ¤re: Wie die Schwangere, so ihr Kind. Denn was eine werdende Mutter isst, wie gestresst und Ã¤ngstlich sie sich fÃ¼hlt, prÃ¤gt sich in Gene und Gehirn ihres Babys ein - und beeinflusst es zeitlebens. Wissenschaftsjournalistin

Ich bin Mutter eines autistischen Kindes - das habe ich euch allen zu sagen Wenn Ihr erfahrt, dass bei einem Kind in Eurer nÃ¤heren Umgebung eine Autismus-Spektrum- StÃ¶rung von Seiten einer Fachstelle diagnostiziert wurde, so zweifelt diese Diagnose bitte nicht an! Bestimmt sind die Eltern einen langen und schweren Weg bis zu dieser Diagnose gegangen. Und bestimmt endete ihr Weg danach nicht. So war und ist das zumindest bei uns. Mutter einer Asperger-Autistin

Ich leide unter AngststÃ¶rungen - jetzt muss ich erleben, wie meine Tochter dasselbe durchmacht Es ist relativ frÃ¼h an einem Sommerabend, kurz nach Sonnenuntergang. Von meinem Bett aus bemerke ich den Schatten eines dÃ¼nnen Asts, der Ã¼ber die Ecke der Schlafzimmerwand tanzt. Combining the beauty of a high-end fashion magazine with the dynamic energy of the web

Diese unbÃ¤ndige Wut Die Natur hat es wohl schon ganz bewusst so eingerichtet, dass wir uns langsam an die Herausforderungen des Elternseins gewÃ¶hnen: Die ersten ZÃ¤hne kamen ohne Begleiterscheinungen, bei den zweiten bekamen wir die durchbrechenden BeiÃŸerchen durch AnhÃ¤nglichkeit und schlaflose NÃ¤chte zu spÃ¼ren bis die BackenzÃ¤hne von Fieber, Ãœbellaunigkeit und Durchfall begleitet durchbrachen. Familie, Abenteuerlust, Alltag

Schicksalsfrage â€Zwei Kinder wollen wir haben". â€Mindestens", war die Meinung des Vaters. Mir reichten eigentlich zwei. Aber lieber drei als eins - ein Einzelkind kam nicht in Frage. So starteten wir in unsere Familienplanung. Jetzt haben wir ein Kind, einen quietschfidelen Sause-Jungen, der uns unfassbar glÃ¼cklich macht, uns aber auch regelmÃ¤ÃŸig an die Grenzen des Belastbaren treibt. Familie, Abenteuerlust, Alltag

SUMMARY:
For hundreds of years, women and girls have been told ridiculous stories about the dangerous super powers they possess when they menstruate.
In a recent study involving nearly 100,000 girls in India, almost 50,000 did not know about menstruation until the first time they got their period.
Some girls are told they cannot participate in certain activities, and others are banished to sleep outside because of these damaging myths.
Women and girls around the world prove this myth wrong every single day.
Girls are doing incredible things â€” even when they don't have a toilet, or sanitary products, to help them manage their period.
TEXT:
A girls' club at the Zengoo primary school in Ethiopia discusses menstrual hygiene. The club was launched in October 2014 to tackle girls' dropout due to menstruation.

For hundreds of years, women and girls have been told ridiculous stories about the dangerous super powers they possess when they menstruate. But having a period is a very normal and healthy part of our lives. Despite this, menstruation remains a taboo topic in many settings, and the silence can be damaging.

What you don't know CAN hurt you.

In a recent study involving nearly 100,000 girls in India, almost 50,000 did not know about menstruation until the first time they got their period. Many girls think that they are dying or have a horrible disease the first time they menstruate, as the pain and blood cause confusion and worry.

Some girls are told they cannot participate in certain activities, and others are banished to sleep outside because of these damaging myths. Today, we're busting some of these crazy myths and getting the truth out there.

A group of women from Nepal, who just received UNICEF hygiene kits, learn about maintaining cleanliness during menstruation.

Walking behind someone who has their period might cause your teeth to break.

FALSE.

Not sure where this one came from. In some places in Malawi, people believe that if you are walking behind someone menstruating, there are pretty catastrophic dental consequences.

Showering when you have your period can stop you from having children.

FALSE.

In Afghanistan, some women are told that washing their genitals when they are menstruating can cause infertility.

If you touch a pickle when you have your period, you'll make it go rotten.

FALSE.

In different countries around the world, it is believed that women who menstruate have the power to poison or spoil food.

If you swim when you have your period, sharks will attack you.

FALSE.

If you swim in shark-infested waters, you're going to be at risk of a bite from our grey-finned friends â€” but that risk doesn't increase when you have your period.

Menstruation is dirty. Girls and women who have their period should be isolated.

FALSE.

Menstruation is a very healthy and normal part of life, but in some places, women are forced to sleep outside or banished to huts to keep them apart from other people and livestock. In Nepal, this practice is known as chaupadi.

When girls are close, they can "sync up" and have their period at the same time.

UNCLEAR.

Some research indicates it is true, but other research shows that is not the case. As a sister and female flatmate, I can vouch that synchronized periods do happen, but I would struggle to show you the proof.

Menstrual blood can kill.

FALSE.

In some communities in Burundi, it is thought that contact with a woman who has her period can be deadly for family members.

Girls are weaker when they menstruate.

FALSE.

Women and girls around the world prove this myth wrong every single day. Girls are doing incredible things â€” even when they don't have a toilet, or sanitary products, to help them manage their period.

You can actually consume more chocolate when you have your period, without taking in any calories.

This is actually a myth that we'd really like to think is true â€” so we're going to just go ahead and say "unclear." Next...

I can play an important role in breaking the damaging silence around periods.

TRUE!

Whether you get your period or not, you can play an important role in breaking the negative taboo associated with menstruation. Strike up a conversation, share a story, ask a question or simply just put it out there â€” #MenstruationMatters!

Philippa Lysaght represents water, sanitation and hygiene in UNICEF's public advocacy team.

Follow HuffPost Canada Blogs on Facebook

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: 10 Ridiculous Period Myths Faced By Girls Around The World

TEXT:
Las redes sociales, ese ente que se alimenta de la inmediatez, se ha volcado durante las Ãºltimas dos semanas en reclamos y condenas contra el productor de cine Harvey Weinstein, seÃ±alado por acoso sexual en Hollywood. Pero la respuesta de los miembros mÃ¡s destacados de la comunidad cinematogrÃ¡fica nacional no fue tan rÃ¡pida.

El llamado dream team mexicano tardÃ³ varios dÃ­as en reaccionar ante la noticia y, hasta el momento, ninguno ha fijado una postura clara en sus redes sociales sobre el tema de abuso sexual y violencia contra las mujeres, a pesar de que varios de ellos han trabajado con anterioridad para este productor.

El cinco de octubre el diario The New York Times publicÃ³ una investigaciÃ³n donde se revelan dÃ©cadas de abuso y hostigamiento sexual contra actrices y personal femenino de las empresas donde Harvey Weinstein es socio fundador junto a su hermano Bob Weinstein. En el reporte del diario estadounidense, la actriz Ashley Judd fue la figura mÃ¡s reconocida en compartir su experiencia de acoso sexual, pero con los dÃ­as se sumaron otras como Rose McGowan, Mira Sorvino, Asia Argento, Cara Delevingne, LÃ©a Seydoux, Gwyneth Paltrow y Angelina Jolie, por citar solo algunas.

La actriz Mira Sorvino fue protagonista de Mimic (1997), la cinta que le abriÃ³ las puertas de Hollywood a Guillermo Del Toro, producida por Dimension Films y Miramax, empresas de Harvey Weinstein. Ella ha hecho declaraciones para diversos medios y mÃ¡s recientemente para Time dijo "como Embajadora de buena voluntad de las Naciones Unidas y como madre no podÃ­a seguir en silencio".

A Guillermo del Toro, que actualmente estÃ¡ en plena promociÃ³n de su nueva pelÃ­cula, le tomÃ³ aproximadamente una semana opinar sobre el tema. RespondiÃ³ algunas preguntas en una conferencia de prensa en el London Film Festival, pero se limitÃ³ a hablar sobre su experiencia de trabajo con los Weinstein. MÃ¡s tarde aclarÃ³ en Twitter que sÃ³lo trabajÃ³ para Bob Weinstein y dedicÃ³ algunos RT al escÃ¡ndalo, uno de ellos de la actriz Mira Sorvino donde agregÃ³: "SobrevivÃ­ porque valientemente Mira se quedÃ³ conmigo".

May I say this (re: MIMIC): I got a chance to survive because Mira bravely stuck with me. Integrity, intelligence and honesty. https://t.co/Bbovrlouhg â€” Guillermo del Toro (@RealGDT) 12 de octubre de 2017

Rose McGowan, protagonista de pelÃ­culas como Scream (1996, Dimension Films) y Grindhouse (2007, The Weinstein Company) apareciÃ³ en la investigaciÃ³n de The New York Times como uno de los ocho casos de mujeres que sufrieron abuso pero llegaron a un arreglo monetario con los abogados del productor a cambio de su silencio. Esto no le impidiÃ³ a travÃ©s de los aÃ±os hacer declaraciones a medios o escribir mensajes en Twitter donde, sin mencionar nombres, expresaba su molestia. En los Ãºltimos dÃ­as, McGowan ha subido el tono de sus declaraciones e incluso arriesgÃ³ su acuerdo de confidencialidad al usar las iniciales del productor y escribir "HW me violÃ³".

En un mensaje de 2016 de esta red social, McGowan escribiÃ³, refiriÃ©ndose al por quÃ© las mujeres no denuncian cuando son violadas: "Porque mi Ex vendiÃ³ nuestra pelÃ­cula a mi violador para su distribuciÃ³n". Por aÃ±os, esta declaraciÃ³n ha sido ampliamente interpretada como una referencia a Harvey Weinstein, pero tambiÃ©n a su relaciÃ³n con el director de cine Robert RodrÃ­guez, con quien mantuvo un noviazgo de 2006 a 2009, perÃ­odo en el que filmaron los capÃ­tulos de Planet Terror y Death Proof para la pelÃ­cula Grindhouse, junto a Quentin Tarantino.

Al cierre de esta ediciÃ³n, Salma Hayek no se habÃ­a manifestado sobre el caso. La veracruzana, que es mÃ¡s activa en plataformas como Instagram, ha dedicado varios mensajes en el Ãºltimo mes para apoyar a las vÃ­ctimas del sismo en MÃ©xico, a los "Dreamers" de los Estados Unidos en la protecciÃ³n del DACA (AcciÃ³n Diferida para los Llegados en la Infancia) y, en Twitter, al DÃ­a de la niÃ±a. Pero hasta el momento no habÃ­a fijado una postura entre la comunidad cinematogrÃ¡fica con respecto a las declaraciones de sus compaÃ±eras actrices.

Las que sÃ­ se pronunciaron en contra de Weinstein son actrices como Meryl Streep, Judi Dench, Kate Winslet y Jennifer Lawrence, todas ellas colaboradoras del productor en varias pelÃ­culas y todas ellas ganadoras de un Oscar gracias a la influencia de Weinstein. Es mÃ¡s o menos el mismo caso de Salma Hayek, quien se lanzÃ³ a la fama en Estados Unidos dirigida por Robert RodrÃ­guez en pelÃ­culas como Del CrepÃºsculo al Amanecer (1996, Dimension/Miramax) y que recibiera su primera nominaciÃ³n al Oscar por Frida (2002, Miramax).

Diego Luna es otro actor que tambiÃ©n ha trabajado para los Weinstein, pero que tampoco habÃ­a externado una opiniÃ³n sobre el escÃ¡ndalo. Ã‰l obtuvo uno de sus primeros papeles protagÃ³nicos en Hollywood en Dirty Dancing 2: Havana Nights (2004, Miramax), donde su coestelar fue la actriz Romola Garai, alguien que tambiÃ©n ha declarado a los medios de comunicaciÃ³n haber sido vÃ­ctima del acoso del productor.

MÃ¡s recientemente, la actriz Eiza GonzÃ¡lez se abriÃ³ camino en Hollywood gracias a la adaptaciÃ³n para televisiÃ³n de Del crepÃºsculo al amanecer, interpretando el mismo papel que hiciera famosa a Salma Hayek en 1996. La serie tambiÃ©n es producida por Robert RodrÃ­guez para Miramax. AsÃ­ mismo, RodrÃ­guez dirigirÃ¡ a la actriz en su prÃ³xima pelÃ­cula Alita: Battle Angel. Ella escribiÃ³ un tuit, aunque sin mencionar directamente a Weinstein.

It's a scary world out there for women. In general. But the louder we speak less people will be able to get away with abuse in every level. â€” Eiza Gonzalez Reyna (@eizamusica) 12 de octubre de 2017

Es un mundo aterrador allÃ¡ afuera. En general. Pero mientras mÃ¡s alto hablemos, menos personas podrÃ¡n salirse con la suya en el tema del abuso en cada nivel.

Los que finalmente se animaron a compartir algo sobre este asunto fueron Alfonso CuarÃ³n y Gael GarcÃ­a Bernal y tambiÃ©n lo hicieron a travÃ©s de algunos RT. Los mexicanos no han abordado directamente el tema de abuso sexual ni han escrito un mensaje especÃ­fico en sus redes sociales que se pueda tomar como una postura oficial sobre este tema. TambiÃ©n hay que tomar en cuenta que tanto CuarÃ³n como Gael, e incluso Emmanuel Lubezki y Alejandro GonzÃ¡lez IÃ±Ã¡rritu, no tenÃ­an relaciÃ³n laboral con Harvey Weinstein.

Emma Thompson, con toda la razÃ³n. Es la crisis de la masculinidad de la que no hablamos. Urge discutirla en todos los niveles. https://t.co/gCCwAohZvF â€” Gael Garcia Bernal (@GaelGarciaB) 12 de octubre de 2017

La mayorÃ­a de las celebridades mexicanas han estado enfocando su comunicaciÃ³n de las Ãºltimas semanas a buscar ayuda para los damnificados del sismo del 19 de septiembre. Sin embargo, en un paÃ­s como MÃ©xico, donde en promedio mueren cinco mujeres al dÃ­a vÃ­ctimas de la violencia, fijar una postura en un caso de alto perfil como este, el acoso sexual de un productor tan influyente como Harvey Weinstein, tambiÃ©n debe encontrar espacio en los medios de comunicaciÃ³n nacionales y en la agenda de nuestras celebridades, para que la sociedad mexicana lo sienta como lo que es: algo cercano que nos afecta a todos, y no otra pelÃ­cula de Hollywood.

*Este contenido representa la opiniÃ³n del autor y no necesariamente la de HuffPost MÃ©xico.

Where disability is most frequently acted rather than authentic (the above played by Tom Burke and Richard Dormer respectively, both non-disabled actors).
TEXT:
My Life As A Midwife On A Rescue Ship During The Mediterranean Migrant Crisis Alice Gautreau is a midwife working with Medecins Sans Frontieres. In this exclusive vlog for HuffPost UK, Alice talks about her life-saving work on board the Aquarius refugee rescue vessel in the Mediterranean, and the incredible story of helping a woman give birth on board the ship. Medecins sans Frontiere midwife

Making Peace With My Hearing Loss "You have something in your ear," a small voice piped up from behind me at the playground. I heard the voice, but wasn't sure she was talking to me. "Excuse me," she repeated with some alarm, "do you know you have something in your ear?" She was pointing at my ears with surprise. Hearing health advocate, writer, LivingWithHearingLoss.com

Being A Daddy And Campaigning For Shared Parental Leave With our second baby on the way we looked closely, and very excitedly, at the shared parental leave situation, and set about doing our sums. Maybe I could take four months, and my partner take five, and we overlap in the middle? Maybe we could both be off for a chunk of time and make it work? Nope. Campaigner for shared parental leave. Arts professional. Father to Jack.

Prevention Rather Than Cure. Part One... Last week was my favourite week of the year people...no not Christmas. Guess again?! No, not international David Gandy appreciation week....It was National Eye Health Week! Finally, we get a week to preach about looking after your eyes so you don't end up with squiffy ones like mine. Comedian and writer.

What To Expect When You Are (Not) Expecting A Child With Cerebral Palsy William needs 24/7 care, but he loves being with people, whether they are children or 'grown-ups'. If you're (not) expecting a child with cerebral palsy you won't be expecting the feelings of relief, comfort and happiness when you see them build relationships with adults who want to help them as much as you do. Writer & Disability Campaigner

Life In A Wheelchair - The Questions You Always Wanted To Ask Naturally as a newly injured child, my thoughts didn't turn to mortgages or whether I would be able to get a job. At that time, I had no concept of just how expensive having a spinal cord injury could be. I had far more pressing concerns such as: Head of Bolt Burdon Kemp's spinal injury department

After The Tsunami Hit Thailand In 2004 I Couldn't Leave Those In Need Behind Every evening I taught art to the children on the camp, their drawings were harrowing and therapeutic at the same time. Their pictures initially were of bodies in water and people stuck up trees but soon evolved into happier scenes of elephants rescuing people, and families in their tents smiling. Founder of Acorn Overseas

Yes, I Take Full Responsibility For This Disease I Can't Control... It has crossed my mind many times that it would be much easier to just not tell people I have epilepsy. But there is always that chance of a seizure, and the risk of something going wrong - or someone doing something wrong - is reduced if we all talk about epilepsy a little bit more and encourage people with epilepsy to do more. If I've decided I can take the risk, you can too. Writer with a tongue-testing name. Condensing the world into frantic words.

Are Disabled Young People Being Set Up To Fail? The political party conference season is getting in full swing. Housing, the NHS, social care as well as Brexit are among issues prominent on the agendas at these annual political melting pots. But there's another one which deserves a higher level of attention and that impacts on hundreds of thousands of lives every day in the UK. CEO of Leonard Cheshire Disability. Previously managing director at RNIB Solutions. He is also a co-founder and trustee of Blind in Business.

People Think It's Extraordinary That I Work - But Disability Doesn't Have To Be A Barrier When I graduated from university in 2015, I was under the illusion that with a good degree and a strong CV due to all the volunteering that I'd done, I would find a job pretty quickly. This couldn't have been further from the truth. supporter Scope and Virgin Mediaâ€™s Work With Me campaign

Why Mexico Is Proof Anti-Abortion Laws Don't Work Since January, following President Trump's reintroduction of the Mexico City Policy (an Executive order that withholds American aid from health organisations that provide or even discuss abortion), that hostility has spiked, with abusive tweets filling our social media feeds. This vitriol directed at Mexican women is infuriating on so many levels and inaccurate on at least three. But while the temptation is either to howl in rage or dismiss it as 'just another tweet', these digital outbursts are symptomatic of the misinformation that persists around abortion and the stigmatisation of women who choose to end a pregnancy. Country director for Marie Stopes Mexico

Denied! Rejection - one of the harshest parts of life. If there is one experience that all we humans have faced in our life that would be the pain of rejectio... Katiâ€™s Chronicles: Imagine yourself locked inside your own body

If Universal Credit Rollout Continues, Foodbanks Won't Be Able To Catch Everyone Who Falls What we must not become is a charity safety net that catches people because our benefits system is fundamentally flawed. Not just for moral or ethical reasons, but because all of the evidence on Universal Credit leads us to believe that even with the enormous generosity of our donors and the hard work and sacrifice of our volunteers and staff, we will simply not be able to catch everybody who falls. Head of Media and External Affairs at The Trussell Trust

My Brittle Bone Condition Won't Stop Me Living Life To The Full My name is Samantha Renke and I am a Lancashire-born actress and public speaker who currently lives in east London. I am a former teacher and trustee for the brittle bone society. I have a genetic condition called osteogenesis imperfecta, more commonly known as brittle bones condition which means I am a full-time wheelchair user, but this most certainly doesn't stop me from living life to the full. Actress and disability campaigner

UK Disabled Artists Lead The World, But For How Long? We live in a society where disability is still seen more frequently as a plot devise rather than simply part of the human condition (see autumn's new TV schedules with amputee Cormoran Strike in JK Rowling's Strike and acid-burned Gabriel Markham in Rellik). Where disability is most frequently acted rather than authentic (the above played by Tom Burke and Richard Dormer respectively, both non-disabled actors). Believing that 'differentâ€™ is delicious not divergent
TITLE: Impact
