SUMMARY:
Yet despite its relatively common occurrence, too many employer parental leave policies are not clear about what support is offered to the parents of a stillborn child.
Accessing paid parental leave recognises the birth of a child and the role of the parents.
Today, we are asking business leaders to make the following commitment: To review company parental leave policy to ensure that employer funded paid parental leave is available in the circumstance of stillbirth.
Making paid parental leave available when stillbirth occurs during the pregnancy is essential, regardless of whether the employee has already started their parental leave.
Such a change would also bring employer funded paid parental leave schemes in line with the Federal Government's Paid Parental Leave Act of 2010.
TEXT:
Stillbirth is one of the most traumatic events that a parent can face. Unfortunately, it is an event that is far too common, with six babies a day being stillborn in Australia. Yet despite its relatively common occurrence, too many employer parental leave policies are not clear about what support is offered to the parents of a stillborn child.

Today is International Pregnancy and Infant Loss Remembrance Day and we are calling on all business leaders to join us in committing to ensuring parents are covered by paid parental leave in the event that they lose a child.

Corporate parental policies need to be reviewed to ensure that a company extends paid parental leave in the case of stillbirth for the following reasons:

It removes additional financial pressure from the family during an already traumatic period as they would have anticipated having paid leave had it been a live birth.

Accessing paid parental leave recognises the birth of a child and the role of the parents.

It allows time for the female employee to physically and emotionally recover from the experience of birth.

A company would (or at least should) have already factored in the cost of parental leave for a live birth, so it does not effectively add to the company's costs.

The employee would not be fully effective if she had to return to work for financial reasons (a Stillbirth Foundation/PwC study into the economic cost of stillbirth indicates that productivity after a stillbirth is only at 26 percent after 30 days).

It is simply the right thing to do.

Today, we are asking business leaders to make the following commitment: To review company parental leave policy to ensure that employer funded paid parental leave is available in the circumstance of stillbirth.

Company policies should adopt the Australian definition of stillbirth, which is defined as the death of a baby before or during birth, from the 20th week of pregnancy onwards -- or 400 grams or more birth weight.

Making paid parental leave available when stillbirth occurs during the pregnancy is essential, regardless of whether the employee has already started their parental leave. After all, a parent is legally required to register the birth of a stillborn baby and yet also has to contend with organising a funeral for their own child, a burden that no parent should face. Access to paid parental leave is a way for a company to acknowledge their employee's loss, be it at 20-weeks gestation, full term of pregnancy or after birth.

Enshrining access to paid parental leave in the case of stillbirth into an employer's policy is key rather than relying on the discretion of managerial staff dealing with such a complex emotional issue. Given that paid parental leave is often cast as solely about caring for a baby, some managers might interpret paid leave not applying in the case of stillbirth, despite the best intentions of the employer. Having it clear in policy removes any doubt and sends a message that an employer recognises stillbirth as a social issue.

Such a change would also bring employer funded paid parental leave schemes in line with the Federal Government's Paid Parental Leave Act of 2010. Section 31(3) of this Act makes explicit that a person is eligible for the government funded paid parental leave scheme if they were to be the primary carer of the stillborn child.

Each of us in different ways has been touched by stillbirth. We are proud to support organisations like the Stillbirth Foundation, which invests in invaluable research into the causes of stillbirth and supports initiatives that will hopefully reduce the incidence of stillbirth. We are united in our view that it is critical to have policy initiatives such as this one to support parents facing one of life's most traumatic events.



This post was co-authored by:



Andrew McBride, who is the father of baby Hope and a manager at PwC.

Julie McKay, who is a Partner and Chief Diversity and Inclusion Officer at PwC.

Lynne Pezzullo, who is mother to heavenly daughter Gabrielle, the Lead Partner, Health Economics and Social Policy for Deloitte Access Economics and Managing Partner Canberra, Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu.

Diane Smith-Gander, who is Robert's aunty, a Non-Executive Director and Immediate Past President of Chief Executive Women.

_________________________________

If you would like more information or wish to participate in this campaign contact the Stillbirth Foundation Australia.
TITLE: Paid Parental Leave Should Include The Parents Of Stillborn Children

TEXT:
Diandra Forrest ist ein Model mit Albinismus

Sie ist das neue Gesicht fÃ¼r eine neue Make-Up-Kampagne fÃ¼r "Wet n Wild"

Damit ist sie das erste Model mit Albinismus, das in einer groÃŸen Werbe-Strecke zu sehen ist

Diandra Forrest hat mit 27 Jahren schon Bemerkenswertes vorzuweisen. Das Model war in mehreren Musikvideos von BeyoncÃ© zu sehen sowie auf dem Cover des "Ebony"-Magazins, das sich Ã¼berwiegend an afroamerikanische Leser richtet, und sie lief vergangenes Jahr Ã¼ber mehrere Laufstege der New York Fashion Week.

Jetzt schreibt die 27-JÃ¤hrige Geschichte als Gesicht einer Beauty-Kampagne von Wet n Wild. Damit ist Forrest das erste Model mit Albinismus, das bei einer groÃŸen Make-Up-Werbung zu sehen ist

Ein Beitrag geteilt von Diandra Forrest (@diandraforrest) am 10. Okt 2017 um 21:26 Uhr

Die Werbung wurde noch nicht verÃ¶ffentlicht, aber Forrest zeigte ihren Fans auf Instagram schon vorab eines ihrer Bilder.

Das Unternehmen mÃ¶chte mit der Reihe "Breaking Beauty", die Ende Dezember auf den Markt kommt, die Makel in den Vordergrund stellen, die wir nach Ansicht der Beauty-Industrie eigentlich lieber verstecken sollten.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: "Perfektion ist langweilig": Diesel traut sich etwas, das in der Mode lange als Tabu galt

Wet n Wild hat schon in der Vergangenheit Kampagnen mit Models gemacht, die nicht dem klassischen SchÃ¶nheitsideal entsprechen. Daher war Forrest besonders begeistert, mit der Marke zusammen arbeiten zu kÃ¶nnen.

"Du bist seltsam, du wirst nie ein Model werden"

Die gebÃ¼rtige New Yorkerin hatte selbst schon immer Probleme, wenn es ums Make-Up ging. "Wenn ich Make-Up kaufe, denke ich immer 'Haben sie meinen Hautton? Wird es an mir gut aussehen?'"sagte sie dem Onlineportal "Refinery29"."Ich muss die FarbtÃ¶ne immer mischen. Entweder sind sie zu dunkel oder viel zu hell."

Albinismus ist eine PimentstÃ¶rung, die sich auf Haut-, Haar- und Augenfarbe auswirken. Weltweit liegt die durchschnittliche Wahrscheinlichkeit von Albinismus bei 1:20.000.

Durch die ungewÃ¶hnliche Hautfarbe fÃ¤llt es vielen schwer, einen passenden Make-Up-Ton zu finden.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: "Ich hab mich noch nie schÃ¶ner gefÃ¼hlt": Diese Frauen zeigen mutig, was sie lange versteckt haben

Forrest wurde als Kind oft wegen ihres Aussehens gehÃ¤nselt und musste sich gegen Anfeindungen wehren - selbst, als sie beschloss, in die FuÃŸstapfen ihrer Mutter zu treten und Model zu werden.

Ein Beitrag geteilt von Diandra Forrest (@diandraforrest) am 31. Mai 2015 um 9:26 Uhr

"Ich hatte einen Model-Coach, als ich 14 oder 15 Jahre alt war", sagte sie "Refinery29". "Er war sehr gemein und sagte stÃ¤ndig Sachen wie 'Du bist zu seltsam, du wirst nie ein Model werden'." Das habe sie lange daran zweifeln, ob sie wirklich diesen Weg einschlagen sollte.

"Albinismus muss normalisiert werden"

Aber ihr Coach lag falsch: Forrest wurde bei einer groÃŸen Model Agentur unter Vertrag genommen - sie bekam viele Anfragen und AuftrÃ¤ge, die Kunden waren von ihr begeistert.

Forrest wollte Menschen mit Albinismus vertreten, hatte aber lange das GefÃ¼hl, dass es in der Mode-Industrie keinen Platz fÃ¼r sie gab. Vor allem, weil Models mit Albinismus oft als "mystisch" und "aus einer anderen Welt stammend" verkauft wurden.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Lange schÃ¤mte sie sich fÃ¼r ihr Aussehen - jetzt genieÃŸt sie es, wenn man sich nach ihr umdreht

Darum hat sie sich zum Ziel gesetzt: "Albinismus muss normalisiert werden. Ich mache das fÃ¼r mich und fÃ¼r alle anderen jungen MÃ¤dchen, die genau so aufwachsen mÃ¼ssen wie ich."

Ein Beitrag geteilt von Diandra Forrest (@diandraforrest) am 21. Jun 2017 um 13:28 Uhr

"Teil der Wet n Wild-Kampagne zu sein, ist fÃ¼r mich ein wahr gewordener Traum", sagte sie der HuffPost.

"Mein Ziel war schon immer, die Beauty-Standards neu zu definieren und auf Albinismus aufmerksam zu machen. Das Gesicht von einer so groÃŸen Marke zu sein, zeigt, dass SchÃ¶nheit keine Grenzen hat."

Dieser Artikel erschien ursprÃ¼nglich in der HuffPost US und wurde von Martina Zink aus dem Englischen Ã¼bersetzt und bearbeitet.

(lk)
TITLE: Model Diandra Forrest wurde frÃ¼her wegen ihres Aussehens gehÃ¤nselt - heute feiert sie den groÃŸen Durchbruch

SUMMARY:
Two former graduate students from Boston University have alleged that they were sexually harassed by BU professor Dr. David Marchant in the late 1990s during respective academic research trips to Antarctica.
According to Science, Jane Willenbring and Deborah Doe are speaking out because they no longer fear retribution.

â€œAnd I didnâ€™t.â€Sexual harassment is a pervasive issue in academia, with multiple universities like USC and UC Berkeley having settled complaints this year.
TEXT:
Two former graduate students from Boston University have alleged that they were sexually harassed by BU professor Dr. David Marchant in the late 1990s during respective academic research trips to Antarctica. The allegations came to light on Friday in a report for Science magazine.

According to Science, Jane Willenbring and Deborah Doe are speaking out because they no longer fear retribution.

Willenbring, who is now 40 years old and a tenured associate professor at the Scripps Institution of Oceanography, part of the University of California, San Diego, alleges in the complaint to the university that during a 1999 field visit to Beacon Valley, Marchant repeatedly harassed her. He reportedly encouraged her to sleep with his brother, who was also on the expedition; called her a â€œslutâ€ and a â€œliarâ€; and greeted her every morning by saying, â€œToday Iâ€™m going to make you cry.â€

â€œMost days, I would listen to long discussions about how I was a â€˜slutâ€™ or a â€˜whore,â€™â€ Willenbring wrote in the report.

Marchant also allegedly threw rocks at her whenever she urinated, so she would go days without drinking water, later developing a urinary tract infection. Toward the end of the trip he also is alleged to have repeatedly pushed her down an icy slope because she hadnâ€™t cried that day.

Most days, I would listen to long discussions about how I was a 'slut' or a 'whore.' Jane Willenbring

Doe, who opted to remain anonymous, reports that she too was victim to Marchantâ€™s harassment in the late 1990s, also on a trek to Antarctica.

Sheâ€™d initially written a letter of support for Willenbring, but turned that letter into her own formal complaint. â€œHe repeatedly called me a â€˜c**t,â€™ among many other insults ... (bitch being the most common) that were invoked on a daily basis or more ... He would crow that he could say absolutely anything he wanted to because we were â€˜in his domain,â€™â€ she said, according to Science. Doe also alleges that he threatened to ensure she never got funding if she were to finish her doctorate.

â€œI distinctly remember standing there, aghast, in my red down jacket and black wind pants, watching my career and life plans dissolve as Dr. Marchant smiled triumphantly at me,â€ she said.

YouTube Marchant in a BU feature on his Antarctica program.

Hillary Tulley, a high school teacher from Illinois who witnessed Marchantâ€™s behavior during a National Science Foundation-funded program called Teachers Experiencing Antarctica, wrote a letter supporting Willenbring and Doe in which she detailed her own experiences with Marchant.

Marchant apparently refused to take Tulley, who was the only woman on that particular expedition, seriously.

â€œTalk during [group] meals ... always included relentless, snickering mentions of my advanced age (I was 43), my small breasts, and other failings, always initiated by Marchant,â€ she wrote. â€œAll my attempts to steer the conversation to science were shut down.â€

Letters of support for both Marchant and his accusers have poured in. One of Marchantâ€™s former graduate students who had also traveled with him to Antarctica denies that the allegations align with his character.

â€œI ... sincere[ly] support ... him as an upstanding and professional individual,â€ the student wrote in an official letter of support.

But another former graduate student, Adam Lewis, wrote that not standing up for both Willenbring and Tulley is â€œone of the only real regrets I have in my whole life.â€ He had witnessed both of them being harassed on their separate expeditions.

â€œI had the chance to stand up for people,â€ he wrote. â€œAnd I didnâ€™t.â€

Sexual harassment is a pervasive issue in academia, with multiple universities like USC and UC Berkeley having settled complaints this year. A 2014 report also showed that scientific research field studies are particularly ripe for harassment â€• PLOS ONE, a scientific research journal, conducted a survey that showed 64 percent of respondents had personally experienced sexual harassment while doing field work, and the majority of those people were trainees at the time.

UPDATE: BU confirmed to HuffPost that Marchant is under investigation as per Title IX procedures, and Marchant did not respond to HuffPostâ€™s request for comment.
TITLE: Women Scientists Report Sexual Harassment On Boston University Expeditions

SUMMARY:
A college student who fled the deadly wildfire that swept through Santa Rosa, California, on Monday night would never leave her dog behind.
Fearing theyâ€™d be trapped in harmâ€™s way, she ran home and retrieved her bike â€” a mode of transportation that makes bringing along a 70-pound dog a lot more difficult.
Quick-thinking Wallace also got a duffel bag and, fortunately for both her and the dog, Bentley was compliant with her request that he get in.
Both Wallace and Ruiz have set up GoFundMe accounts to help them recover from losing their homes.
In Santa Rosa alone, where Wallace and Ruiz lived, nearly 3,000 homes were lost.
TEXT:
A college student who fled the deadly wildfire that swept through Santa Rosa, California, on Monday night would never leave her dog behind.

Natasha Wallace, who attends Santa Rosa Junior College, told news station KTXL that she was on her way home from studying across town at around 2 a.m. when she saw the flames in the distance and realized she and her pit bull, Bentley, needed to get out.

The pair quickly got stuck in traffic in Wallaceâ€™s car. Fearing theyâ€™d be trapped in harmâ€™s way, she ran home and retrieved her bike â€” a mode of transportation that makes bringing along a 70-pound dog a lot more difficult.

Quick-thinking Wallace also got a duffel bag and, fortunately for both her and the dog, Bentley was compliant with her request that he get in.

â€œI grabbed my dog and I told him, â€˜Hey man, this is serious, you need to just sit in the bag.â€™ ... And he, he hopped right in,â€ she told KTXL in the video above.

Wallace biked a few miles away from the traffic jam with the large canine slung across her back, when a man named Paul Johnson pulled his truck over and gave both of them a ride to safety.

Wallaceâ€™s story is the second dramatic bike escape widely reported in the wake of the fires. Multiple media outlets wrote earlier this week about Charity Ruiz, a pregnant woman fleeing Santa Rosa on Monday who also wound up stuck in traffic and fled on a bike, KPIX 5 reported.

Ruiz, who was scheduled to deliver her baby next week, biked away towing her two daughters in a small, attachable bicycle trailer. They also were ultimately picked up by a kind stranger who drove them to a friendâ€™s home.

Both Wallace and Ruiz have set up GoFundMe accounts to help them recover from losing their homes. You can read more about how to help other victims of the fires here.

The multiple wildfires that raged across Northern California this week are the deadliest in the stateâ€™s recorded history, with at least 32 people confirmed dead as of Friday. Hundreds of people remain missing, and rescue workers continue to search the charred rubble for bodies.

Officials assessing damage estimated on Friday that 5,700 structures had been destroyed across the state. In Santa Rosa alone, where Wallace and Ruiz lived, nearly 3,000 homes were lost.

More sad news! As damage assessment continues, latest estimates that 5,700 structures have been destroyed by the wildfires burning across CA pic.twitter.com/f3djAANIQg â€” CAL FIRE PIO (@CALFIRE_PIO) October 13, 2017

Daniel Berlant, assistant deputy director for the California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection, told HuffPost this week that climate change is creating an environment where wildfires become more intense and spread more quickly.
TITLE: Student Flees Wildfire On Bike Carrying 70-Pound Dog In Duffel Bag

It was so exciting to see new technology arising, with the possibility of measuring our heart rates, body temperatures and sleep patterns. Blogging my attempts at a healthy balanced lifestyle with IBD

Wearable Tech Is Coming to Town Christmas is approaching fast and with it, the unavoidable questions arise: what to buy for whom from where? What's on trend? What's worth investing in? This year, it looks like all people want for Christmas... is a wearable device. Think smartwatches and fitness and health trackers. Founder of fashion app ASAP54 where fashion meets tech. Brazilian living in London.

Wildlife Photographer of the Year 2014 at Natural History Museum The annual Wildlife Photographer of the Year competition is now in its fiftieth year. It is a global showcase of the very best nature photographs and I was absolutely blown away by the finalists on show in a stunning and moving display of their work at the Natural History Museum. Arts and Culture Blogger

Fitness Goal Goodies and Gym Bag Beauty Treats After the Easter scoff-fest, and as magazines begin to herald the latest way to get a 'Beach Ready Body' for Summer, minds may well be turning back to those abandoned gym resolutions. Here's my selection of gym bag beauty treats and all other manner of exercise carrots to help you get back on track with those fitness resolutions. Freelance copywriter and digital creative

Our Wonderful World, Carpe Pisces and Birdsong at Dusk We are fortunate in the UK to live in a very green and pleasant land. Much of our natural landscape is untouched, untamed and so old that I get entranced just looking at it. Author of the popular self-help manual 'How to be Happy, The Little Book of Peace (for your soul)' and 'Maestro'

The Blind Atheist, "Kiss Me as if it Were the Last Time!" And What Really Matters (Part Three) Our search for God is a hopefulness that we too might find ourselves. Go for a walk in any green landscape near you. You will see what atheists refuse to believe exists because they choose to be blind. Author of the popular self-help manual 'How to be Happy, The Little Book of Peace (for your soul)' and 'Maestro'

On Perfection, Planning and Losing Perfection In our facile society, perfection is glossy, fabricated, manipulated and made to order. Yet we are surrounded by unmistakably perfect momen... Author of the popular self-help manual 'How to be Happy, The Little Book of Peace (for your soul)' and 'Maestro'

TEXT:
CritiquÃ© pour son HLM parisien, Alexis CorbiÃ¨re s'Ã©nerve et se dit "exemplaire"

POLITIQUE - "Je n'accepte pas que des gens salissent mon honneur comme ils l'ont fait". InvitÃ© de l'Ã©mission "24h Pujadas" sur LCI jeudi 12 octobre, Alexis CorbiÃ¨re n'a pas cachÃ© son Ã©nervement concernant la polÃ©mique sur le logement social qu'il occupe depuis plusieurs annÃ©es Ã  Paris.

Depuis plusieurs semaines, Alexis CorbiÃ¨re et Raquel Garrido sont la cible des critiques Ã  cause du HLM qu'ils occupent depuis maintenant 6 ans, dans le 12e arrondissement de Paris. Alors sur LCI, Alexis CorbiÃ¨re a tenu Ã  mettre les choses au point, rÃ©futant les accusations selon lesquelles le couple "refusait" de quitter le logement.

"Je ne refuse rien, je suis en train de partir, je l'ai expliquÃ©. En l'espace de trois-quatre mois, partir avec une famille de 5 enfants, c'est quand mÃªme un dÃ©lai tout Ã  fait raisonnable. Je suis entrain de me porter acquÃ©reur", a-t-il affirmÃ©, prÃ©cisant qu'il avait trouvÃ© un bien dans sa circonscription de Seine-Saint-Denis.

Le dÃ©putÃ© a rappelÃ© qu'il occupait lÃ©galement l'appartement, et dÃ©noncÃ© "une provocation indÃ©cente organisÃ©e contre la France Insoumise". "C'est une chasse qui est menÃ©e. Ce n'est pas moi qui suis visÃ©, c'est La France insoumise, pour nous salir et j'en assez. Je le dis parce que je suis un homme d'honneur", a fustigÃ© le dÃ©putÃ©.

"Depuis le mois de juin, j'ai dit que je partais, je me suis mis en situation pour partir", a-t-il affirmÃ©, prÃ©cisant qu'il avait dÃ©jÃ  fait de part de ses intentions au journaliste qui l'avait interrogÃ© sur son logement, et accusant ce dernier d'avoir volontairement mis l'accent sur l'aspect polÃ©mique: "Je l'ai dit au journaliste qui a lancÃ© cette polÃ©mique mais Ã§a ne l'intÃ©ressait pas et ce qui l'intÃ©ressait, c'Ã©tait de lancer une attaque assez blessante contre moi."

Une information qu'a dÃ©mentie Buzzfeed, Ã  l'origine de l'article en question: "Au cours de la vingtaine de minutes que nous avons passÃ© au tÃ©lÃ©phone avec lui, le dÃ©putÃ© ne nous a pas dit qu'il Ã©tait en train d'acquÃ©rir un appartement. Il a prÃ©fÃ©rÃ© s'Ã©nerver, nous attaquer, nous accuser d'Ã©crire un Â«article commandÃ©Â» et deviser sur les 'dirigeants de grands mÃ©dias' qui vivent dans des HLM. Et c'est Ã  la fin seulement qu'il a fini par prÃ©ciser Â«qu'il Ã©tait en train de chercher un logementÂ», ce que nous avons Ã©crit au dÃ©but de notre article", affirme Buzzfeed, qui a publiÃ© l'intÃ©gralitÃ© de l'interview d'Alexis CorbiÃ¨re, aprÃ¨s son passage sur LCI.

Alors que de nombreuses voix s'Ã©lÃ¨vent dans l'opposition pour critiquer la position du dÃ©putÃ© FI, accusÃ© de prÃ´ner "l'exemplaritÃ© politique" dans son parti, sans s"y conformer lui-mÃªme, Alexis CorbiÃ¨re s'est dÃ©fendu: "Je suis exemplaire, David Pujadas", a-t-il tonnÃ©.

Ã€ voir Ã©galement sur Le HuffPost:
TITLE: CritiquÃ© pour son HLM parisien, Alexis CorbiÃ¨re s'Ã©nerve et se dit "exemplaire"

SUMMARY:
Mental health campaigners have called the reports â€œmisleadingâ€, telling HuffPost UK encouraging male friendship is key to improving the populationâ€™s mental health and reducing suicide rates.
Cal Strode, a spokesperson for the Mental Health Foundation, agreed that strong male friendships should be portrayed as a positive thing.
Men are also much less likely to talk openly with their friends about mental health problems,â€ he told HuffPost UK.
Instead of pitting friendships against romantic relationships, Relate counsellor, Gurpreet Singh said we should invest in both in order to improve our wellbeing.
Sometimes for example, thereâ€™s an element of camaraderie thatâ€™s more common in friendships,â€ he told HuffPost UK.
TEXT:
Historically, men have been told to be strong and silent, but new research suggests men are finally beating these outdated stereotypes and sharing their feelings with one another.

In fact, the study found that straight men find relationships with their male friends more emotionally satisfying than the bonds they have with their girlfriends.

In light of the research, articles have appeared online stating that the modern day â€˜bromanceâ€™ is threatening heterosexual partnerships, but this just isnâ€™t the case.

Mental health campaigners have called the reports â€œmisleadingâ€, telling HuffPost UK encouraging male friendship is key to improving the populationâ€™s mental health and reducing suicide rates.

Whatâ€™s more, relationship experts believe women should be encouraging their partners to develop close friendships, on the grounds that this could improve their own romantic relationship.

Ridofranz via Getty Images

The study, published in the journal Men and Masculinities, found that â€œthe increasingly intimate, emotive, and trusting nature of bromances offers young men a new social space for emotional disclosure, outside of traditional heterosexual relationshipsâ€.

â€œOur participants mostly determined that a bromance offered them elevated emotional stability, enhanced emotional disclosure, social fulfilment, and better conflict resolution, compared to the emotional lives they shared with girlfriends,â€ the researchers said.

In light of the study, some news outlets claimed bromances are â€œthreateningâ€ heterosexual relationships, but James Scroggs, chair of male suicide prevention charity CALM said â€œit can be misleading to start pitting bromance against romanceâ€.

Suicide remains the largest killer of men under the age of 45 in the UK and men are three times more likely to die from suicide than women. However, the latest statistics suggest suicide rates are falling and this is likely linked to the fact that weâ€™re becoming more open with one another about mental health and suicide.

â€œAt CALM, we work to prevent male suicide by challenging a damaging and outdated culture that prevents men from opening up and seeking help when they need it,â€ Scroggs told HuffPost UK.

â€œWhilst we note that the bromance research was conducted with a small number of participants and focused on men at university only, it does speak to the growing number of men who feel comfortable opening up to their friends.â€

He also pointed out that CALMâ€™s previous research, published with HuffPost UK in 2016, also showed that men are starting to talk to their partner or family about their feelings.

â€œIt is clear there is a steady and positive shift in peopleâ€™s attitudes and behaviours which enable men to open up, not bottle up their emotion, and therefore avoid reaching crisis point,â€ he said.

Cal Strode, a spokesperson for the Mental Health Foundation, agreed that strong male friendships should be portrayed as a positive thing.

â€œFrom our research we know that 28% of men living with a mental health problem had never sought medical help, compared to 19% of women. Men are also much less likely to talk openly with their friends about mental health problems,â€ he told HuffPost UK.

â€œMen often feel isolated and unable to tell people how they are feeling â€“ a culture of men shouldering pain alone has developed...we have a duty to question our culture and push for change.â€

He added that thereâ€™s a danger we can confuse being surrounded by a big group of people with friends â€œthat we can count on when weâ€™re really not doing okayâ€.

â€œMen having more friendships where they feel able to speak openly about their emotions and mental health can only be a good thing,â€ he said.

Instead of pitting friendships against romantic relationships, Relate counsellor, Gurpreet Singh said we should invest in both in order to improve our wellbeing.

â€œFriendships will often bring out a different side to us than a romantic relationship. Sometimes for example, thereâ€™s an element of camaraderie thatâ€™s more common in friendships,â€ he told HuffPost UK.

â€œWeâ€™ll also be friends with different people for different reasons, because they represent different parts of us. You can be friends with your partner but a â€˜couple relationshipâ€™ is also about meeting one anotherâ€™s romantic and sexual needs, sharing your life together and perhaps starting a family together.

â€œSpending time with friends, doing things that our partners may not necessarily enjoy, gives us an opportunity to pursue our separate interests and also creates a healthy breathing space in the relationship.â€

He pointed out that previous research by Relate found one in eight people in the UK say they have no close friends, so â€œitâ€™s good that more men now feel able to confide in one anotherâ€.

â€œHowever, if youâ€™re also in a couple relationship, itâ€™s important to maintain a balance and not neglect your partner in favour of your friendships and vice versa,â€ he said.

Also commenting on the study, Kate Leaver, author of The Friendship Cure (out March 2018 in the UK), told HuffPost UK bromances can not only improve mental health, but release some of the strain on romantic relationships.

â€œIn modern times, we place a dangerous level of expectation on our romantic partners and have a concerning fixation on romantic love as the most important form of love,â€ she said.

â€œThe more we can move away from that and distribute our emotional needs and resources across multiple relationships - bromances, female friendships - the better. For the sustainability and stability of our romantic relationships, for our mental health, for our constant development as people.â€

She added that she strongly believes people should retain their own independent friendships when they get into a relationship.

â€œResearch shows that on average we lose three friendships when we enter a serious monogamous relationship and Iâ€™d like to see us deliberately change that stat,â€ she said.

â€œWe should really be diversifying our emotional investment as much as possible, including our chosen love person and the friends who lift us up and make life better.â€
TITLE: 'Bromances' Aren't Ruining Romantic Relationships, They're Saving Men's Lives

TEXT:
Ein Flugzeug hat vergangenen Dienstag 40 Tonnen Kerosin Ã¼ber der Pfalz abgelassen

Das sogenannte Fuel Dumping ist in NotfÃ¤llen erlaubt

Die Folgen des Fuel Dumpings sind umstritten

Ein Flugzeug hat vergangene Woche etwa 40 Tonnen Kerosin Ã¼ber Rheinland-Pfalz abgelassen. Das bestÃ¤tigte die Deutsche Flugsicherung am Freitag, wie "Focus Online" berichtet.

Der Airbus von Lufthansa sollte vergangenen Dienstag von Frankfurt nach Houston im US-Bundesstaat Texas fliegen. Doch der Airbus A380 musste nach dem Start wieder zum Flughafen zurÃ¼ckkehren, weil es offenbar Probleme am Fahrwerk gab.

Das Flugpersonal lieÃŸ daraufhin das Kerosin ab, um sicher landen zu kÃ¶nnen.

Fuel Dumping ist in NotfÃ¤llen erlaubt

Durch diese MaÃŸnahme verliert das Flugzeug an Gewicht - denn wenn es zu schwer fÃ¼r die Landung ist, kÃ¶nnte das Fahrwerk zu stark belastet werden und die Passagiere in Gefahr bringen. Aus diesem Grund ist das sogenannten Fuel Dumping in solchen NotfÃ¤llen erlaubt.

Schon im Mai hat ein Passagierflugzeug 54 Tonnen Kerosin Ã¼ber der Westpfalz abgelassen, weil es wegen technischer Probleme wieder zum Startflughafen zurÃ¼ckkehren und fÃ¼r die Landung Gewicht verlieren musste.

Das Sprit abgelassen werde, komme in Deutschland pro Jahr nur 20 bis 30 Mal vor - bei insgesamt drei Millionen Flugbewegungen, sagte eine Sprecherin der Deutschen Flugsicherung "Focus Online". Das geschehe nur in FÃ¤llen, in denen ansonsten eine groÃŸe Gefahr fÃ¼r das Leben der Reisenden bestÃ¼nde.

"Es geht hier um Menschenleben. Deshalb mÃ¼ssen wir den Piloten die MÃ¶glichkeit geben, Ã¼ber mÃ¶glichst unbesiedelten Gebieten ihre Runden zu drehen, um entsprechend Treibstoff abzulassen", sagte die Sprecherin.

Der Pilot darf nicht selbst entscheiden

Der Pilot kÃ¶nne dies auch nicht selbst entscheiden, sondern mÃ¼sse auf GeheiÃŸ der Lotsen Ã¼ber mÃ¶glichst unbewohnte Gebiete fliegen und dort den Sprit ablassen. Ob der Treibstoff Ã¼berhaupt am Boden ankomme, sei unter Experten umstritten.

Mit den Risiken von abgelassenem Kerosin fÃ¼r Gesundheit und Umwelt wird sich nach Landtagsangaben der Ausschuss fÃ¼r Wirtschaft und Verkehr am 18. Oktober befassen.

Mit Material der dpa

(jg)
TITLE: Nach einer Panne: Ein Flugzeug lÃ¤sst 40 Tonnen Kerosin Ã¼ber der Pfalz ab

TEXT:
US-PrÃ¤sident Trump will sich am Freitag zum Iran-Atomabkommen Ã¤uÃŸern

US-PrÃ¤sident Donald Trump will am Freitag seine Iran-Strategie verkÃ¼nden. Das bestÃ¤tigte das WeiÃŸe Haus. Demnach soll Trump gegen 18.45 Uhr deutscher Zeit eine Rede halten - und sich zum Atomabkommen mit dem Iran Ã¤uÃŸern, das der US-PrÃ¤sident in den vergangenen Wochen immer wieder in Frage gestellt hatte.

Der Republikaner muss dem Kongress bis zum Sonntag sagen, ob der Iran die Auflagen aus der Vereinbarung erfÃ¼llt. Es wird damit gerechnet, dass der PrÃ¤sident diese BestÃ¤tigung verweigern kÃ¶nnte.

Trump mache sich umfangreiche Gedanken dazu, was er in Bezug auf den Iran tun solle, sagte der Stabschef des PrÃ¤sidenten, John Kelly, am Donnerstag. Trump sei nicht der einzige, der den Deal in Frage gestellt habe.

Iran: "Irrationale Entscheidungen von Trump"

Sollte Trump die BestÃ¤tigung verweigern, muss der Kongress innerhalb von 60 Tagen entscheiden, ob die ausgesetzten Sanktionen gegen Teheran wieder in Kraft gesetzt werden sollen. Erst dieser Schritt kÃ¤me einer AufkÃ¼ndigung des Abkommens gleich. Eine Mehrheit fÃ¼r Sanktionen ist im Senat fraglich.

"Es gibt weder einen Grund panisch zu werden noch die eventuellen irrationalen Entscheidungen von (US-PrÃ¤sident Donald) Trump Ã¼berhaupt ernst zu nehmen", sagte Irans ParlamentsprÃ¤sident Ali Laridschani am Donnerstag. Die internationale Gemeinschaft sei gegen Trumps AlleingÃ¤nge.

VizeprÃ¤sident und Atomchef Ali Akbar Salehi hofft insbesondere auf die UnterstÃ¼tzung der EuropÃ¤ischen Union. "Wir setzen auf die EuropÃ¤er und bis jetzt waren die Signale diesbezÃ¼glich ja auch positiv", sagte Salehi laut Nachrichtenagentur Irna. Wichtig sei jedoch, dass die EuropÃ¤er sich auch im Ernstfall gegen die USA und auf die Seite des Irans stellten.

Gabriel: "Unmittelbare Gefahr eines neuen Krieges"

Noch-AuÃŸenminister Sigmar Gabriel warnte am Donnerstag erneut entschieden vor einem Ausscheren der USA aus dem Abkommen.

Der Iran kÃ¶nnte wieder anfangen an der Entwicklung von Atomwaffen zu arbeiten, sagte er dem Redaktionsnetzwerk Deutschland (RND). Israel habe das als direkte Bedrohung seiner Sicherheit wahrgenommen und mit militÃ¤rischen SchlÃ¤gen gedroht.

"Auch diese unmittelbare Gefahr eines neuen Krieges wÃ¤re zurÃ¼ck", sagte der frÃ¼here SPD-Chef. Er warnte auch vor einem atomaren RÃ¼stungswettlauf weltweit.

France, Allemagne et Royaume-Uni "prÃ©occupÃ©s" par la dÃ©cision de Trump

En "dÃ©certifiant" l'accord de Vienne, le prÃ©sident amÃ©ricain porte un coup majeur Ã  une nÃ©gociation diplomatique sans prÃ©cÃ©dent, qui, de GenÃ¨ve Ã  Lausanne en passant par New York et Vienne, a rÃ©uni sur prÃ¨s de deux ans les reprÃ©sentants de sept pays: Ã‰tats-Unis, France, Grande-Bretagne, Chine, Russie, Allemagne, et Iran. Le programme nuclÃ©aire iranien empoisonnait les relations internationales depuis 2003, et les discussions, dÃ©butÃ©es entre EuropÃ©ens et Iraniens, patinaient.

Si le Premier ministre israÃ©lien, Benjamin Netanyahu, a immÃ©diatement fÃ©licitÃ© le prÃ©sident amÃ©ricain pour sa "dÃ©cision courageuse", Donald Trump reste trÃ¨s isolÃ© sur ce dossier: TÃ©hÃ©ran bien sÃ»r, mais aussi tous les autres signataires de ce texte historique avaient par avance mis en garde contre un retour en arriÃ¨re aux consÃ©quences imprÃ©visibles.

La chef de la diplomatie europÃ©enne Federica Mogherini a mis en garde contre la tentation de "dÃ©manteler un accord qui fonctionne et tient ses promesses".

Dans un communiquÃ© commun, la France, l'Allemagne et le Royaume-Uni se sont ainsi dits vendredi soir "prÃ©occupÃ©s par les implications" de la dÃ©cision de Donald Trump et "fermement attachÃ©s" Ã  cet accord. "Nous encourageons l'Administration et le CongrÃ¨s amÃ©ricains Ã  prendre en compte les implications que leur dÃ©cision aurait pour la sÃ©curitÃ© des Ã‰tats-Unis et de leurs alliÃ©s, avant de prendre toute mesure susceptible de porter atteinte" Ã  l'accord, par exemple d'imposer de nouveau Ã  l'Iran des sanctions dÃ©jÃ  levÃ©es, poursuivent les trois pays europÃ©ens.

Macron "envisage" de se rendre en Iran

Ils ajoutent en revanche partager "des prÃ©occupations amÃ©ricaines sur "le programme de missiles balistiques de l'Iran et ses activitÃ©s dans la rÃ©gion" et se disent prÃªts Ã  prendre "de nouvelles mesures adÃ©quates pour traiter ces questions, en Ã©troite coopÃ©ration avec les Ã‰tats-Unis et tous les partenaires concernÃ©s.

L'Ã‰lysÃ©e a par ailleurs indiquÃ© que le prÃ©sident franÃ§ais Emmanuel Macron "envisageait" de se rendre en Iran, Ã  l'invitation du prÃ©sident Rohani, ce qui serait la premiÃ¨re visite d'un chef d'Ã‰tat ou de gouvernement franÃ§ais dans ce pays depuis 1971. La prÃ©sidence iranienne a elle Ã©voquÃ© sur son site une visite "l'annÃ©e prochaine". Les deux prÃ©sidents se sont entretenus vendredi aprÃ¨s-midi par tÃ©lÃ©phone, Macron rappelant "l'attachement de la France" Ã  l'accord sur le nuclÃ©aire iranien.

Donald Trump a Ã©galement annoncÃ© des sanctions contre certains membres des Gardiens de la rÃ©volution, l'armÃ©e d'Ã©lite iranienne. Les Gardiens de la rÃ©volution "ont dÃ©tournÃ© de vastes parts de l'Ã©conomie iranienne et saisi les dotations religieuses pour financer la guerre et le terrorisme Ã  l'Ã©tranger", a-t-il accusÃ©, sans toutefois allÃ© jusqu'Ã  les dÃ©signer comme un "groupe terroriste".

SUMMARY:
PROMOTED BY BRITISH AIRWAYS HOLIDAYS Memories Of Summer In The Cinque Terre To be suddenly transported away from the daily grind to this magical place, and to be able to experience it together, was an incredibly special experience.
London-based lifestyle influencer, eatweartravel.com PROMOTED BY BRITISH AIRWAYS HOLIDAYS Wonderful, Wonderful Copenhagen With Family This year however, have decided to be a little more organised with our long weekends - and have MADE time to leave London, (and paused all the weekend clubs!)
Travel journalist, blogger at English Mum PROMOTED BY BRITISH AIRWAYS HOLIDAYS Peruvian Nostalgia: A Happy Travel Moment It's those little things, the five-minute moments and the spontaneous detours you'll never forget that are the best thing about holidays for me.
Irish Travel Blogger.
Reviews and recommendations of handpicked luxury spa hotels, resorts and wellness retreats around the globe.
TEXT:
PROMOTED BY BRITISH AIRWAYS HOLIDAYS Memories Of Summer In The Cinque Terre To be suddenly transported away from the daily grind to this magical place, and to be able to experience it together, was an incredibly special experience. London-based photographer and blogger at skyeoneill.com

PROMOTED BY BRITISH AIRWAYS HOLIDAYS Disneyland Paris - My Best Holiday Moment You might think a visit to Nepal or a climb on Kilimanjaro would've been more appropriate for the best holiday moment blog post. For me, it was the emotion of a lost childhood recaptured in three days. It was the child in me finally seeing a dream come true. London-based lifestyle influencer, eatweartravel.com PROMOTED BY BRITISH AIRWAYS HOLIDAYS Wonderful, Wonderful Copenhagen With Family This year however, have decided to be a little more organised with our long weekends - and have MADE time to leave London, (and paused all the weekend clubs!) and jump on a plane to mainland Europe - to places we've never been before... London-based creative communicator, writer, and designer PROMOTED BY BRITISH AIRWAYS HOLIDAYS How Mickey Mouse Changed My Life Spotting beautiful Cinderella Castle for the first time, pretty, pastel and huge at the end of bustling Main Street USA, we're already grabbing each other's hands, laughing and breathless with disbelief. Travel journalist, blogger at English Mum PROMOTED BY BRITISH AIRWAYS HOLIDAYS Peruvian Nostalgia: A Happy Travel Moment It's those little things, the five-minute moments and the spontaneous detours you'll never forget that are the best thing about holidays for me. Surround yourself with holiday memories and whenever you get a chance, go and make more! Travel blogger at Flash Anthology

Travel - The Baby Edition Long gone are the days of basking peacefully in the sun on an isolated beach in the Mediterranean, or the indulgent yet meditative afternoon walks down 5th Avenue exercising both legs and credit card Mother and writer.

Why I Hate The Phrase 'Gap Year' The amount of times I've heard people say to me; "do it why you're young", as if the only time that we should open ourselves up to new possibilities is when we're still young enough to enjoy them, before age, and responsibility bears down on us, and we can no longer afford to take a break from our lives. Writer & journalist

48 Hours In... St Lucia Everything about St Lucia is green. From her lushly vegetated peaks undulating across the teardrop shaped island, to her twinkling emerald waters, it's a Caribbean paradise chock-full of geological marvels. Arts, lifestyle and socio-political writer

Traversing The Rockies - Week 4 (D28-30) After 10km, and a river crossing made making us unavoidably wet, we lost the path. Multiple small rivers and bogs had us pretty much soaked. One river crossing had to be made across a log and while Stan managed it with relative ease, I obviously fell off and into fast flowing river up to my hips. Lucy is a London based Doctor setting out to traverse the Canadian Rocky Mountains on the Great Divide Trail- 2 people, 60 days, 1600km.

Is This Ireland's Best Kept Secret? I thought I knew this part of Ireland pretty well until we arrived in Glengarriff and I quickly realised this is a part of my home county I have failed to explore. The view from our hotel upon check in was magical, the soft evening light reflecting on the bay. Irish Travel Blogger. Skyscanner addict.

Traversing The Rockies - Week Four (D25-27) After a warm night, and consequently an abundance of mozzies we started out along the Brazeau River. Expecting torrential rain from Diane's sat phone weather report, we donned our waterproofs at the first raindrops but this proved to be a big mistake with the upcoming climb! Lucy is a London based Doctor setting out to traverse the Canadian Rocky Mountains on the Great Divide Trail- 2 people, 60 days, 1600km.

Chapter 2: Fear And Judgement What I have to regularly remind myself is that people will judge you whether you worry about their opinions or not, so you may as well do what you want to do. Plus, when you think about it, worrying about the opinion of others is actually incredibly self-indulgent because it's based on the assumption that you are important enough to others that they even care about what you're up to. Presenter, DJ, writer, and secret hopeless romantic

Yes, I Take Full Responsibility For This Disease I Can't Control... It has crossed my mind many times that it would be much easier to just not tell people I have epilepsy. But there is always that chance of a seizure, and the risk of something going wrong - or someone doing something wrong - is reduced if we all talk about epilepsy a little bit more and encourage people with epilepsy to do more. If I've decided I can take the risk, you can too. Writer with a tongue-testing name. Condensing the world into frantic words.

The Time Of My Life Losing my wife and soul mate Katie is the most difficult thing I have ever had to face. It is a reality I had never imagined and should never have needed to comprehend, but in many ways, I was fortunate. I don't enjoy writing that, but there is a truth to it. Blogger, cyclist, runner, triathlete, widower, traveler, animal lover.

Quintessential British Retreats: Cliveden House Hotel And Spa, Berkshire It its past glory as a private country house estate, it's said that no one would turn down an invitation to Cliveden. In its 350-year history, Cliveden has hosted every British monarch since George I and is most famous as the home of the Astors and the setting for the scandal of the Profumo Affair. Reviews and recommendations of handpicked luxury spa hotels, resorts and wellness retreats around the globe.
TITLE: Travel: Ideas, Advice and Tips On Flights, Hotels And Holidays

SUMMARY:
A place to share knowledge and better understand the worldThe Perils Of Being Ownerless I consider myself a feminist.
A place to share knowledge and better understand the worldFive Things Every Couple Should Know Before They Get Married A lifelong relationship is an asset: Marriage is not for the faint at heart.
It's the bomb you drop on the first date if you want to send any dating prospect off to NOPEville.
What To Do If You Need To Poo On A First Date First dates can be a nerve-racking experience.
Dating Expert and Dating Coach
TEXT:
How To Break Up Less Painfully, According To A Therapist There is no surefire way to avoid hurting someone's feelings, but there are definitely better ways of breaking up that respect the other person and their feelings. A place to share knowledge and better understand the world

The Perils Of Being Ownerless I consider myself a feminist. I consider myself to live in a world where things are certainly not equal for women, but being white, married, middle class, heterosexual and reasonably solvent meant that I did not experience the injustice so many women do on a daily basis. Mother, recipe writer, blogger, presenter and was runner up in the 2011 Great British Bake Off

An Expert's Guide To Handling Long-Distance Relationships Distance relationships can be extremely challenging. Being separated from someone you love takes an emotional, psychological and physical toll on each partner along with adding stress and pressure to the relationship. A place to share knowledge and better understand the world

Five Things Every Couple Should Know Before They Get Married A lifelong relationship is an asset: Marriage is not for the faint at heart. It will stretch you, challenge you, wound you, and heal you. There will be times you will want to and even feel justified in cashing it in. But, just like a 401k, the compound interest isn't fully realized until you have held onto it for years. A place to share knowledge and better understand the world

Why It's Totally Okay To Be Clingy In Relationships 'Clingy' has long been deemed as one of the most undesirable traits that could instantly turn off any level of interest. It's the bomb you drop on the first date if you want to send any dating prospect off to NOPEville. In a nutshell, no one, I repeat, no one wants to be seen as clingy. Blogger and story teller

What Do Most Couples Misunderstand About Money? Although money is just a tool, it is a tool that holds a lot of power. Money is one of the top cited reasons for conflict in a relationship and often attributed to couples breaking up. Getting a better grasp on what money means and how it operates between partners is paramount. In that light, here are four often misunderstood financial considerations for couples to keep in mind: A place to share knowledge and better understand the world

Love Is All Around Us (Even In My Chemo Unit) Richard Curtis once wrote that, 'love is everywhere', and none more so than at the arrivals gate at Heathrow Airport. I disagree. You'll find more love in my local chemo unit, but it's a different sort of love. It's deeper somehow. More evolved. Tinged with sadness but always driven by an overriding sense of hope. Freelance writer & blogger at www.kidsversuscopy.com

How To Introduce Sex Toys Into Your Relationship Buying your first sex toy is often a right of passage for a lot of women. You've thought about it, you've done your research, you've made a short-list of contenders, and you've finally (after much deliberation) decided on 'the one'. Head of Communications, MysteryVibe

Four Last Minute Winter Wedding Planning Tips Winter is a magical season for a wedding. The cold outdoors provides a fantastic contrast and backdrop for a warm and welcoming wedding. In the UK winter is the season of love and giving - everyone is in a good mood, looking ahead already to the New Year and the fresh start that comes with spring. Founder of Freak Music, one of the UK's leading entertainment agencies.

Why Is Gaslighting So Disturbing? Being gaslighted over time effectively disconnects you from yourself, your feelings, your ability to know what you want and don't want, what you know to be true about yourself, others, and the world. It can eventually strip a person of their core sense of themselves, leaving them feeling dependent upon the gaslighter to define reality and provide approval and confirmation of what is real. A place to share knowledge and better understand the world

Going On The Undateables Taught Me I Don't Need To Be Terrified Of Dating If I can take anything away from being on the show I would say it has given me the confidence to go out and enjoy dating. Rather than being terrified of it. I don't know what the future holds for Tanya and I, but if nothing else, I've make a new friend. Engineer and The Undateables star, living with brittle bones

Six Things You Should Know About Dating A Widowed Person About a year after my wife was killed, I was asked by some newspaper or other to write about my experience of dating as a widower. Having not written a word of fiction or fantasy since leaving high school, I politely declined the offer and rolled my eyes at the assumption that I would be back in the game so soon. Author of Sunday Times Bestseller 'It's Not Raining, Daddy, It's Happy' and writer of the award-winning blog 'Life as a Widower'

We Need More Transparency To Inform Young People That Porn Is An Industry And A Fantasy I recently had a 14 year old girl confide in me after a lesson - she explained she had hair growing around her genitals and wanted to know what was wrong with her. She'd never seen a vulva that wasn't completely bald, and genuinely believed her body hair was unnatural and abnormal. Brook Education and Wellbeing Specialist

Why Ghosting Someone Is The Worst Thing Ever We've all been there, you think the date you had last Tuesday went great, you've been texting non-stop and have agreed to meet again. Then all of a sudden, that person is gone. Drifted into the wind like a Greggs plastic bag.

What To Do If You Need To Poo On A First Date First dates can be a nerve-racking experience. You know you must do everything you can to make a great first impression. Every word, comment or action will be scrutinized and you are extremely careful to present the best version of yourself. So, it can be hugely embarrassing if nature calls and you find yourself having to run to the loo quickly. Dating Expert and Dating Coach
TITLE: Dating & Relationships: Dates, Sex, Marriage & Divorce Advice & Tips

SUMMARY:
Conventional relationship wisdom says couples should settle their disagreements before bed and never go to sleep still mad at each other.
â€œWe are not in a good place to hash things out when we are angry and triggered and need time to process whatâ€™s happening.
It is up to you to determine what you need, and not your partnerâ€™s job to predict this after simply telling them youâ€™re upset.
But once their event is over, do talk about it, because buried resentments wreak havoc over time.â€ â€• Ryan Howes7.
When youâ€™ve lost sight of what you were even arguing about in the first place.
TEXT:
Conventional relationship wisdom says couples should settle their disagreements before bed and never go to sleep still mad at each other. And while this advice is well-intentioned, in some cases, it can actually worsen the problem at hand.

We asked relationship experts to tell us the types of arguments that call for hitting the hay and revisiting the discussion at a later time. Below, seven times to sleep on it, according to therapists and psychologists:

1. When youâ€™re really tired.

â€œLack of sleep can greatly exacerbate conflict. When couples are exhausted, they are more irritable and snippy. Going to bed mad can often mean that you wake up feeling okay, especially if the conflict was exacerbated or even entirely caused by two irritable, fatigued people sniping at one another.

Also, the idea that going to bed angry is â€˜badâ€™ leads to many couples staying up later than they should, trying to resolve fights and often failing, as they get more and more entrenched in their positions. When you have a good nightâ€™s sleep, you can much more easily see your partnerâ€™s position and empathize, which means that making up is finally possible.â€ â€• Samantha Rodman, psychologist and dating coach

2. When youâ€™ve been drinking.

â€œThe heated conversations of the overserved can travel to strange places, and the more drunk, the less constructive they tend to be. It might be best to call a time out, have a glass of water, and revisit the squabble in the morning, if you still remember it.â€ â€• Ryan Howes, psychologist

3. When youâ€™re really worked up.

â€œWhen in conflict, the body often goes into fight-or-flight mode. â€˜Fightâ€™ usually results in an elevated heart rate, an increase in stress hormones and an inability to think rationally. You cannot have a meaningful conversation, much less attempt problem solving, when your body is in this state. If you recognize it, you need to find a way to self-soothe. Some people go for a walk, some take a shower, some meditate and some sleep. If your anger has gotten the best of you, sleep may in fact be your best strategy for repair, especially if itâ€™s late.â€ â€• Zach Brittle, therapist and founder of the online couples therapy series forBetter

4. When you need more time to process your feelings.

â€œWe are not in a good place to hash things out when we are angry and triggered and need time to process whatâ€™s happening. Anger provides useful information to us and is a signal that something needs to change. Specifically, you want to do this in a constructive way (journaling, reflecting, physical activity, sleep) and not destructively (lengthy discussions, yelling, violence). It is up to you to determine what you need, and not your partnerâ€™s job to predict this after simply telling them youâ€™re upset. Sleep also provides a mental filing of things experienced or learned throughout the day, so itâ€™s an even better time to allow for processing of these strong emotions.â€ â€• Kari Carroll, couples therapist

5. When the conflict requires a mediator.

â€œSome conflicts are ongoing and require intervention, like therapy. Trying to resolve these in one evening just so you donâ€™t go to sleep angry would be impossible, and would leave both partners feeling hopeless and like they must be doing something wrong if they canâ€™t resolve things.â€ â€• Samantha Rodman

6. When you have a big day the next day.

â€œYou may have a bone to pick, but itâ€™s 11 p.m. and your partner has a job interview first thing in the morning. Or a final exam. Or major surgery. If itâ€™s possible to hold onto your moderate grudge until their major event has passed, that may be the most loving, considerate thing to do. But once their event is over, do talk about it, because buried resentments wreak havoc over time.â€ â€• Ryan Howes

7. When youâ€™ve lost sight of what you were even arguing about in the first place.
TITLE: 7 Reasons It's Totally OK To Go To Bed Angry, Despite What You've Heard

SUMMARY:
Shannen Doherty said "the unknown" is the worst part of living with breast cancer.
"Is the chemo going to work?
Is the radiation going to work?
You know, am I going to have to go through this again, or am I going to get secondary cancer?
Pain is manageable, you know living without a breast is manageable, it's the worry of your future and how your future is going to affect the people that you love."
TEXT: Shannen Doherty said "the unknown" is the worst part of living with breast cancer."The unknown is always the scariest part," she told ET Online. "Is the chemo going to work? Is the radiation going to work? You know, am I going to have to go through this again, or am I going to get secondary cancer? Everything else is manageable. Pain is manageable, you know living without a breast is manageable, it's the worry of your future and how your future is going to affect the people that you love."
TITLE: Woman's Candid Secondary Breast Cancer Video Diary Shares Reality Of Living With A Terminal Diagnosis

SUMMARY:
Weâ€™re hitting the road on a 25-city tour to hear concerns from across the nation.
By converting a tour bus into a mobile video studio, weâ€™ll capture conversations with people of all ages and backgrounds.
And by working on the ground with community leaders, nonprofits, educational institutions, local businesses and others, weâ€™ll make sure people know weâ€™re there to listen.
Not on the bus tour?
Plus, you can enter to win a $1,800 prize toward a trip to New Orleans for the Listen To America closing event.
TEXT:
Weâ€™re hitting the road on a 25-city tour to hear concerns from across the nation.

We want to know: What does it mean to be American today? To find out, weâ€™re hitting the road this fall to interview people about their hopes, dreams, fears and definition of "being American." By converting a tour bus into a mobile video studio, weâ€™ll capture conversations with people of all ages and backgrounds. Our goal: moving, multimedia storytelling that showcases what we share as Americans, rather than what divides us.

Why we are doing this

Trust in media has bottomed out. We hope to rebuild some of that â€” and learn from it â€” by listening to the public and elevating their stories through our massive distribution network.

How we are making it happen

We will travel the old-fashioned way â€” via bus â€” to 20-plus states to hear from some of the under-heard, diverse Americans who make up the communities that form much of our nation. And by working on the ground with community leaders, nonprofits, educational institutions, local businesses and others, weâ€™ll make sure people know weâ€™re there to listen.

Not on the bus tour? Donâ€™t worry. You can follow us via our daily newsletter or Facebook page.

Plus, you can enter to win a $1,800 prize toward a trip to New Orleans for the Listen To America closing event. To enter, just tell us why you love your hometown.
TITLE: Listen To America

Les X-Tension reprÃ©sentent-ils une menace? PlutÃ´t une force. Ils vont porter les mouvements demandÃ©s par leurs enfants. Pourquoi? Parce que la marche actuelle du monde les consterne. Pourtant, ce sont d'autres gÃ©nÃ©rations qui concentrent toutes les attentions: les millennials et le troisiÃ¨me Ã¢ge. Les premiers parce qu'ils incarnent l'avenir. Les seconds parce qu'ils reprÃ©sentent un pourcentage non nÃ©gligeable de la population (les plus de 65 ans reprÃ©sentent 19% de la population franÃ§aise selon l'INSEE).

SUMMARY:
Just Bad News, In Good English John Akinde performs his poem Letters in an exclusive vlog for HuffPost UK.
Money Can't Buy You Happiness Say The Ringmasters Writer and comedy performer Madi Maxwell-Libby performs her poem Kids, Coins, Cuts in a vlog for HuffPost UK.
In this vlog for HuffPost UK, in which he performs his poem Why I've Never Voted, he talks about how voting is protest.
Conservatives.
Conservatives.
TEXT:
One Day Without Us 2018 We want to restore the courage, heroism and dignity, the adventure and discovery that is part of the experience of migration. As migrants and non-migrants, we want to celebrate and acknowledge the contributions that migrants have made to our country in the past and continue to make today. Author, freelance journalist and blogger

A Year On And Theresa May Has Delivered Nothing But A Weak And Wobbly Government One year of Theresa May is as good a proof as any that Britain is held back by the Tories. The failed politics of austerity have led to a crisis in living standards, millions of children living in poverty, and our health services brought to its knees. Theresa May has failed to deliver on her message of equality and fairness, and has let down working families across the country through her chaotic government. Labour MP for Denton and Reddish

The Prime Minister's Decision To Leave Euratom Shows She Is Willing To Put Ideology Above Jobs And Nuclear Safety Frankly the national interest, access to cancer treatments, and the strength of British industries are far more important than the Prime Minister's pet concerns. That is why Labour has called a debate today in Parliament on our membership of Euratom and why we will continue to put pressure on the Prime Minister to drop her opposition to Euratom and to put jobs and nuclear safety first. Shadow Secretary of State for Exiting the EU, Labour MP for Holborn and St Pancras

I'm Talking But No One Is Listening In the poem Punchline, performed exclusively for HuffPost UK here, spoken-word artist KReimer talks about cuts to mental health services and how hard it is to get help. Spoken word artist, creative producer and Roundhouse Resident Artist

Letters Do Not Bring Good News. Just Bad News, In Good English John Akinde performs his poem Letters in an exclusive vlog for HuffPost UK. In it he touches on how a letter took away the place he called home in the name of gentrification, how letters tell him what money he owes, where to be, and that he needs to vote. However, he doesn't ever get a letter telling him who represents him. Artist and part of the Roundhouse Poetry Collective

Call Me Woman And Feel The Majesty Of It Roll Off Your Tongue Women are stronger when they march together, says writer Michelle Fisher in her poem Terms of Endearment. In a vlog for HuffPost UK she speaks about her disappointment in our female prime minister and her government's decisions, the election of Donald Trump and how when we march as one, we are strong. Writer and part of the Roundhouse Poetry Collective.

Money Can't Buy You Happiness Say The Ringmasters Writer and comedy performer Madi Maxwell-Libby performs her poem Kids, Coins, Cuts in a vlog for HuffPost UK. In it, she speaks about the severe inequality in our society today, benefit cuts and the children left behind. Writer and comedy performer

My Jihad Is About Judging Less And Loving More Spoken word artist Amani Z Saeed performs her poem Radical Love exclusively for HuffPost UK. In the vlog she speaks of her frustration with terrorism and the Islamophobia that follows. Spoken word artist and part of the Roundhouse Poetry Collective

Voting Is Protesting... In Their Language Benna has never voted before. In this vlog for HuffPost UK, in which he performs his poem Why I've Never Voted, he talks about how voting is protest. He says 'the things that happen when I don't vote are the same things that happen when my peers do,' and how it is down to young people to ensure that the 'views from down here' reach the 'silver spoon meeting rooms'. Spoken word artist, social entrepreneur and Roundhouse Resident Artist

I Am Voting, I Just Wish I Knew More Doug Deans, in the poem Bloody Right, describes a conversation between a father and daughter. In this vlog, Doug performs the poem and touches on the frustration one young woman is facing - she doesn't know who to vote for or whether she knows enough. Writer, performer and part of the Roundhouse Poetry Collective

Strong And Stable Kids Need Feeding! In the four years since it launched, The Universal Infant Free School Meals (UIFSM) policy has had a huge impact. Over 85% of children in theirâ€‹ first three years of primary school now eat a healthy school lunch, compared to less than 45% in 2013. That's something to be really proud of, so whyâ€‹ pull it so abruptly!? MBE, world-renowned chef and food campaigner

Putting Ourselves First In This Election This election isn't about the things it's supposed to be about. It's not about leaders, parties, candidates, rallies. It's not about wall to wall news coverage, interviews, speeches and gaffes. It's not about them. It's about us. Writer and musician, writing on politics, music and religion. www.twitter.com/joseph_finlay

The Labour Manifesto Is A New Deal For Public Health The Labour Party has proudly affirmed that the state should act in the interest of the many rather than the few. No doubt you will hear repeated scare-quotes, such as, "Labour plans amount to the biggest state intervention in the economy for decades", that redistribution is "dangerously left-wing" or "unworkable" and that nobody wants to see the return of the "the nanny, interventionist state". Doctor and campaigner working in the NHS, member of the BMA's Junior Doctors committee. Writing in personal capacity.

The Music Industry Is Uniting To Get Young People To Vote United, our brands are penetrating the echo-chamber and introducing the next generation to the policies affecting their future. Electoral registration creates a mental foothold, a subconscious investment which will lead to candidate selection and ultimately voting on June 8th. Music Editor, Headfirst Bristol

In Bury South, Labour Voters Are Plumping For Strong And Stable Over Principled And Weak We're in Bury South, a seat held by Labour's Ivan Lewis for twenty years. Around the table are eight local women aged between thirty and fifty. After some introductions, our moderator James Morris asks two questions. "Who did you vote for in 2015?" Each woman takes it in turn to reply. Labour. Labour. Labour. Labour. Labour. Labour. Didn't vote. Labour. "And second question, who would you vote for if the election were held tomorrow?" Conservatives. Conservatives. Conservatives. Conservatives. Conservatives. Conservatives. Conservatives. Conservatives. I settle back in my chair. This feels like a big deal. Elections analyst and political consultant
TITLE: Beyond Brexit

TEXT:
The BBCâ€™s flagship political programme â€˜Question Timeâ€™ should be overhauled to prevent the â€œvenomâ€ of audiences and to combat its â€œuglyâ€ studio atmosphere, an ex-Corporation boss has suggested.

Roger Mosey, the former head of BBC television news, said â€œCorbynistas, Nats and Ukippersâ€ can dominate audiences while quieter â€œmoderatesâ€ struggle to be heard.

Mosey also suggested reforms to how panellists are chosen to increase the number of impartial experts who can provide context to discussions without political affiliation.

Writing in the New Statesman, Mosey said: â€œCorbynistas, Nats and Ukippers tend to make more noise than the retreating Blairites or Tory moderates, and some editions â€“ notably the one from Plymouth in the summer â€“ have had an ugly atmosphere.â€

Article continues below.

He added: â€œThere is nothing wrong with fervent believers getting stuck in, but the absence of angry claques of the open-minded shouldnâ€™t put centrist positions at a disadvantage.

â€œIâ€™ve spoken to former panellists who now turn down invitations because of the venom of the responses to them in the studio and on social media.â€

He added that the programmes new editor, Hilary Oâ€™Neill, should consider inviting more impartial figures who can relate facts of a given subject rather than political representatives from relatively minor parties.
TITLE: BBC Question Time Needs Overhaul To Prevent 'Venom' Of Audiences, Ex-News Boss Says

TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

LUCKNOW -- The Allahabad High Court has acquitted the parents of Aarushi Talwar, who was found murdered nine years back in Noida, setting aside the CBI court's earlier order, in connection with the double murder case, which shook the nation in 2008.

A special CBI Judge, S. Lal, had earlier held Aarushi's parents, Rajesh and Nupur Talwar, guilty of conspiracy and murder of 14-year-old Aarushi and domestic help Hemraj.

The order, however, failed to bring a closure to the case and the public opinion remained divided, even after years of the conviction.

A high court bench, comprising Justice B.K. Narayana and Justice A.K. Mishra, had reserved its verdict, in September, in the appeal filed by Aarushi's parents, who were sentenced to life in jail.

On May 16, 2008, Aarushi was found murdered inside her bedroom in the flat in Jal Vayu Vihar - her throat slit with surgical precision.

It was initially suspected that house help Hemraj had killed Aarushi. However, the case took a shocking turn when Hemraj's body was recovered two days later from the terrace of the same flat.

The police then began to suspect the Talwars and said Rajesh had murdered the two after finding them in an "objectionable" position.

The accusations enraged the Talwars and friends, who accused the police of framing the dentist couple in order to cover up a botched investigation.

After widespread outrage, the case was transferred from the Uttar Pradesh Police to the CBI that exonerated the parents and suspected the Talwars' assistant Krishna along with two domestic servants, Rajkumar Sharma and Vijay Mandal.

In 2009, the CBI handed over the investigation to a new team, which recommended closing the case due to critical gaps in investigation.

Based on circumstantial evidence, it named Rajesh as the sole suspect, but refused to charge him due to lack of evidence.

Rajesh was first arrested by the Uttar Pradesh Police on May 23, 2008 after which he was lodged at Dasna Jail and let off on July 11, 2008.

Later in 2012, his wife Nupur surrendered before a Ghaziabad court before trial and was also sent to Dasna Jail.
TITLE: Allahabad High Court Acquits Nupur and Rajesh Talwar In Aarushi Murder Case

J-2 avant le 1er prime!!! StressÃ© mais heureux ğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜Š Une publication partagÃ©e par Camille Lacourt Officiel (@cam_lacourt_off) le 12 Oct. 2017 Ã  9h06 PDT

J'ai une bonne conscience de mon corps aprÃ¨s le reste, je dÃ©couvre".

Le nageur tentera de faire mieux que les sportifs qui l'ont prÃ©cÃ©dÃ© sur la piste de danse de TF1.
