In honour of Black History Month, weâ€™ve taken a look at five inspiring women who own some of the best beauty businesses currently nailing it in the UK.
Madam C.J Walker exceeded expectations by growing a beauty empire that lead her to become one of Americaâ€™s first self-made female millionaires.
A child of ex-slaves, she paved the way in the beauty industry so that others like her - black, female - could follow in her footsteps.
A post shared by MDMflow (@mdmflow) on Sep 2, 2016 at 10:31am PDTA post shared by MDMflow (@mdmflow) on Feb 13, 2017 at 12:08pm PSTNails & Brows MayfairFounded by Sherrille Riley, Nails and Brows has quickly become the go-to boutique for gorgeous, full but natural-looking eyebrows.
Rileyâ€™s moto is â€œdefining what is naturally yours.â€A post shared by #Nailsandbrowsmayfair (@nailsandbrowsmayfair) on Aug 9, 2017 at 11:47pm PDT
TEXT:
In honour of Black History Month, weâ€™ve taken a look at five inspiring women who own some of the best beauty businesses currently nailing it in the UK.

Nowadays, black-owned beauty businesses are few and far between. But time was, they were practically unheard of.

Before we share our chosen five, letâ€™s take a step back to where it all began during the late 1800s.

Madam C.J Walker exceeded expectations by growing a beauty empire that lead her to become one of Americaâ€™s first self-made female millionaires.

Walker, neÃ© Sarah Breedlove, was an African American entrepreneur, philanthropist and civil rights activist.

A child of ex-slaves, she paved the way in the beauty industry so that others like her - black, female - could follow in her footsteps.

A post shared by Madam CJ Walker Beauty Culture (@mcjwbeauty) on Mar 8, 2017 at 12:52pm PST

Founding a haircare line that stands to this day, Madam CJWâ€™s legacy opened the door for women of colour to take control of their lives and thrive.

â€œI gave myself a start,â€ said Walker, â€œby giving myself a start.â€

A post shared by Madam CJ Walker Beauty Culture (@mcjwbeauty) on Mar 21, 2017 at 9:57am PDT

Thus, whether they know it or not, these five black female entrepreneurs are paying homage to Walker, simply by being slicker than.

Charlotte Mensah

Owner of the popular Hair Lounge 1999 salon on Portobello road, Charlotte Mensah has won a slew of awards, including the Stylist 2017 award in the â€˜Best Conditioner for Thick Hairâ€™ category.

Mensahâ€™s products (which including the Manketi oil-based â€™poo, conditioner and oil) are adored and used by people with varying hair textures.

Her lounge is frequented by local youth and influencers to politicians, actresses and writers including Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie.

A post shared by Charlotte Mensah (@charlottemensah) on Jun 5, 2017 at 1:54pm PDT

A post shared by Charlotte Mensah (@charlottemensah) on Jan 20, 2017 at 2:56am PST

EPARA Skincare

Epara Skincare is a luxury skincare line created to â€œcater to the unique yet underserved needs of women of colour.â€

With a brand name that literally translates as â€˜to cocoon oneself,â€™ itâ€™s no wonder this skincare line (founded by Nigerian businesswoman Ozohu Adoh) was snapped up by Harrods within its first year of launching.

A post shared by Epara (@eparaskincare) on Oct 6, 2017 at 3:15am PDT

A post shared by Epara (@eparaskincare) on Aug 9, 2017 at 11:01am PDT

Afro Hair And Skin Co.

Made with entirely organic and natural ingredients, the products hailing from The Afro Hair And Skin Company have garnered high praise from beauty bloggers and the media alike.

An advocate for holistic health and wellness in black women, founder Ibi Meier-Oruitemeka launched the brand to provide high functioning natural alternatives to more commercial brands.

A post shared by The Afro Hair & Skin Co.Â® (@afrohairandskinco) on May 9, 2017 at 1:33am PDT

A post shared by The Afro Hair & Skin Co.Â® (@afrohairandskinco) on Jun 24, 2017 at 1:49am PDT

MDMflow

MDMflow is the conception of 22-year-old London College of Fashion graduate and cosmetics scientist Florence Adepoju.

The cult favourite brand takes its inspiration from â€™90s hip-hop culture and features lipsticks in delectable shades targeted to suit all skin tones.

A post shared by MDMflow (@mdmflow) on Sep 2, 2016 at 10:31am PDT

A post shared by MDMflow (@mdmflow) on Feb 13, 2017 at 12:08pm PST

Nails & Brows Mayfair

Founded by Sherrille Riley, Nails and Brows has quickly become the go-to boutique for gorgeous, full but natural-looking eyebrows. The manis, too, are particularly chic.

Expanding the business from brick and mortar to digital, Riley launched a line of brow solutions including brow brushes and pencils.

Rileyâ€™s moto is â€œdefining what is naturally yours.â€

A post shared by #Nailsandbrowsmayfair (@nailsandbrowsmayfair) on Aug 9, 2017 at 11:47pm PDT
TITLE: Black History Month: Five Black-Owned British Beauty Brands You Should Know About

SUMMARY:
Wenn man es sich aussuchen kÃ¶nnte, dann wÃ¼rde man Zuhause bleiben, doch die Pflicht ruft und so erscheint man Abends und hofft, es mÃ¶ge schnell vorbei sein.
Dazu gehÃ¶rt auch, dass die Weihnachtsfeier als ein wichtiges Event wahrgenommen wird, dass die Beziehung und die Kommunikation zwischen der FÃ¼hrungsebene und den Mitarbeitern verbessern kann.
Doch wenn sich alle gemeinsam auf ein und dasselbe Ziel konzentrieren und sich darauf freuen, dann, ja dann kann eine Weihnachtsfeier interne Hierarchien Ã¼berwinden.
Denn sie kosten Zeit und Geld und das sind Ressourcen, die man nicht verschwenden kann und will.
Denn nur so kann man sich gegenseitig kennenlernen, wenn man sich prÃ¤sentieren kann in Form eines offenen GesprÃ¤chs.
TEXT:
FÃ¼hrungskrÃ¤fte reden nicht mit Mitarbeitern, zumindest nicht wÃ¤hrend der Arbeit. "Man kommt einfach bei der vielen Arbeit nicht dazu", mÃ¶gen FÃ¼hrungskrÃ¤fte nun entgegnen. Dabei fragt man sich, was man dagegen tun kÃ¶nnte und eine Vielzahl an Strategien wie Team-Meetings, Rederunden und feste Zeiten sind mÃ¶glich, doch eine der besten LÃ¶sungen ist die Weihnachtsfeier - eine gut geplante Feier! Auf einer solchen Feier begegnen sich beide Gruppen auf AugenhÃ¶he und haben die Chance, sich ganz neu kennenzulernen.

Eine Weihnachtsfeier ist langweilig, aber Pflicht!

Kaum etwas ist so langweilig wie die alljÃ¤hrlich wiederkehrende Weihnachtsfeier der Firma. Warum? Weil es in jedem Jahr das Gleiche ist: Das gleiche Buffet, dieselbe langweilige Stimmung und dasselbe GefÃ¼hl, es nicht abwarten zu kÃ¶nnen, nach Hause zu kommen. Wenn man es sich aussuchen kÃ¶nnte, dann wÃ¼rde man Zuhause bleiben, doch die Pflicht ruft und so erscheint man Abends und hofft, es mÃ¶ge schnell vorbei sein.

Doch in allem Negativen steckt auch etwas Positives. So kann die Ãœberzeugung der meisten Mitarbeiter Ã¼ber die Weihnachtsfeier dazu genutzt werden, um sich bei der Planung besondere MÃ¼he zu geben. Dazu gehÃ¶rt auch, dass die Weihnachtsfeier als ein wichtiges Event wahrgenommen wird, dass die Beziehung und die Kommunikation zwischen der FÃ¼hrungsebene und den Mitarbeitern verbessern kann. Denn in den meisten Unternehmen herrscht gerade zwischen FÃ¼hrung und Nicht-FÃ¼hrung Funkstille. Daher kann eine solche Feier besonders deren Kommunikation fÃ¶rdern und somit das Unternehmen an sich bereichern.

Ãœberwindet eine Weihnachtsfeier interne Hierarchien?

Der gemeinsame Fokus liegt auf Weihnachten und die Weihnachtsfeier ist das verbindende Element, dass alle GÃ¤ste an diesem Abend zusammenschweiÃŸt.

Hierbei wird das allzu oft zitierte "Kompetenzgerangel" beiseite gelassen. Es geht nicht darum, wer besser oder wichtiger ist. Denn damit kommt es zu keiner guten Feier. Doch wenn sich alle gemeinsam auf ein und dasselbe Ziel konzentrieren und sich darauf freuen, dann, ja dann kann eine Weihnachtsfeier interne Hierarchien Ã¼berwinden.

Man nennt das auch "Team Fokus", indem sich viele Menschen auf ein und dasselbe Ziel konzentrieren. Statt gegeneinander zu arbeiten, arbeiten die Mitarbeiter miteinander und somit entsteht wÃ¤hrend der Feier eine Art ZusammengehÃ¶rigkeitsgefÃ¼hl. Gerade dieses GefÃ¼hl beflÃ¼gelt einen jeden, die bisher gesetzten Schranken zu Ã¼berwinden und sich als Teil der unternehmerischen Gemeinschaft zu sehen. Denn Hierarchien Ã¼berwindet man nur dann, wenn man sich gemeinsam auf ein Ziel konzentriert und miteinander arbeitet - fÃ¼r das Wohl aller Beteiligten.

Das Interesse steigt, wenn man Gemeinsamkeiten hat

Erst durch ein Event abseits des normalen Arbeitsalltags lernt man den jeweils anderen Kollegen persÃ¶nlich kennen. Denn wenn man ehrlich zu sich selbst ist, dann weiÃŸ man, dass auf der Arbeit nicht viel Raum fÃ¼r die persÃ¶nliche Entfaltung ist. Und wenn man sich nicht persÃ¶nlich entfalten kann, kÃ¶nnen andere die eigene PersÃ¶nlichkeit nicht erkennen. Ein Versteckspiel fÃ¼r beide Seiten - leider.

Dinge, die die eigene PersÃ¶nlichkeit ausmachen und Nichts mit der Arbeit zu tun haben, werden nur dann geÃ¤uÃŸert, wenn sich die UmstÃ¤nde Ã¤ndern. Normalerweise ist dies bei Veranstaltungen der Fall. Wenn es keine Terminfrist gibt und man das GefÃ¼hl hat, dass alle entspannt sind, dann kann man sich leichter und eher fallen lassen.

Somit zeigt man sich seinen Mitmenschen von einer anderen Seite und gibt ihnen die Gelegenheit, einen selbst kennenzulernen. Unter UmstÃ¤nden - und das ist das WÃ¼nschenswerte dabei - tauscht man sich Ã¼ber Gemeinsamkeiten aus, die ein Grundstein einer Beziehung sein kÃ¶nnen.

Es kÃ¶nnte durch ein GesprÃ¤ch dazu kommen, dass man von seiner Kollegin erfÃ¤hrt, dass sie gerne BÃ¼cher von Jane Austin liest und sich fÃ¼r alte Obstsorten interessiert. Selbst wenn es wie Zufall wirken mag, so kann es passieren, dass ein Kollege die Leidenschaft fÃ¼r Jane Austin BÃ¼cher teilt und schon ist das Eis gebrochen und man fÃ¼hlt sich wohler, weil man etwas hat, worÃ¼ber man miteinander reden kann. Denn Smalltalk ist auf Dauer schlicht langweilig und ermÃ¼dend - fÃ¼r beide Seiten.

"Ach, das sind Ihre Kinder?", fragte er erstaunt

Man nutzt die Chance, sich Ã¼ber die Kinder kennenzulernen. Durchaus kann es passieren, dass zu einer Firmen-Weihnachtsfeier die Kinder der Mitarbeiter eingeladen werden dÃ¼rfen. Als positiver Nebeneffekt entsteht dadurch eine familiÃ¤re AtmosphÃ¤re und die Eltern mÃ¼ssen sich keine Sorgen machen, ob es ihren Kindern gutgeht oder nicht.

Ebenso kann es im Laufe des Abends dazu fÃ¼hren, dass die Kinder eines Kollegen auch des eigenen Chefs sich mit den Kindern eines Mitarbeiters gut verstehen und mit ihnen spielen. Man lernt sich also darÃ¼ber kennen, dass die Kinder zuerst eine BrÃ¼cke der Kommunikation schlagen. UrplÃ¶tzlich stellt man fest, dass man hinsichtlich der Kindererziehung dieselben PrioritÃ¤ten besitzt und erkennt, dass man diese Gemeinsamkeiten auch im Arbeitsalltag umsetzen kÃ¶nnte, sofern man den Kontakt aufrechterhÃ¤lt.

Die FÃ¼hrungskrÃ¤fte kÃ¶nnen sich mal entspannen

Man ist dem Dresscode nicht unterworfen und die Mitarbeiter sehen sie als ebenbÃ¼rtig an, weil keine Krawatten und AnzÃ¼ge getragen werden. Denn es kann durchaus sein, dass ich Mitarbeiter von AnzÃ¼gen und Krawatten eingeschÃ¼chtert fÃ¼hlen und sich wohler fÃ¼hlen, ihren Chef anzusprechen, wenn sich dieser auf eine Weise kleidet, der keine Hierarchien ausdrÃ¼ckt. Es verringert daher die Hemmschwelle, womit man offener aufeinander zu geht.

Die FÃ¼hrungskrÃ¤fte mÃ¼ssen an diesem Abend nicht alles kontrollieren und mÃ¼ssen auch nicht alles im Blick haben, sondern sie sind ein Teil der Feier und kÃ¶nnen sich mal einfach fallen lassen. Statt wie gewohnt, auÃŸen vor zu stehen. Denn als Chef ist man es gewohnt, alles im Blick haben zu mÃ¼ssen und nicht abschalten zu dÃ¼rfen. FÃ¼r so manchen Chef ist es eine BÃ¼rde, denn er muss es erst wieder Ã¼ben, sich fallen zu lassen und die Verantwortung auf alle anderen abzugeben und ihnen zu vertrauen.

UrplÃ¶tzlich plaudern die Mitarbeiter

Bei der Arbeit ist normalerweise keine Zeit fÃ¼r Themen, die Nichts mit der Arbeit zu tun haben. Denn sie kosten Zeit und Geld und das sind Ressourcen, die man nicht verschwenden kann und will. Je wohler sich die Mitarbeiter fÃ¼hlen, weil die Weihnachtsfeier toll organisiert worden ist und weil groÃŸartige Unterhaltung an diesem Abend stattfindet, desto selbstbewusster reden sie darÃ¼ber, was sie mÃ¶gen, was sie denken und sind offener. Dadurch erkennen FÃ¼hrungskrÃ¤fte, dass ihre Mitarbeiter etwas zu sagen haben, wenn sie es sich zutrauen.

Denn nur so kann man sich gegenseitig kennenlernen, wenn man sich prÃ¤sentieren kann in Form eines offenen GesprÃ¤chs. Die geladenen GÃ¤ste und Mitarbeiter mÃ¼ssen das GefÃ¼hl haben, dass nicht bewertet wird, was sie sagen. Dies ist zuweilen nur dann mÃ¶glich, wenn eine ausgelassene Stimmung zwischen allen GÃ¤sten herrscht. Denn dann weiÃŸ man auch, dass sie entspannt genug sind und auch die Zeit haben, das Gesagte zu verstehen und nicht nur wie typisch, ein Teil des Flurfunks sind.

____

Ihr habt auch ein spannendes Thema?

Die HuffPost ist eine Debattenplattform fÃ¼r alle Perspektiven. Wenn ihr die Diskussion zu politischen oder gesellschaftlichen Themen vorantreiben wollt, schickt eure Idee an unser Blog-Team unter blog@huffingtonpost.de.
TITLE: Weihnachtsfeier verbessert Kommunikation zwischen Mitarbeitern und FÃ¼hrungskrÃ¤ften

TEXT:
La presentadora Nuria Roca y el escritor Juan del Val, casados desde el aÃ±o 2000, fueron los protagonistas el pasado jueves de El Hormiguero (Antena 3). La pareja acudiÃ³ al programa de Pablo Motos para presentar la Ãºltima novela de Del Val, Parece mentira.

En un momento del programa, Motos leyÃ³ un pasaje del libro de Del Val en el que el protagonista hablaba de que "no habÃ­a nada malo en desear a otras personas".

A raÃ­z de esto, Roca contestÃ³ que mantenÃ­a una relaciÃ³n abierta con Del Val.

"Yo no quiero tener una persona al lado que no estÃ© viva, que no desee. Yo quiero que desee. Otra cosa es que no quiera estar conmigo. Eso sÃ­ que no lo perdonarÃ­a nunca ni yo querrÃ­a estar con esa persona. Ahora bien, yo creo que las parejas crecen, evolucionan, maduran... y nosotros llevamos muchos aÃ±os juntos. Lo que hemos hecho es crecer y hacer un aprendizaje como pareja y atrevernos a confesarnos cosas en cuanto a sentimientos", asegurÃ³ la presentadora.

JamÃ¡s se me ocurrirÃ­a dar por mejor mi pensamiento, mi posiciÃ³n o mi proceder. JamÃ¡s se me ocurrirÃ­a adoctrinar" Nuria Roca

DespuÃ©s del programa numerosos medios de comunicaciÃ³n se hicieron eco de lo que contÃ³ la pareja. Tras el aluviÃ³n de mensajes y de algunas crÃ­ticas, Nuria Roca ha respondido en un cuenta de Instagram con un amplio mensaje.

"Respeto todas las opiniones y las agradezco siempre que vengan desde la educaciÃ³n y nunca desde la prepotencia de quien no admite una opiniÃ³n y una manera diferente de entender. JamÃ¡s se me ocurrirÃ­a dar por mejor mi pensamiento, mi posiciÃ³n o mi proceder. JamÃ¡s se me ocurrirÃ­a adoctrinar", aseguraba.

Y ha sido tajante: "En una sociedad en la que Ãºltimamente se ve tanto pensamiento Ãºnico y tan poca tolerancia a la diversidad, estarÃ­a bien que tuviÃ©ramos todos un poquito mÃ¡s de respeto, de libertad y que diÃ©ramos menos lecciones de moral".

Juan del Val tambiÃ©n ha querido responder a los mensajes tras la entrevista en El Hormiguero. "Yo no veo ninguna opciÃ³n como la Ãºnica ni como la mejor. No entiendo por quÃ© alguien se enfada cuando alguien expone su manera de vivir o sentir", ha dicho en Instagram.

Y tambiÃ©n ha sido duro: "No seÃ¡is condescendientes y preocuparos por los vuestros (en referencia a los hijos) que bastante difÃ­cil es educar para que sean felices".

... y a todo esto en "Parece mentira" hay mucho mÃ¡s y por eso os estÃ¡ gustando tanto. Gracias. #parecementiradelval Una publicaciÃ³n compartida de Juan (@delvaljuan) el 13 de Oct de 2017 a la(s) 5:38 PDT
TITLE: La respuesta de Nuria Roca a los que critican su relaciÃ³n abierta

SUMMARY:
Image caption Steve Hewlett 1958-2017Full text of the lecture as delivered at the Royal Television Society on 28 September 2017:I am honoured to be asked to deliver this, the first annual Steve Hewlett memorial lecture.
Thank you to the RTS, the Media Society and to Rachel for inviting me to deliver it.
It's great to have Steve's boys - Freddie, Billy, Bertie - here, his sister Sue and other members of the family too.
Steve's death was news - national news - which, had he been here to see it and to see you all gathered here for the first annual Steve Hewlett memorial lecture - would have produced one of those characteristically laconic Hewlett chuckles.
It was news, of course, because millions had grown used to turning up the car radio or stopping the ironing or waiting before turning on the kettle to make sure they not miss the latest weekly instalment of the Hewlett cancer chronicle - in which a middle aged man described the pain in his oesophagus; the splitting of his nails or chapping of his feet; the search for the drug or the treatment that might buy him some relief and some more time before the end which he sensed and we sensed was coming all too fast.
TEXT:
Image caption Steve Hewlett 1958-2017

Full text of the lecture as delivered at the Royal Television Society on 28 September 2017:

I am honoured to be asked to deliver this, the first annual Steve Hewlett memorial lecture.

Thank you to the RTS, the Media Society and to Rachel for inviting me to deliver it. It's great to have Steve's boys - Freddie, Billy, Bertie - here, his sister Sue and other members of the family too.

Steve's death was news - national news - which, had he been here to see it and to see you all gathered here for the first annual Steve Hewlett memorial lecture - would have produced one of those characteristically laconic Hewlett chuckles.

It was news, of course, because millions had grown used to turning up the car radio or stopping the ironing or waiting before turning on the kettle to make sure they not miss the latest weekly instalment of the Hewlett cancer chronicle - in which a middle aged man described the pain in his oesophagus; the splitting of his nails or chapping of his feet; the search for the drug or the treatment that might buy him some relief and some more time before the end which he sensed and we sensed was coming all too fast.
TITLE: Nick Robinson

TEXT:
â€˜EastEndersâ€™ fans were left in shock after Thursday nightâ€™s (12 October) episode, when Dot Branning appeared to turn her back on Walford after 30 years.

Viewers were left in disbelief when Dot announced she was taking some time away from Albert Square to visit family by the seaside in Wales, telling her grandson Robbie Jackson of her plans, out of the blue.

When an emotional Robbie asked, â€œhow long are you thinking, grandma?â€, she ignored the question, instead handing over her cat, Dave, for him to take care of.

BBC The emotional scene between Robbie and Dot moved many viewers

After a rough few years for Dot, distraught â€˜EastEndersâ€™ viewers were wondering whether this was it for June Brownâ€™s long-standing character, voicing their concerns on social media:

Was just thinking how Dot has been the highlight of #eastenders these past few...and now she's off for a bit ğŸ˜’ â€” David Phillips (@MrDCPhillips) October 12, 2017

Aww don't go Dot #EastEnders â€” Lisa Cotton (@lisylou) October 12, 2017

Dotâ€™s moving to Mumbles, what a lovely way to live out her days in Verdis or with a Joeâ€™s ice cream #eastenders â€” Emily ğŸŒ¸ (@emilyrosepople) October 12, 2017

Dot is leaving too? #EastEnders â€” Ronnie Mitchell (@RonMitchellEE) October 12, 2017

Every time Dot leaves for a while I'm terrified we'll all never get a chance to see her again. June Brown is an icon #Eastenders â€” Matt (@Heathyheath_) October 12, 2017

#eastenders is so weird tonight. Dot spends ages fighting to keep Dave then disappears. â€” Roz Laws (@rozlaws) October 12, 2017

However, others couldnâ€™t help noticing that she was taking time away from the area just as Mick Carter, played by Danny Dyer, was also leaving, prompting some to speculate whether theyâ€™d be heading off on a road trip together:

I might be able to tolerate 1 spin off ep of Dot and Mick discussing life from deckchairs in The Mumbles #Eastenders â€” Jo Robinson (@JoRobinson2012) October 12, 2017

In tonight's #Eastenders both Mick and Dot suddenly left the Square on flimsy reasons and for uncertain durations. You don't think ... ğŸ¤” â€” Andrea Mullaney (@Pandrea100) October 12, 2017

I'm pretty sure Sandy was a name Dot made up just to run off with Mick. Them leaving at the same time is some coincidence #EastEnders â€” Matt (@Heathyheath_) October 12, 2017

Could Mick and Dot be going on holiday together? A sense a Christmas shocker coming up! #eastenders â€” Antony (@TheEpicAnt) October 12, 2017

Dot and mic are running off together #eastenders â€” Mark Edwards (@markaousrodigo) October 12, 2017

Fortunately, anyone concerned about Dotâ€™s future on â€˜EastEndersâ€™ neednâ€™t worry, as a spokesperson for the soap has assured Digital Spy: â€œDot will be back on our screens very soon.â€

Soap actress June Brown first joined â€˜EastEndersâ€™ in 1985, just a few months into the showâ€™s first run, and was introduced as the mother of criminal Nick Cotton.

It didnâ€™t take long for Dot to take centre stage, though, and has been involved in some of the soapâ€™s most famous storylines during her 32 years in Albert Square.

June celebrated her 90th birthday earlier this year, which was commemorated by the BBC with a special tribute show.

TV's Longest Serving Soap Stars
TITLE: 'EastEnders' Fans Voice Upset As Dot Cotton Appears To Bid Farewell To Albert Square

TEXT:
Acht Jahre lang soll Marc Anthony (49, "El Cantante") Ã¼ber den Tisch gezogen worden sein. Denn wie das US-Portal "TMZ" berichtet, habe sich der SÃ¤nger mit puerto-ricanischen Wurzeln unwissentlich in die HÃ¤nde eines BetrÃ¼gers begeben, der bei einer WirtschaftsprÃ¼fungsfirma in New York arbeiten soll. Ihm vertraute der SÃ¤nger den direkten Zugang zu all seinen Bankkonten und Kreditkarten an. Ein Fehler, der Anthony letztendlich um ganze 2,5 Millionen US-Dollar (mehr als 2,1 Millionen Euro) gebracht haben soll.

Seit 2009 soll sich der Angestellte illegal an den American Express Kreditkarten des SÃ¤ngers bedient haben. Ein luxuriÃ¶ser Lebensstil sowie nÃ¤chtliche Etablissement-Besuche zahlen sich schlieÃŸlich nicht von alleine. Anthony selbst, habe von dem jahrelangen Betrug nichts mitbekommen. Erst durch eine interne ÃœberprÃ¼fung des Wirtschaftsunternehmens seien die UnregelmÃ¤ÃŸigkeiten auf den Konten des 49-JÃ¤hrigen ans Licht gekommen. Sollte sich der Verdacht gegen den Mann erhÃ¤rten, droht diesem eine Haftstrafe von bis zu 25 Jahren.

SUMMARY:
Images from Clarkeâ€™s damning report, released his week, show exposed broken windows, poor ventilation, graffiti, damp, exposed wiring and vermin in the UK prison estate.
The private sector contracts for prison maintenance in England and Wales, worth around Â£500m, have so far failed to deliver the Â£115m savings promised.
The pay cap for prison officers has been lifted as the Ministry of Justice attempts to hire 2,500 more prison officers.
Prison officers will receive a 1.7% pay rise, but is far less than the 5% the Prison Officerâ€™s Association had been asking for.
â€œOr that efforts at rehabilitation would be undermined by prisoners having to spend more time isolated in their cells.
TEXT:
Cockroaches, filthy toilets, litter-strewn cells and electric wires hanging above shower cubicles - prisoners are living in â€œutterly appallingâ€ squalor in UK jails.

That is the conclusion of a damning report from Peter Clarke, Chief Inspector of Prisons, as he warned the violence plaguing UK jails will not end while inmates are held in such poor conditions.

Images from Clarkeâ€™s damning report, released his week, show exposed broken windows, poor ventilation, graffiti, damp, exposed wiring and vermin in the UK prison estate.

One depicted a handprint of blood left on the wall of a cell filled with smashed-up furniture.

HMP A blood handprint marks the wall of a smashed-up cell at HMP Erlestoke, in Wiltshire

Now, Labourâ€™s Shadow Justice Secretary Richard Burgon has told HuffPost UK he will launch a review of private sector contracts for jail maintenance with a view to bringing them back in-house.

He said said British prisons were â€œapproaching an emergency situationâ€, adding: â€œThe outsourcing of facilities management, maintenance and repairs has had a predictable impact on services.

HMP Birmingham Inside a cell at HMP Birmingham. Image from HM Inspectorate of Prisons report on living conditions, which said prisoners were spending as many as 22 hours a day locked inside cramped cells

â€œWhen there are reports of prisoners remarking it is easier to get drugs than clothing, or when prisoners go for long periods without properly functioning showers, it does nothing to build institutional trust.â€

He called for ministers to listen to the prison officers facing the â€œexplosionâ€ of violence on the frontline.

The private sector contracts for prison maintenance in England and Wales, worth around Â£500m, have so far failed to deliver the Â£115m savings promised. The Ministry of Justice entered into the five-year deals with Carillion and Geo Amey in 2014.

Window A broken window at HMP Swinfen Hall, in Staffordshire

The prisons watchdog sounded the alarm on the contracts in August, with checks on fire equipment, CCTV and tests for legionella not being carried out while broken showers left unrepaired for months.

Prisoners have been using clothes to patch up broken windows, while rat infestations have been discovered in some jails

PA Wire/PA Images Carillion and Geo Amey entered into contracts for prison maintenance in 2015

Burgon said: â€œIn addition to ruling out any more private sector prisons, Labour will undertake a review, working with governors and others, to identify those private service contracts that can be brought back in-house over time that would both save the state money and at the same time improve prison conditions.â€

PA Wire/PA Images Shadow Justice Secretary Richard Burgon will launch a review of private sector maintenance contracts within the prison service

Clarkeâ€™s report found some prisoners had no choice but to eat their meals while sitting on their toilets, the report found â€“ something which is in direct contravention of food hygiene guidance.

It also said prisoners and young offenderes were increasingly â€œfrustrated and angryâ€ at being locked up for as long as 22 hours a day in cramped conditions.

Last year, the number of assaults, self-harm incidents and suicides in prisons in England and Wales hit record highs.

Clarke told the BBC the poor state of jails was at the heart of the problem.

Cockroach in prison A cockroach amongst litter at HMP Liverpool

He said: â€œThe Governmentâ€™s ambition for prison reform will not be achieved unless prisons are made safer, the problem of drugs is dealt with and living conditions are improved.â€

A number of prisons have been hit by serious disturbances. In the latest episode trouble flared at Long Lartin maximum security jail on Wednesday, with inmates taking control of an entire wing.

Clarke warned inmates were turning to drugs to â€œbreak the boredomâ€ as they are locked up in cramped and decrepit cells for long periods.

From Peter Clarkes report From Peter Clarke's HM Inspectorate of Prisons report on living conditions in UK jails - barely half of inmates said they were offered cleaning materials every week

Clarke said: â€œThe inevitable outcome of the conditions in jail and the crowding is that prisoners are very frustrated and angry.

â€œWe have seen an explosion of violence in our jails over the last few years.

â€œUntil things are improved in terms of the frustrations of prisoners in their conditions and being locked up for excessively long periods of time during the day, Iâ€™m afraid I canâ€™t see how things are going to improve.â€

Clarke went on: â€œBroken plumbing, blocked lavatories, broken windows, broken furniture, filth, infestations, cockroaches, rats - all the sorts of things that really, in the 21st century, we should be saying â€˜this simply is not rightâ€™.â€

Figures published on Friday also showed the prison population at 85,463, less than 1,000 below the â€œuseable operational capacityâ€ of 86,456, with the high number of prisoners thought to be contributing to the catalogue of problems facing jails.

Lose wire near shower An electric wire hangs above a shower at HMP Liverpool

Prisoners are spending an alarming number of hours locked up in cells HM Inspectorate of Prisons has found Prisoners are spending an alarming number of hours locked up in cells, HM Inspectorate of Prisons has found

Earlier this week the president of the Prison Governors Association said jails are â€œfull to burstingâ€ and called on the Government to â€œbe braveâ€ and cut the numbers behind bars.

Andrea Albutt said: â€œCurrently our prisons are full to bursting. The Government must be brave and reduce the prison population and donâ€™t worry about votes. Donâ€™t dabble, just do it â€“ because morally it is the right thing to do.â€

Describing sentences of a year or less as â€œpointlessâ€, she added: â€œThis cohort must be dealt with in a different way in the community. Executive release is possible. We have prisoners on IPP (imprisonment for public protection) sentences years past their tariff but still in prison.â€

Graffiti and rubbish in cell Graffiti and rubbish inside a cell at HMP Liverpool

Burgon said governors had repeatedly raised the problem with him, also.

â€œI have been struck by the fact every time I meet a prison governor or an officer, they tell me that we are jailing too many people.

â€œThey ask me why we are using vast resources to send someone to prison for a few weeks. They lament seeing the same people over and over.

â€œWhen people at the frontline and experts raise such matters, we must take them seriously.â€

HMP Pentonville

The Centre for Social Justice (CSJ) think tank has suggested the Government should freeing elderly or seriously-ill prisoners , who â€œpose minimal riskâ€ to the public as it would save Â£246m a year and ease pressure on jails.

Burgon also hit out at Government failures to recruit more prison officers.

The pay cap for prison officers has been lifted as the Ministry of Justice attempts to hire 2,500 more prison officers.

Prison officers will receive a 1.7% pay rise, but is far less than the 5% the Prison Officerâ€™s Association had been asking for.

HMP Liverpool A smashed window leaves inmates exposed to the cold at HMP Liverpool

Burgon said: â€œIt really should have come as no surprise to this government that prisons would become less safe when staff are more outnumbered.

â€œOr that efforts at rehabilitation would be undermined by prisoners having to spend more time isolated in their cells. Or that when staff with decades of vital experience are lost to the service â€“ or at breaking point, exhausted after working ever longer hours in ever more stressful conditions â€“ that standards in prisons will become less decent.â€

A prison service spokesman said there have â€œa number of unforeseen operational changesâ€ since the maintenance contracts were awarded which have directly impacted the maintenance of the estate,â€ adding: â€œWe are now in discussions with contractors.â€

TEXT:
Ein Angler will nur den Fisch aus dem Wasser ziehen - Sekunden spÃ¤ter ringt er um sein Leben. | stockstudioX via Getty Images

Ein Angler in England erstickte beinahe an einem Fisch

Die 14 Zentimeter lange Seezunge sprang dem Mann in den Mund

Ein Angler am Pier der britischen Stadt Bournemouth erstickte beinahe an einem lebendigen Fisch. Er musste wiederbelebt werden, nachdem er das Tier versehentlich verschluckt hatte, so der britische Sender BBC.

Voller Freude Ã¼ber seinen Fang hielt der Mann sich den Fisch Ã¼ber den Mund, um ihn zu kÃ¼ssen. Doch die 14 Zentimeter groÃŸe Seezunge zappelte sich frei und sprang in seinen Mund.

Dem 28-JÃ¤hrigen wurde dadurch die LuftrÃ¶hre blockiert. Trotz Erste-Hilfe-MaÃŸnahmen durch seine Freunde erlitt der Angler einen Herzstillstand.

SanitÃ¤ter Harrison hatte nur einen Versuch, um den Fisch zu entfernen

Die gerufenen RettungssanitÃ¤ter konnten den Mann retten, indem sie den Fisch mit Hilfe einer Pinzette entfernten.

â€œUns war bewusst, dass wir den Fisch aus dem Hals des Patienten entfernen mussten, sonst hÃ¤tte er die kurze Fahrt bis zum Royal Bournemouth Hospital nicht Ã¼berlebtâ€, sagte SanitÃ¤ter Matt Harrison der BBC.

â€TatsÃ¤chlich hatte ich nur einen Versuch, um den Fisch zu entfernen. Denn wenn ich abgerutscht, ein StÃ¼ck abgebrochen und der Fisch tiefer gerutscht wÃ¤re, hÃ¤tten wir nichts mehr tun kÃ¶nnen, um die Blockierung zu lÃ¶sen.â€

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Ein Mann wollte nur entspannt angeln gehen - plÃ¶tzlich hÃ¶rt er neben sich im Boot einen Schlag

â€œHier ist es Tradition, seinen ersten Fang zu kÃ¼ssenâ€

Laut BBC berichtete Harrison, dass die Kiemen und Widerhaken der Seezunge zwar feststeckten, es ihm aber trotzdem gelang, den Fisch in einem StÃ¼ck zu entfernen.

Die SanitÃ¤ter konnten anschlieÃŸend das Herz des Anglers nach drei Minuten wieder zum Schlagen zu bringen. FÃ¼r Harrison war es sein bis dahin bizarrster Einsatz.

â€œWir sind alle sehr froh, dass der Patient keine Folgen von seinem Herzstillstand davon trÃ¤gt, denn das Ganze hÃ¤tte sehr leicht eine tragische Wendung nehmen kÃ¶nnen.â€

Ein Freund des Anglers erklÃ¤rt den ungewÃ¶hnlichen Vorfall so: â€œHier ist es Tradition, seinen ersten Fang zu kÃ¼ssen.â€

Einen EnglÃ¤nder stÃ¶rte das Verhalten seiner Frau so sehr, dass er in den Wald zog

Seine ganze kuriose Geschichte erfahrt ihr im Video oben

Er berichtet, dass er 25 Jahre lang als GÃ¤rtner gearbeitet hatte, bevor ihn das Verhalten seiner Ehefrau immer mehr belastet habe. â€œJe mehr ich arbeitete, desto wÃ¼tender wurde sieâ€, erzÃ¤hlte Applegate den Mitarbeitern. â€œIhr Verhalten geriet auÃŸer Hand und sie verlangte von mir, immer weniger zu arbeiten. Organizaciones defensoras de derechos humanos y activistas enviaron una carta abierta al primer ministro de CanadÃ¡, Justin Trudeau en el marco de su visita a MÃ©xico el 12 y 13 de octubre para solicitarle abordar "la alarmante situaciÃ³n por la que atraviesa MÃ©xico en materia de derechos humanos e impunidad" en su reuniÃ³n con el presidente Enrique PeÃ±a Nieto.

En la misiva, los firmantes apuntan que durante los Ãºltimos 10 aÃ±os, MÃ©xico ha sufrido niveles alarmantes de violencia e impunidad ante el despliegue de miles de elementos militares para realizar labores de seguridad pÃºblica en el marco de la guerra contra las drogas.

Acusan que dicha estrategia ha "fomentado la comisiÃ³n de graves violaciones a los derechos humanos y crÃ­menes atroces dado que las Fuerzas Armadas no se han limitado Ãºnicamente a actuar como apoyo a las autoridades civiles, sino a realizar tareas que corresponden exclusivamente a las policÃ­as."

Las organizaciones que firmamos esta carta, nos dirigimos a usted con el fin de solicitarle que sea abordada la alarmante situaciÃ³n por la que atraviesa MÃ©xico en materia de derechos humanos e impunidad, en la prÃ³xima reuniÃ³n con el Presidente Enrique PeÃ±a Nieto en el marco de su visita a nuestro paÃ­s los prÃ³ximos 12 y 13 de octubre.Como es probable que usted sepa, durante los Ãºltimos 10 aÃ±os, MÃ©xico sufre niveles alarmantes de violencia e impunidad. El despliegue de miles de elementos militares para realizar labores de seguridad pÃºblica en el marco de la guerra contra las drogas ha fomentado la comisiÃ³n de graves violaciones a los derechos humanos y crÃ­menes atroces dado que las Fuerzas Armadas no se han limitado Ãºnicamente a actuar como apoyo a las autoridades civiles, sino a realizar tareas que corresponden exclusivamente a las policÃ­as.

Los saldos de esta estrategia de seguridad han sido devastadores. Desde el 2006, la ProcuradurÃ­a General de la RepÃºblica (PGR) ha contabilizado 5,910 averiguaciones previas por tortura y las FiscalÃ­as de los estados han registrado al menos 6,262. No obstante, hasta el momento solo existen 8 sentencias condenatorias en torno a este grave delito.

AsÃ­ mismo, ocurren hechos extremadamente violentos y atentados contra el derecho a la vida a un nivel intolerable. Desde el 2006, la ComisiÃ³n Nacional de los Derechos Humanos ha emitido 77 recomendaciones en las que se documentan hechos de asesinatos. Por su parte, el Alto Comisionado de las Naciones Unidas para los Derechos Humanos informÃ³ que, de acuerdo a cifras oficiales, se han registrado mÃ¡s de 150 mil homicidios intencionales entre el 2006 y 2015.

Por otro lado, existe un contexto de desapariciones forzadas generalizadas en gran parte del territorio de MÃ©xico, y existen serias dificultades para la prevenciÃ³n, investigaciÃ³n y sanciÃ³n de las mismas, asÃ­ como para la bÃºsqueda de las personas desaparecidas. De acuerdo al Registro Nacional de Personas Desaparecidas, 32,943 personas desaparecieron desde el inicio de la guerra contra el narcotrÃ¡fico, incluyendo 8,525 mujeres y 5,985 menores de edad. Por su parte, la PGR sÃ³lo ha iniciado 598 averiguaciones previas por este delito y hasta el momento solo se han emitido 9 sentencias condenatorias por desapariciÃ³n forzada. De manera preocupante, de acuerdo a datos de 19 procuradurÃ­as estatales del paÃ­s, existe un total de 1,075 fosas clandestinas y 2,014 cuerpos exhumados del aÃ±o 2007 al 2014.

La violencia e impunidad, ademÃ¡s ha propiciado el desplazamiento interno forzado de al menos 310,527 personas dentro del paÃ­s.

Dichas cifras revelan que los atroces hechos ocurridos o sujetos a investigaciÃ³n durante la administraciÃ³n del Presidente Enrique PeÃ±a Nieto, no son casos aislados, por el contrario, son hechos generalizados que evidencian a instituciones que no quieren o no son capaces de investigar y perseguir estos crÃ­menes.

En particular, nos preocupa que gran parte de las violaciones graves a derechos humanos ocurridas en MÃ©xico, se cometan bajo un contexto de militarizaciÃ³n de la seguridad pÃºblica. Hemos documentado una actuaciÃ³n recurrente de las Fuerzas Armadas mexicanas: el uso indebido de la fuerza, ejecuciones arbitrarias de civiles rendidos o indefensos, alteraciÃ³n de evidencias y ocultamiento de pruebas, seguido de una estrategia mediÃ¡tica para distorsionar los hechos y criminalizar a las vÃ­ctimas.

En ese sentido, aprovechamos la ocasiÃ³n para expresarle nuestra preocupaciÃ³n por la aprobaciÃ³n de una Ley de Seguridad de Interior en MÃ©xico. Dicha Ley, tiene como propÃ³sito facultar a las Fuerzas Armadas del paÃ­s en tareas de seguridad pÃºblica e incluso pretende que las mismas puedan llegar a suplantar las tareas de la policÃ­a llegando a ampliar las facultades para que el EjÃ©rcito y la Marina puedan tener competencias ministeriales y judiciales. Tememos que, con esta Ley, la autoridad civil termine cediendo a las acciones militares y de que se perpetÃºe la impunidad de las violaciones graves a los derechos humanos cometidas por las Fuerzas Armadas.

Por otro lado, la poblaciÃ³n migrante en trÃ¡nsito es tambiÃ©n altamente afectada sin que a la fecha se cuente con cifras oficiales y al menos tres masacres de migrantes documentadas, con cerca de 314 vÃ­ctimas, permanecen aÃºn en la impunidad. De igual manera, nos preocupa la ausencia de medidas preventivas y de investigaciÃ³n efectiva, asÃ­ como la permanencia de todo tipo de violencia y discriminaciÃ³n, contra mujeres, siendo el feminicidio la mÃ¡xima expresiÃ³n, la violencia cometida contra niÃ±os, niÃ±as y adolescentes, personas LGBTTTI, pueblos indÃ­genas y pueblos en defensa de su territorio ancestral. A ello se suma las constantes violaciones de derechos econÃ³micos, sociales y culturales, particularmente en el contexto de la actividad empresarial.

AsÃ­ mismo, desde que el presidente Enrique PeÃ±a Nieto asumiÃ³ su cargo, se han registrado 38 asesinatos de periodistas, lo anterior, a pesar de que el mandatario anunciÃ³ oficialmente en mayo de 2017 las "Acciones por la libertad de expresiÃ³n y para la protecciÃ³n de periodistas y defensores". Pese a ello, en lo que va del 2017, 11 asesinatos en contra de periodistas han sido documentados, 6 de ellos corresponden a mujeres periodistas. Esto demuestra que las acciones anunciadas por el presidente parecen solo actos de retÃ³rica sin indicadores de impacto efectivo. En tanto, 106 personas defensoras han sido asesinadas y 81 desaparecidas, lo que evidencia que las acciones del Estado para promover y proteger la defensa de derechos humanos no han sido efectivas a pesar de los compromisos asumidos.

Es importante destacar, que las agresiones que enfrentan en MÃ©xico las y los periodistas y las personas defensoras, como lo son amenazas, allanamientos, censura, deslegitimaciÃ³n de su trabajo, acoso judicial y espionaje, son un reflejo de la falta de una polÃ­tica integral de protecciÃ³n y prevenciÃ³n a ataques hacia vÃ­ctimas, personas defensoras y periodistas.

SeÃ±or Primer Ministro, en momentos tan difÃ­ciles como los que definen hoy la situaciÃ³n de MÃ©xico, hacemos un llamado para que CanadÃ¡, paÃ­s cuyo pilar de la democracia se ha basado en el respeto de los derechos humanos, promueva el respeto de los mismos con sus paÃ­ses aliados, como lo es MÃ©xico.

Cada aÃ±o su paÃ­s mantiene un papel crÃ­tico y activo en el Consejo de Derechos Humanos de las Naciones Unidas, ha contribuido en el fortalecimiento del mismo, ha promovido la escrupulosa aplicaciÃ³n de los mecanismos de protecciÃ³n de derechos humanos y ha demostrado ser firme ante cualquier amenaza que ponga en riesgo su independencia, imparcialidad.

Es por ello que de la manera mÃ¡s atenta le solicitamos:

Fortalecer la asociaciÃ³n bilateral con MÃ©xico garantizando que los esfuerzos y las acciones conjuntas, contribuyan en el respeto, protecciÃ³n y garantÃ­a de los derechos humanos de ambos paÃ­ses. De igual manera, le llamamos a instar al Jefe del Estado mexicano a emprender soluciones estructurales y duraderas para que sus instituciones combatan la preocupante impunidad prevaleciente en MÃ©xico. Promover el cumplimiento de las 14 recomendaciones dirigidas al Gobierno de MÃ©xico por el Alto Comisionado de las Naciones Unidas para los Derechos Humanos, en particular, la que se refiere al establecimiento de un Consejo Asesor contra la Impunidad. Ante la falta de capacidad e imparcialidad para investigar actos de corrupciÃ³n y violaciones a derechos humanos, MÃ©xico necesita de un mecanismo internacional, independiente e imparcial, compuesto por personas expertas que coadyuven con el Estado Mexicano para generar instituciones de procuraciÃ³n y administraciÃ³n de justicia capaces de revertir los alarmantes Ã­ndices de corrupciÃ³n e impunidad por violaciones a derechos humanos que existen en el paÃ­s. Confiamos en que su gobierno, reconociendo la importancia fundamental de los Estados a prestar ayuda mutua de conformidad con sus obligaciones internacionales, ayudarÃ¡ a MÃ©xico a combatir la corrupciÃ³n e impunidad a travÃ©s de la promociÃ³n del establecimiento del Consejo Asesor y de un Mecanismo Internacional contra la Impunidad con una composiciÃ³n internacional. Promover, dentro del Consejo de Derechos Humanos de Naciones Unidas y otras instancias multilaterales, un diÃ¡logo respecto de la preocupante situaciÃ³n de violaciones a derechos humanos en MÃ©xico, con miras a plantear soluciones estructurales e integrales al contexto que vive MÃ©xico. Manifestar la importancia que tienen las vÃ­ctimas, las personas defensoras de derechos humanos, y la sociedad civil mexicana en la construcciÃ³n de un estado de derecho, solicitando al Gobierno mexicano que garantice amplios, efectivos y transparentes espacios de consulta, participaciÃ³n y evaluaciÃ³n de la sociedad civil en polÃ­ticas pÃºblicas y otros temas relacionados con derechos humanos. Promover la implementaciÃ³n de los Principios Rectores sobre Empresas y Derechos Humanos de la ONU siguiendo las observaciones hechas por el Grupo de Trabajo de la ONU en la materia al final de su visita al Estado canadiense. MÃ©xico estÃ¡ en un proceso de implementaciÃ³n de dichos Principios a travÃ©s de un Programa Nacional. La implementaciÃ³n de este Programa constituye una oportunidad para atender los niveles de impunidad con la que operan entes pÃºblicos y privados que han causado abusos y violaciones a derechos humanos por sus actividades empresariales. Siendo que MÃ©xico no cuenta con un mecanismo de identificaciÃ³n y sanciÃ³n a los responsables de dichos abusos, ni con mecanismos efectivos para el acceso a la justicia de personas que resultan afectadas, esta polÃ­tica pÃºblica tiene el potencial de fomentar el respeto de los derechos humanos como eje primordial del desarrollo y de todo tratado comercial y de inversiÃ³n. Hacer una revisiÃ³n sobre la eficacia de los lineamientos y compromisos adquiridos por el Estado canadiense en materia de respeto a los derechos humanos en sus actividades empresariales y operaciones en el exterior y en su cadena de valor, incorporando el proceso de debida diligencia para identificar, prevenir, mitigar y remediar impactos negativos en derechos humanos en todos los sectores, particularmente en el extractivo, tomando en cuenta que la mayorÃ­a de las empresas mineras operando en MÃ©xico son canadienses. Es importante mencionar que en el marco del diÃ¡logo debe darse esta conversaciÃ³n teniendo en consideraciÃ³n la modernizaciÃ³n, actualizaciÃ³n y renegociaciÃ³n del Tratado de Libre Comercio de AmÃ©rica del Norte, donde tambiÃ©n debe ponerse Ã©nfasis en el respeto a los derechos a la tierra, territorio y medio ambiente de comunidades agrarias, indÃ­genas y equiparables, asÃ­ como en las afectaciones especÃ­ficas en estos contextos a los derechos de las mujeres y los riesgos de las personas defensoras comunitarias frente a la actividad empresarial.

Agradecemos de antemano su amable atenciÃ³n y aprovechamos para expresarle nuestras mÃ¡s altas y distinguidas consideraciones.

Atentamente,

SUMMARY:
But these are not the only ways to get better search engine rankings.
Google ranks your content based on user behaviour vis-Ã -vis your content.
Here are a few lesser-known facts about how Google actually ranks your content:Your click-through rate on the search engine result pagesHow many people are clicking your links from the search engine result pages?
You may wonder, if you don't have better search engine rankings, how does Google expect you to get more traffic?
Therefore, it isn't just the quality of your content that affects your search engine rankings.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

Every publisher wants better search engine rankings. It's always exhilarating if you see one of your links appearing among the top 10 Google search results. But how does Google's ranking algorithm actually evaluate your content, your individual links, or even your entire website? Is there a set formula?

Of course, everybody who has dabbled in a bit of Search Engine Optimisation (SEO) knows some standard ways of improving rankings. Publishing quality content based on your keywords, creating compelling titles and encouraging people to link back to your content, are all standard ways of optimising for better search engine rankings. But these are not the only ways to get better search engine rankings. Google has burned its fingers. It can no longer rely on publishers and webmasters to stick to its guidelines. The ranking algorithm now crowdsources its ranking intelligence.

Consequently, the way people react to your content is as important as publishing optimised, high-quality content. Google ranks your content based on user behaviour vis-Ã -vis your content. Here are a few lesser-known facts about how Google actually ranks your content:

Your click-through rate on the search engine result pages

How many people are clicking your links from the search engine result pages?

Although your link may appear on Google's first page, if it isn't attracting much traffic, it is moved to the second or third page, and the other links that attract more traffic, are gradually shifted up.

Google takes your click-through rate into account while recalibrating your rankings. Just because suddenly your link is showing up among the top 10 results doesn't mean it is going to stay there forever. Remember that Google is continuously calculating not just your rankings, but rankings of millions of links. So, your link is constantly being compared to other links and is being shuffled around accordingly.

This is how it happens:

Your link begins to show up at position 4 on the search results page.

There is another link that appears at position 6 on the same page.

For the same keyword or search term both the links show up 100 times.

20/100 times people click your link.

40/100 times people click the other link.

This sends Google a message that the other link is more important than yours, and should be given prominence.

So, you are put in position 6 and the other link rises to position 4.

Since this is an ongoing process, all the links that have a better click-through rate than you, begin to bypass you and before you know, your link has vanished from the first or even the second page. The reverse can happen if your click-through rate is better than the link appearing before you. If your link attracts more clicks than the link before you, the positions are interchanged. This is one of the lesser-known ranking secrets that seems to have been recently implemented.

Your bounce rate

The bounce rate is the number many people leave your website after accessing the link they found on Google. If they leave your website without exploring it further, Google thinks that your website is not solving the purpose of the search it is being featured for.

You need to consider bounce rate from Google's perspective. Bounce rate doesn't mean a person coming to your website and then going to another website without further exploring your website. From Google's point of view, bounce rate means a person clicks a link from Google's search results page and then, without exploring your website further, comes back to Google. If many people do this, you have a higher bounce rate which, according to Google, means, your website doesn't have useful content.

The time a reader spends on your website

If a visitor immediately leaves your website after accessing it from Google, it's evident that he or she didn't find what he or she is looking for. On the other hand, if the person spends lots of time on the link that he or she found on Google and then also explores your website further, it signals Google that your website holds quality content and hence, should be ranked better.

The traffic that you get

Google also takes into account the traffic that you are currently getting. You may wonder, if you don't have better search engine rankings, how does Google expect you to get more traffic? From other sources. Google wants to encourage you to use other sources as validation or as plain traffic sources. You can advertise your links on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn. You can share your links on your social media timelines. You can use your mailing list. The more traffic you can generate, the better can be your search engine rankings.

The Search Task Accomplishment factor

When you search on Google, it is a task for it. You're looking for some information. When you come across a link, do you find the information, or not? If you find the information on the link you have just found on Google, your task is accomplished. If not, you come back to Google and carry on your research. That link didn't help you accomplish your task.

If a person finds your link, comes to your website and then immediately goes back to Google to carry on the search it means he or she didn't find the information he or she was looking for, and hence, the task wasn't accomplished. This is seen in a negative light by Google, and consequently, your search engine ranking negatively gets impacted. Therefore, it isn't just the quality of your content that affects your search engine rankings. Social validation and user behaviour matter too.

The opinions expressed in this post are the personal views of the author. They do not necessarily reflect the views of HuffPost India. Any omissions or errors are the author's and HuffPost India does not assume any liability or responsibility for them.
TITLE: Do You Know How Google Actually Ranks Your Content?

"Veremos si podemos hacer el tipo de cambios que necesitamos. Tenemos que proteger a nuestros trabajadores y, para ser justos, el primer ministro quiere proteger tambiÃ©n a CanadÃ¡ y a su gente. Debe ser justo para ambos paÃ­ses", afirmÃ³.

Trudeau hablarÃ¡ con Trump para desviar la "mala vibra" hacia MÃ©xico en TLCAN

Trump hablÃ³ en una rueda de prensa en la Casa Blanca junto al primer ministro de CanadÃ¡, Justin Trudeau. Al mandatario se le consultÃ³ si el TLCAN estÃ¡ muerto, a lo que respondiÃ³: "Ya veremos quÃ© ocurre".

"Eso es ciertamente algo de lo que estamos al tanto (...) Pero al mismo tiempo, los canadienses esperan que trabajemos con seriedad para alcanzar un buen acuerdo", agregÃ³.

Empresarios le piden a Trump permanecer en el TLCAN

Por su parte, el secretario de Comercio de Estados Unidos, Wilbur Ross, uno de los mÃ¡ximos asesores de Trump, desestimÃ³ que el final del TLCAN sea necesario. "No esperamos que pase, no deseamos que pase, no creemos que pase, pero es al menos un posibilidad conceptual mientras avanzamos", destacÃ³.

Fuentes informadas sobre las propuestas de Estados Unidos dijeron que Ã©stas apuntan a elevar el lÃ­mite para el contenido de origen norteamericano a 85%, desde el actual 62.5 %, con un requerimiento especÃ­fico de fabricaciÃ³n estadounidense de 50%.

Reino Unido podrÃ­a unirse al TLCAN si la cosa no mejora con UE tras Brexit

La ronda de Washington promete ser compleja y el representante de Comercio de Estados Unidos, Robert Lighthizer, anunciÃ³ la maÃ±ana del miÃ©rcoles que las negociaciones se extenderÃ­an hasta el 17 de octubre.

El canciller mexicano, Luis Videgaray, ha advertido que el fin del TLCAN podrÃ­a marcar un punto de quiebre en las relaciones entre Estados Unidos y MÃ©xico, lo que afectarÃ­a la cooperaciÃ³n en Ã¡reas no relacionadas al comercio.

Aldi's most recent weekly 'Special Buys' catalogue has featured a second-hand 16GB iPhone, advertised at $449.
In a statement supplied to 9Finance, an Aldi spokesperson said that there was some delays with delivery of the product.
Aldi will sell refurbished iPhone 6 models.This is going to be huge.
Aldi's 'Special Buys' catalogues are infamous for causing lines and crowds at their stores for certain products.
Aldi now includes a disclaimer in their catalogues under certain products, saying:"Please note stocks are limited and will vary between stores.
TEXT:
Aldi's most recent weekly 'Special Buys' catalogue has featured a second-hand 16GB iPhone, advertised at $449.

The smartphone will be available in both space grey and silver, and has a 12-month warranty.



And it's good timing: the iPhone 6 is no longer being sold by Apple, with the company phasing out the model as they announce the new iPhone 8 and iPhone X.

But if you're getting excited already -- hold on. In a statement supplied to 9Finance, an Aldi spokesperson said that there was some delays with delivery of the product.



"Due to delivery issues the iPhone 6 will not be on sale this weekend in NSW, WA, SA and some QLD stores. It will however be on sale on the 24 October. Stores are able to take names until close of business Sunday if customers would like to wait for their stock to arrive. Therefore, customers can still order the phone."

Aldi will sell refurbished iPhone 6 models.This is going to be huge. https://t.co/MgF0siUhz7 pic.twitter.com/RBH76WltA3 â€” news.com.au (@newscomauHQ) October 14, 2017

On first glance, the product seems well-valued. Online phone store Kogan is selling their iPhone 6 for $529, as is Dick Smith.

Aldi's 'Special Buys' catalogues are infamous for causing lines and crowds at their stores for certain products.

When the global discount supermarket advertised a $199 electronic ride-on car for children, it sold out in some stores in less than 30 seconds.

Sydney's Chatswood store sold out of an advertised $99 Fabric Accent Arm Chair within 20 seconds when it was featured in the 'Special Buys' catalogue.

Aldi now includes a disclaimer in their catalogues under certain products, saying:



"Please note stocks are limited and will vary between stores. Despite our careful planning, we apologise if selected items may sell out on the first day due to unexpected high demand".
TITLE: You Can Now Get Cheap Refurbished iPhones At Aldi

SUMMARY:
I wonder how many moments of sleep we will get before the sun rises.
My mind fast forwards to the day ahead and all of a sudden her additional needs feel bigger than usual.
When this is taken away, monumental shifts need to occur as we adapt to this whole new way of parenting.
Of course, certain things are known, like the stark medical words for the cause of these midnight moments: Stroke in utero.
I think of all the parents around the world who are taking care of their children with medical issues during these testing midnight hours.
TEXT:
"I reposition her limbs and try to help her find that space of comfort where she can rest and heal, beyond the labels of her medical conditions."

We've had some rough nights with our daughter who has additional needs, walking up and down the hallway as we take turns to try and soothe her little body.

Running baths to help her feel comfort when she can't find calm. I mix medicines under soft lights and watch the clock tick over from 12 am, 2 am, 3 am and on...

This space is all too familiar. I wonder how many moments of sleep we will get before the sun rises. My mind fast forwards to the day ahead and all of a sudden her additional needs feel bigger than usual. I can't recall the last time we slept a whole night through together, often when she wakes and finally resettles, we are left alert and full of adrenalin, trying to find quiet and calm ourselves.

The hope for health and happiness from parents to their children spans the globe through cultures and time immemorial. When this is taken away, monumental shifts need to occur as we adapt to this whole new way of parenting.

Through these sleepless nights I carry her body as she drapes over my arms, so delicate, fragile and full of mystery. I wonder why she's so unsettled? If only she could talk and let me know. Is she hungry, tired, sore or sad?

I reposition her limbs and try to help her find that space of comfort where she can rest and heal, beyond the labels of her medical conditions.

I have nothing but my intuition to lean on when all else is unknown. Of course, certain things are known, like the stark medical words for the cause of these midnight moments: Stroke in utero. Bilateral Perisylvian Polymicrogyria. Quadraplegic Cerebral Palsy. They are the words of a bad dream. Maybe that's why we no longer sleep.

When her body allows it, I am able to soothe her and hold her close to my heart. But when the rigidity fires, her body forces itself into extension. I sense ways to hold her and bring her body back to balance, waiting for the electrical storm to pass. I hear her soft sighs and yawns after her body has exerted so much energy and has finally found equilibrium.

I think of all the parents around the world who are taking care of their children with medical issues during these testing midnight hours. I wonder how they cope.

The hope for health and happiness from parents to their children spans the globe through cultures and time immemorial. When this is taken away, monumental shifts need to occur as we adapt to this whole new way of parenting.

Through this haze of broken sleep, exhaustion and ongoing physical care, we keep choosing to love over fear.

These tiny micro-milestones of choice in the long run turn out to create some of the biggest shifts of our life, one small midnight moment at a time.

__________________________

A version of this post originally appeared on Miracle Mama.

You can follow Natalie on Instagram here or Facebook here.

Vote for Miracle Mama -- Bupa Blog Finalist -- here.
TITLE: The Midnight Miracle Moments You Have As A Special Needs Mum

SUMMARY:
In his latest film, Dhawan plays Raja, a man who cannot control his urge to grab a woman's butt when he sees one.
I guess, at this point, we should just be thankful that Bollywood movies aren't yet suggesting women actually want to date the T-Rex or that human-chomping shark from Jaws.
In Badrinath Ki Dulhaniya, his character Badri abducted the girl and locked her inside the trunk of his car... yet the film was being hailed far and wide as 'feminist'.
In Badrinath Ki Dulhaniya, his character Badri abducted the girl and locked her inside the trunk of his car.
In a country with a frustrating understanding of gender equality, we actually cannot afford to send out mixed messages as Badrinath Ki Dulhaniya did.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

I have a question for Varun Dhawan. Say, he's at a department store with some friends, getting supplies for a party. A random man walks up to a female friend, while she is bent over a shelf, and spanks her butt. Would he â€” as he probably expected his audience in Judwaa 2 to â€” break into peals of laughter?

My hunch is, he or any decent person for that matter, won't find harassment of that kind funny. In his latest film, Dhawan plays Raja, a man who cannot control his urge to grab a woman's butt when he sees one. Now the problem is not Dhawan playing the man â€” he is an actor and he'd ideally play a gamut of different characters â€” but the film's insistence that this man is its 'hero'. And, like a zillion Hindi films before it, also establish that this butt-grabber, sexual harasser is a man women will eventually fall in love with, because they actually secretly consider being chased and grabbed as a rite of passage to fall in love. I guess, at this point, we should just be thankful that Bollywood movies aren't yet suggesting women actually want to date the T-Rex or that human-chomping shark from Jaws.

In 10 days, Judwaa 2 has made Rs 112 crores. It is hardly surprising, given that the last time he played an entitled Indian man chasing a woman and not taking 'no' for an answer, it was a blockbuster hit, too, that made over Rs 200 crore.

In Badrinath Ki Dulhaniya, his character Badri abducted the girl and locked her inside the trunk of his car... yet the film was being hailed far and wide as 'feminist'.

In Badrinath Ki Dulhaniya, his character Badri abducted the girl and locked her inside the trunk of his car. His father threatened to hang her in the town square and none of them apologised for these specific incidents of violence inflicted on the woman. Yet the film was being hailed far and wide as 'feminist'.

Why?

Because, though true to Bollywood, boor extraordinaire Badri gets the girl, he also gets ridiculously sloshed and tells his horrible, violent father at the conclusion of the film that he is a bad person who doesn't not let women pursue careers. My guess is people in India found it fairly progressive that the protagonist did not actually let the woman he abducted die inside the trunk of the car. Though common human sense says, such a man shouldn't be let alone near an ant unsupervised, forget a human being, in the Indian scheme of gender justice, all was fair in love and two super-hit nightclub numbers. The rousing support for Badrinath Ki Dulhaniya was symptomatic of how even in the presumably 'aware' social circles in India, dignity of women is considered a conditional allowance, not an unquestionable right, the breach of which should be met with punishment, not romance. In a country with a frustrating understanding of gender equality, we actually cannot afford to send out mixed messages as Badrinath Ki Dulhaniya did.

The rousing support for Badrinath Ki Dulhaniya was symptomatic of how even in the presumably 'aware' social circles in India, dignity of women is considered a conditional allowance, not an unquestionable right,

Judwaa 2 doesn't even pretend that nearly two decades have passed since the original film was released, when there were just a few channels to call out it's obnoxious sexism. Which brings us to the question, what gave the makers the courage to go ahead and make the same film, its misogyny intact? Look no further than the film's raging collections and the nearly non-existent protests, to figure what.

One is compelled to wonder if Bollywood's slapstick ideas only have to do with violating women's bodies and ignoring consent? Judwaa 2 showcases every possible way of harassment imaginable to women in India, perpetrated by the male protagonist. A lecherous co-passenger hurling sexually coloured comments at a woman on a flight, a man in a mall who grabs someone's butt, a man who has been rebuffed but comes back to forcibly smooch a girl in a public space, a man who spots a house help in a skirt and immediately grabs her and rubs himself against her â€” the list is infuriating.

Not only that, the women in the film â€” obviously â€” are made out to be the most confusing humans you would know. So the character played by Tapsee Pannu is initially upset that Varun Dhawan's character forcibly smooched her and her mother, but runs right back into his arm thinking it was him who fought a few louts harassing her at a basketball game. A part of me felt that character she plays doesn't need a boyfriend, she needs a lesson in self-respect first.

A part of me felt that character doesn't need a boyfriend, she needs a lesson in self-respect first.

Judwaa 2's success comes unsurprisingly at a time when a host of men and women actually went to town arguing that the repulsive 'Aunty Ki Ghanti' song doing the rounds of the internet was actually about consent. Several 'fans', apart from shouting lines from that song in public places, argued that since the singer is asking 'Bol na anty aoon kya', it is clear that he is seeking consent. Ask them what kind of people actually think saying 'hey should I come and flap your boobs' qualify as consent, they will present you a plethora of arguments that usually make one point â€” 'but it's a joke!'

Before HuffPost India and a few other news outlets pointed out the frighteningly misogynistic nature of the song, several social media pages of comedy groups and even self-proclaimed 'feminist' content sites made 'funny' memes about the song, helping normalise and legitimise this brand of misogyny as 'fun'. No wonder Judwaa 2 exists and is laughing its way to the bank.

Ask any woman, if a random man grabbed her butt in a mall and gnawed at her mouth, she'd be furious and traumatised. It's high time films start sticking to the script of reality on issues like these.

Also on HuffPost
TITLE: Who's Surprised That 'Judwaa 2', Yet Another Sexist Film Starring Varun Dhawan, Has Made â‚¹100 Crores?

A Montreal actress has joined a growing chorus of women accusing embattled Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein of sexual harassment or sexual assault.
In an interview with the CBC, Erika Rosenbaum alleged the fallen movie mogul made aggressive sexual advances during three separate meetings nearly 15 years ago.
I felt it important to tell the truth and speak out against the sexual harassment I and others have endured.
Film producer Harvey Weinstein attends the 2016 amfAR New York Gala at Cipriani Wall Street in Manhattan, New York Feb. 10, 2016.
"I had kept my experience with Harvey Weinstein a secret for a very long time.
TEXT:
Erika Rosenbaum is the first Canadian to join the list of some 30 women who have accused Weinstein of inappropriate conduct since the scandal first broke in the New York Times.

A Montreal actress has joined a growing chorus of women accusing embattled Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein of sexual harassment or sexual assault.

In an interview with the CBC, Erika Rosenbaum alleged the fallen movie mogul made aggressive sexual advances during three separate meetings nearly 15 years ago.

Weinstein, who has been fired from the film company he co-founded, has previously denied through a spokeswoman any allegations of non-consensual contact.

Rosenbaum said she first met Weinstein at a Los Angeles party when she was in her early 20s.

I felt it important to tell the truth and speak out against the sexual harassment I and others have endured. Erika Rosenbaum

She said she met with him three more times to talk about her career, and alleged Weinstein acted inappropriately and tried to be intimate with her.

She alleged that during their third encounter â€” in a hotel room during the Toronto International Film Festival in the mid-2000s â€” Weinstein held her by the back of her neck and masturbated while standing behind her.

Rosenbaum is the first Canadian to join the list of some 30 women who have accused Weinstein of inappropriate conduct since the scandal first broke in the New York Times.

"My statements to the media were very difficult to recount," Rosenbaum, whose credits include roles in the films "Brooklyn" and "The Trotsky," said Friday in a statement.

Film producer Harvey Weinstein attends the 2016 amfAR New York Gala at Cipriani Wall Street in Manhattan, New York Feb. 10, 2016.

"I had kept my experience with Harvey Weinstein a secret for a very long time. I felt it important to tell the truth and speak out against the sexual harassment I and others have endured.

"There is an important dialogue that we need to have. I want to be part of that dialogue and be on the right side of history."

Rosenbaum declined an interview request by The Canadian Press on Friday.
TITLE: Montreal Actress Erika Rosenbaum Says Harvey Weinstein Sexually Harassed Her

TEXT:
'Into It' Podcast: 'X Factor' Banishes Novelty Acts, 'Blue Peter' Gets Zero Viewers And Kesha Is Back With 'Praying' The rumoured proposed changes to 'The X Factor' have got the 'Into It' team talking this week, specifically Simon Cowell's plans to rid the show of novelty acts. Plus, Kesha's triumphant return sparked a discussion about the most effective pop comebacks of recent years, with Rihanna getting the thumbs up from the group (which is more than can be said for Lady Gaga). HuffPost UK's entertainment podcast

How Whitney Houston Taught Me To Forgive My life was ruined. I felt like a big piece of me had also died. No one wanted to work with me. The media made me out to be a horrible person. And my singing meant nothing. Because Whitney was dead. Singer, actress and Celebrity Big Brother Housemate 2017

The Voice vs. The X-Factor: A Fair Comparison In the UK, X-Factor 2016 ended a few days before the new year emerged. Some days after 2017, The Voice started. I have been watching talent shows for ... All-around freelance writer

Has ITV Given The Voice The 'X Factor' And Unearthed A Pop Star? Step forward Mo Adeniran. The very first week of the new series on ITV and a star has fallen into their laps. The BBC must be secretly kicking themselves that no-one like Mo had deigned to audition while on their channel. Despite all The X Factor's misgivings, the show certainly knew how to launch a star and it seems that The Voice UK now has one of its own. Writer & Blogger who loves to comment about TV, music & entertainment

Are We Living In A 'Fame' Crisis? The industry is lacking in authenticity. Now, people want to be famous for the sake of being famous even though they don't necessarily have the talent in a particular area, so the world of 'celebrityism' has been filled up with Big Brother winners and X Factor dropouts. Founder and Director at Creative Industry Hub

Why Are We Getting Honey G For Life And Not Just For Christmas? For the sake of our intelligence, those of you that are a part of the Honey G 'machine', please stop force feeding us her shtick and put your time and efforts into those that are more deserving of such an opportunity. Writer & Blogger who loves to comment about TV, music & entertainment

Why the New Matt Is No Matt The judges loved Matt. He was a favourite from the start. Even at the audition stage he seemed like a shoo-in. At the end, he turned out to be the irr... Would be multi-millionaire, would be celebrated writer- sadly neither (yet)

Is Saara Aalto The Only One That Can Save This Series Of The X Factor? With The Voice looking to start the new year with a bang, it seems unfortunate that The X Factor has become a ministry of blandness this time but a Saara win could be enough to show the new singing competition in town that the old dog still have some bite and shouldn't be put down quite yet. Writer & Blogger who loves to comment about TV, music & entertainment

Predicting The Winner Of The X-Factor I believe that all of them will have a career in music, as well as singers that left the X-Factor before them. Winning a music competition secures a high prestige, but what matters most for an artist is his establishment for many years in the industry. This is the real winner. All-around freelance writer

Post-Truth, Postscript So the Oxford English Dictionary's 2016 Word of the Year has been announced. Where last year the word was actually a pictogram, the 'crying laughing face emoji', this year the word is a two-word phrase: Post-Truth. English teacher, book-lover, @TweeterofWit, blogger, lifelong learner

Honey G Can Still Win The X-Factor Now that Honey G was a candidate to leave, X-Factor fans could think that this was the precursor of her departure and that she is not able to reach the final or win the show. My research demonstrates that those people are wrong. All-around freelance writer

The Tempestuous Journey Of Saara Aalto In The X-Factor Saara Aalto has faced hard times in this year's X-Factor, perhaps more than anyone else that is currently in the competition. However, she has overcom... All-around freelance writer

Honey G Is A Phenomenon. Period. Snapshot from the Official X-Factor Youtube Channel (https://www.youtube.com/user/TheXFactorUK) Honey G is much more than a rap music artist. She is... All-around freelance writer
