TEXT:
Sebastian Kurz (links) mit Christian Rainer, dem Herausgeber des Ã¶sterreichischen Nachrichtenmagazins profil (rechts), in der Mitte der Unternehmer Rahimi

Sebastian Kurz wurde von Politikberatern ein charismatisches Image gebaut. Er soll die alte Systempartei Ã–VP ersetzen. Mit der Liste Kurz.

Liste Sebastian Kurz wird am Amtlichen Stimmzettel fÃ¼r die Nationalratswahl am 15. Oktober in der Republik Ã–sterreich stehen. Die Liste Sebastian Kurz steht an zweiter Stelle des Stimmzettels und soll die traditionelle Ã–VP ersetzen, die bei den letzten Wahlen den zweiten Platz einnahm.

Die â€Liste Sebastian Kurz" ist die Parteibezeichnung am Stimmzettel. Sie definiert sich als die â€neue Ã–VP". Damit ist das Ende der bisher bÃ¼rgerlichen Ã–VP im Prinzip schon eingetreten.

Offenbar denkt man in der ehemals bÃ¼rgerlichen Ã–VP, dass die alte Systempartei nicht mehr reÃ¼ssieren kann. Es soll auf eine Zeitenwende reagiert werden, die nach neuen Parteien in Europa verlangt. â€Liste Sebastian Kurz" wird damit zum Ã¶sterreichischen Modell der â€Alternative fÃ¼r Deutschland" (AfD). Auch in den inhaltlichen Schwerpunkten sind Parallelen erkennbar.

Kritisierte Bundeskanzlerin Merkel

Da Sebastian Kurz sich mit dieser Ausrichtung von der alten Systempartei Ã–VP schon trennte, kannte er auch keine Hemmungen die deutsche CDU-Bundeskanzlerin Merkel in die Kritik zu nehmen. Auch die CDU ist fÃ¼r Sebastian Kurz und seine Berater letztlich nicht mehr als eine Systempartei, die abgelÃ¶st werden sollte.

Die Kritik an Angela Merkel war inhaltlich aber nicht gerechtfertigt. Es ging um den Umgang mit Vertriebenen aus Kriegsregionen, insbesondere aus Syrien. Die FlÃ¼chtlingspolitik der deutschen Bundesregierung war dabei aber vorbildlich. Kurz wollte mit der Kritik sich bewusst profilieren, auf Kosten der deutschen Bundeskanzlerin.

Sensibles Thema

Die FlÃ¼chtlinge aus Syrien sind eigentlich Assyrer, die der christlichen Kultur angehÃ¶ren. Sie stammen aus den LÃ¤ndern des alten Mesopotamiens und leben in der Diaspora in mehreren LÃ¤ndern Europas und der USA, insbesondere seit 1915 ein VÃ¶lkermord an den Assyrern begangen wurde. Der Umgang mit assyrischen FlÃ¼chtlingen erfordert deshalb besondere SensibilitÃ¤t.

Rund 5.000 Mitglieder der syrisch-orthodoxen Kirche in Ã–sterreich lebten schon vor 20 Jahren in Wien. Sie lebten in Ã–sterreich unauffÃ¤llig. Es gab nie die geringsten Probleme mit Assyrern in Ã–sterreich. Sie sind anerkannte Mitglieder der BevÃ¶lkerung in Wien.

Der Bischof der syrisch-orthodoxen Kirche ist in der ErzdiÃ¶zese Wien integriert. FÃ¼r seine Leistungen erhielt er in einer festlichen Zeremonie im Jahr 2004 den Titel â€Professor" verliehen. Vom damaligen NationalratsprÃ¤sidenten Andreas Khol (Ã–VP), der eine Festrede hielt.

Weshalb jetzt assyrische Einwanderer ein Problem in Ã–sterreich darstellen sollen, das ist vÃ¶llig unklar.

Syrien ist Ã¼ber die Mittelmeerregion, insbesondere Ã¼ber Zypern, aber auch Ã¼ber Griechenland bereits ein Nachbarland der EuropÃ¤ischen Union. Damit liegt Syrien in einer Region, die im Fokus der EU liegt. Ein Assoziationsabkommen mit Syrien wurde deshalb bereits 2009 vorbereitet. Die Bedingungen der BevÃ¶lkerung und die politische Situation in Syrien mÃ¼ssen deshalb von der EU ernst genommen und entsprechend reagiert werden.

Ã–sterreich verliert Reputation

Ã–sterreich und seine BevÃ¶lkerung wurden noch vor wenigen Jahren mit Attributen fÃ¼r Gastfreundschaft und Hilfsbereitschaft identifiziert. Auf Basis von Leistungen aus Krisenzeiten, die belegt sind.

1956 kamen rund 200.000 Ungarn nach Ã–sterreich, die in Folge des Volksaufstandes in BedrÃ¤ngnis gerieten. Allen Menschen, die aus Ungarn flohen, wurde durch Ministerratsbeschluss Asyl gewÃ¤hrt. 1968 kamen nach dem Ende des Prager FrÃ¼hlings in der CSSR rund 160.000 Tschechen und Slowaken nach Ã–sterreich. 1981 kamen nach der VerhÃ¤ngung des Kriegsrechts in Polen rund 150.000 Polen nach Ã–sterreich. Aufgrund des Balkankriegs Anfang der neunziger Jahre setzte Ã–sterreich die Initiative â€Nachbarn helfen Nachbarn". Es kamen rund 100.000 FlÃ¼chtlinge aus Bosnien-Herzegowina nach Ã–sterreich.

In all diesen FÃ¤llen bewÃ¤hrte sich Ã–sterreich und seine BevÃ¶lkerung und gewann dadurch international berechtigterweise an Reputation. Es ist keinesfalls im Interesse Ã–sterreichs, dass dieser gute Ruf jetzt durch die Politik des AuÃŸenministers Sebastian Kurz zertrÃ¼mmert werden soll.

Plakative Reden

Forderungen von Sebastian Kurz sind meist oberflÃ¤chlich und dreist. Dies gilt beispielsweise auch fÃ¼r seine Forderung:



â€Mehr Deutsch in Moscheen. Davon bin ich heute noch Ã¼berzeugt. Wo Deutsch gesprochen wird, wird Deutsch schneller erlernt, das hilft bei der Integration".

Es gibt ausreichend MÃ¶glichkeiten, dass in Ã–sterreich die deutsche Sprache qualifiziert gelernt werden kann. Keinesfalls ist es erforderlich, dass die eigene Sprache und eigene Kultur von Immigranten ganz aufgegeben wird. Die Kulturzentren und dazu zÃ¤hlen auch die religiÃ¶sen Orte der Moscheen sollen ihre Sprache erhalten und ihre Traditionen pflegen.

Sebastian Kurz war Staatssekretar fÃ¼r Integration vor seiner Bestellung zum AuÃŸenminister. In dieser Funktion muss er dafÃ¼r sorgen, dass weitere MÃ¶glichkeiten fÃ¼r das Kommunizieren in deutscher Sprache geschaffen werden. Insbesondere durch interkulturelle Zentren, in denen Einwanderer mit der einheimischen Ã¶sterreichischen BevÃ¶lkerung zusammentreffen und in Dialog kommen kÃ¶nnen. Mit solchen Begegnungen werden auch Spannungen abgebaut.

Politik als Design

Sebastian Kurz ist der Einmarsch der Ã„sthetik des Fotomodells in die Politik. Betrachtet man Fotos von Sebastian Kurz erhÃ¤lt man den Eindruck, dass er zu viel Rouge an den Wangen aufgetragen erhielt. Kurz wird meist als Dressman prÃ¤sentiert, der mit dicker Camouflage versehen wurde.

Auf manchen Bildern wird Kurz in einem utopischen Stil gezeichnet, der an Figuren wie im Film Matrix erinnert. Mit der Stimmung als wÃ¤ren die letzten Tage der Welt gekommen. SelbstverstÃ¤ndlich schaffen professionelle Fotografen eine solche Bildgestaltung. Das ist aber kein politisches Programm.



Das kann noch gesteigert werden. Etwa auf einem Cover des profil, das Sebastian Kurz im heroischen Stil der Skulpturen eines Arno Breker aufgemalt zeigt, in einer Ã„sthetik, der man in der Epoche des Nationalsozialismus huldigte.

Noch vor wenigen Jahren hÃ¤tte man das Auftreten eines Sebastian Kurz in Wien als â€prÃ¤potent" rasch abgetan. PlÃ¶tzlich wurde Sebastian Kurz mit euphorischer Verherrlichung empfohlen.

Einige Medien forcierten Kurz stark. Insbesondere Christian Rainer, der Herausgeber des Ã¶sterreichischen Nachrichtenmagazins profil. Er schwÃ¤rmt von Sebastian Kurz, den er in einem Kommentar als neuen Parteivorsitzenden der Ã–VP und als nÃ¤chsten Bundeskanzler der Republik Ã–sterreich empfahl. In einem Stil, der so wirkt als wÃ¤re er im Delirium:

â€Dass die Volkspartei nun das einzig rational Fassbare tut: Sie muss Sebastian Kurz zum Parteiobmann machen, wenn nÃ¶tig hÃ¤nderingend, wenn nÃ¶tig auf den Knien flehend. Und die Ã–VP muss das zu dessen Bedingungen tun: weil er sonst nicht zur VerfÃ¼gung steht und weil weder Kurz noch die Partei ohne diese Bedingungen eine Lebenschance hat".

In Ã–sterreich gibt es ernstzunehmende Verletzungen der Grundrechte. Das belegen die jÃ¤hrlichen Berichte der Ã¶sterreichischen Volksanwaltschaft. Hunderte FÃ¤lle von Angriffen auf das Eigentumsrecht. Die Ã¶sterreichische Bundesregierung setzt keine MaÃŸnahmen. Das Ã¶sterreichische Nachrichtenmagazin profil will davon nicht berichten. Bevor Sebastian Kurz die deutsche Bundeskanzlerin kritisiert, sollte er als Parteivorsitzender der Ã–VP dafÃ¼r sorgen, dass die Grundrechte in Ã–sterreich eingehalten werden.

Sebastian Kurz wurde von Politikberatern und Medien ein charismatisches Image gebaut, das niemals halten kann. Sollte sich ein Wahlerfolg fÃ¼r die â€Liste Kurz" am 15. Oktober einstellen, so wird die ErnÃ¼chterung fÃ¼r Ã–sterreich zwangslÃ¤ufig folgen.

Â© Autor: Johannes SchÃ¼tz, 2017

Zum Autor:

Johannes SchÃ¼tz bereitet eine Buchpublikation vor:

â€Die Enteigner: Der grÃ¶ÃŸte Skandal der Republik Ã–sterreich".

Johannes SchÃ¼tz, Medienwissenschafter und Publizist, war Lehrbeauftragter an der

UniversitÃ¤t Wien (Informationbroking, Recherchetechniken, Medienkompetenz),

Vorstand des Zentrums fÃ¼r Medienkompetenz, Projektleiter bei der Konzeption des

TEXT:
Harvey Weinstein: addict sexuel et agresseur, deux choses bien distinctes 26 fÃ©vrier 2016.

HARVEY WEINSTEIN - InternÃ© dans une clinique en Europe? Ou au beau milieu de l'Arizona? Selon les derniÃ¨res photos parues sur le site TMZ, Harvey Weinstein, le producteur star d'Hollywood serait en passe de commencer une cure de dÃ©sintoxication au sexe dans un Ã©tablissement spÃ©cialisÃ© du sud-ouest des Ã‰tats-Unis.

Jeudi 11 octobre, dans un communiquÃ© officiel, le producteur annonÃ§ait travailler avec des thÃ©rapeutes et planifier un retrait de sa vie professionnelle. "Mon objectif dÃ©sormais est d'apprendre sur moi et de maÃ®triser mes dÃ©mons", Ã©crit-il.

La nouvelle de son admission en Ã©tablissement spÃ©cialisÃ© a soulevÃ© de nombreuses critiques. L'actrice anglaise Emma Thompson interrogÃ©e sur la BBC s'est ainsi insurgÃ©e: "Je ne pense pas qu'on puisse le dÃ©crire comme un addict au sexe, c'est un prÃ©dateur. C'est diffÃ©rent. Il est au sommet d'un systÃ¨me d'harcÃ¨lement, de dÃ©prÃ©ciation, d'intimidation et d'interfÃ©rence. Cela fait partie de notre monde, du monde des femmes, depuis des temps immÃ©mmoriels."

"Les addicts au sexe ne sont pas des agresseurs"

Cette possible dÃ©fense du producteur est en effet assez bancale, voire dangereuse car elle entretient l'idÃ©e que les personnes souffrant de cette addiction sont forcÃ©ment des agresseurs et qu'ils pourraient Ãªtre de par la reconnaissance et le traitement de cette addiction, moins responsables de leurs actions.

Une personne addict au sexe peut Ãªtre l'auteur d'agression sexuelle, une personne sans addiction peut l'Ãªtre aussi.

Laurent Karila, psychiatre spÃ©cialisÃ© en addictologie et qui dirige une consultation spÃ©cialisÃ©e sur le sujet Ã  l'hÃ´pital Brousse Ã  Paris interrogÃ© par Le HuffPost rÃ©itÃ¨re avec force la mÃªme distinction que l'actrice anglaise. "Les addicts au sexe ne sont pas des agresseurs. Cette addiction peut entraÃ®ner des troubles du comportement mais elle ne rend pas de fait agressif."

Christine Barois, mÃ©decin psychiatre Ã  Paris, interrogÃ©e dans Sud Ouest offre une comparaison trÃ¨s parlante pour dÃ©mentir ce raccourci: "Il y a une recherche de plaisir compulsif dans l'addiction sexuelle. Bien Ã©videmment, elle peut pousser le malade Ã  dÃ©passer des barriÃ¨res morales dans le seul but de combler son dÃ©sir. Mais pour prendre un exemple simple, un alcoolique ne va pas dÃ©valiser un magasin d'alcool juste parce qu'il a besoin de boire. Un homme accusÃ© par des douzaines de femmes belles et cÃ©lÃ¨bres d'agressions sexuelles n'a pas le profil d'un addict, mais celui d'un pervers".

L'addiction au sexe n'est pas reconnue dans le manuel des troubles psychiatriques de l'American Psychiatric Association ni dans les classifications internationales malgrÃ© plusieurs tentatives de dÃ©finitions. Cependant son existence est attestÃ©e et des consultations spÃ©cialisÃ©es comme celle de Laurent Karila existent dÃ©sormais. Ce type d'addiction touche plus souvent les hommes que les femmes.

"Dans ce type de violences sexuelles, il ne s'agit pas de sexe, mais de pouvoir"

"L'addiction au sexe, modÃ¨re cependant Laurent Karila, n'est jamais un problÃ¨me isolÃ©, elle peut se doubler de troubles dÃ©pressifs ou anxieux par exemple." L'addiction au sexe se dÃ©finit selon ces quatre critÃ¨res: la perte de temps, des envies irrÃ©sistibles, une perte de contrÃ´le et des consÃ©quences sociales.

Dans le dernier livre de Laurent Karila, "Tous addicts et aprÃ¨s?" aux Ã©ditions Flammarion, qu'il cosigne avec William Lowenstein, mÃ©decin interniste spÃ©cialisÃ© en addictologie, un questionnaire d'Ã©valuation de l'addiction sexuelle Ã©tabli en 2012 est disponible. Il ne vise pas Ã  diagnostiquer cette addiction mais Ã  encourager Ã  consulter un spÃ©cialiste si un patient se reconnaÃ®t dans au moins trois des questionnements:

Evaluez-vous avec l'outil PEACCE (adaptation en langue franÃ§aise par Laurent Karila) Trouvez-vous que vous Ãªtes souvent prÃ©occupÃ© par des pensÃ©es sexuelles? (PensÃ©es) Cachez-vous certains de vos comportements sexuels Ã  votre entourage (partenaire de vie, famille, ami(e)s proches...)? (Entourage) Avez-vous dÃ©jÃ  recherchÃ© de l'aide pour un comportement sexuel que vous n'apprÃ©ciez pas de faire? (Aide) Est-ce que quelqu'un a dÃ©jÃ  Ã©tÃ© heurtÃ© Ã©motionnellement Ã  cause de votre comportement sexuel? (ConsÃ©quences) Vous sentez-vous contrÃ´lÃ© par votre dÃ©sir sexuel? (ContrÃ´le) Vous sentez-vous triste aprÃ¨s Ãªtre passÃ© Ã  l'acte sexuellement (rapports sexuels, internet, autres)? (Emotions)

Tout peut dÃ©clencher un besoin de consommation de sexe expliquent les auteurs de "Tous addicts et aprÃ¨s?", "avoir terminÃ© une grosse journÃ©e de travail, avoir gagnÃ© beaucoup d'argent, Ãªtre angoissÃ©, triste, avoir reÃ§u une bonne ou bien une mauvaise nouvelle... Tout est possible, tout est "prÃ©texte"".

Ainsi donc l'addiction d'Harvey Weinstein est avÃ©rÃ©e, le problÃ¨me rÃ©side ailleurs. Ce n'est pas la quantitÃ© de partenaires avec lesquelles il a eu des rapports sexuels, ni ses envies permanentes de sexe, ni le fait que comme il le dit dans son communiquÃ© officiel il ait essayÃ© de se contrÃ´ler depuis un an sans y parvenir. Il a abusÃ© de sa position de pouvoir pour pouvoir forcer des femmes Ã  se soumettre Ã  ses appÃ©tits sexuels.

"Dans ce type de violences sexuelles, il ne s'agit pas de sexe, mais de pouvoir", assure la sexologue amÃ©ricaine spÃ©cialisÃ©e dans les traumatismes sexuels Samantha Manewitz interrogÃ©e par Slate.

Pour ses victimes, pour les personnes addicts au sexe et pour toute la sociÃ©tÃ©, les actions d'Harvey Weinstein relÃ¨vent de la justice, qu'il soit ou non internÃ© pour addiction. Ses "dÃ©mons" ne peuvent l'innocenter.

SUMMARY:
The BBCâ€™s flagship political programme â€˜Question Timeâ€™ should be overhauled to prevent the â€œvenomâ€ of audiences and to combat its â€œuglyâ€ studio atmosphere, an ex-Corporation boss has suggested.
Roger Mosey, the former head of BBC television news, said â€œCorbynistas, Nats and Ukippersâ€ can dominate audiences while quieter â€œmoderatesâ€ struggle to be heard.
Mosey also suggested reforms to how panellists are chosen to increase the number of impartial experts who can provide context to discussions without political affiliation.
Writing in the New Statesman, Mosey said: â€œCorbynistas, Nats and Ukippers tend to make more noise than the retreating Blairites or Tory moderates, and some editions â€“ notably the one from Plymouth in the summer â€“ have had an ugly atmosphere.â€Article continues below.

TEXT:
The BBCâ€™s flagship political programme â€˜Question Timeâ€™ should be overhauled to prevent the â€œvenomâ€ of audiences and to combat its â€œuglyâ€ studio atmosphere, an ex-Corporation boss has suggested.

Roger Mosey, the former head of BBC television news, said â€œCorbynistas, Nats and Ukippersâ€ can dominate audiences while quieter â€œmoderatesâ€ struggle to be heard.

Mosey also suggested reforms to how panellists are chosen to increase the number of impartial experts who can provide context to discussions without political affiliation.

Writing in the New Statesman, Mosey said: â€œCorbynistas, Nats and Ukippers tend to make more noise than the retreating Blairites or Tory moderates, and some editions â€“ notably the one from Plymouth in the summer â€“ have had an ugly atmosphere.â€

Article continues below.

He added: â€œThere is nothing wrong with fervent believers getting stuck in, but the absence of angry claques of the open-minded shouldnâ€™t put centrist positions at a disadvantage.

â€œIâ€™ve spoken to former panellists who now turn down invitations because of the venom of the responses to them in the studio and on social media.â€

He added that the programmes new editor, Hilary Oâ€™Neill, should consider inviting more impartial figures who can relate facts of a given subject rather than political representatives from relatively minor parties.
TITLE: BBC Question Time Needs Overhaul To Prevent 'Venom' Of Audiences, Ex-News Boss Says

Ambulances outside of Royal Victoria Hospital in Montreal, on April 26, 2015.
On Saturday, a 33-year old man died after falling 5 storeys during a rappelling event in Downtown Montreal.
Montreal's ambulance service says a 33-year-old man has died after falling five storeys from a downtown building.
Stephane Smith of Urgences Sante says the man was participating in a demonstration that involved rappelling down a building using ropes.
The human rights group announced on their Facebook page that the event had been cancelled.
TEXT:
Ambulances outside of Royal Victoria Hospital in Montreal, on April 26, 2015. On Saturday, a 33-year old man died after falling 5 storeys during a rappelling event in Downtown Montreal.

Montreal's ambulance service says a 33-year-old man has died after falling five storeys from a downtown building.

Stephane Smith of Urgences Sante says the man was participating in a demonstration that involved rappelling down a building using ropes.

The event had been part of a fundraiser for Amnesty International Canada's francophone division.

The human rights group announced on their Facebook page that the event had been cancelled.

Paramedics were called to the scene at about 10 a.m. but were unable to revive the man.

Two people were also taken to hospital to be treated for shock.

A spokesperson for Quebec's workplace health and safety board said a team had been sent to investigate the incident.

Diane Thibault said it was unclear whether the man had been a participant or a worker.

Also On HuffPost:
TITLE: 33-Year Old Dies After Falling During Rappelling Event In Montreal

Die Doku-Soap "Die Geissens - Eine schrecklich glamourÃ¶se Familie" geht ab dem 23. Oktober in eine neue Runde. Und bereits am 16. Oktober sind Carmen (52) und ihr Ehemann Robert Geiss (53) in einer speziellen "Undercover am Ballermann"-Ausgabe zu sehen. Trotzdem wollen die beiden ihre TV-PrÃ¤senz offenbar weiter ausbauen. Wie die "Bild"-Zeitung berichtet, plant RTL II eine neue Show mit dem Paar.

Es war die BegrÃ¼ndung des US-PrÃ¤sidenten dafÃ¼r, dem Iran mit neuen Sanktionen zu drohen und das Atomabkommen mit dem Land nicht mehr zertifizieren zu wollen.

Der Redakteur Antony J. Blinken glaubt, Trump "vergrault die VerbÃ¼ndeten der USA und hÃ¤ndigt dem Iran einen Sieg aus."

TEXT:
Protest gegen Donald Trumps "Idiotie" in der US-AuÃŸenpolitik | Jim Bourg / Reuters

Donald Trump hat einen Strategiewechsel zum Iran-Deal angekÃ¼ndigt

Der US-PrÃ¤sident droht mit Sanktionen und will das Atomabkommen mit der Islamischen Republik nicht mehr zertifizieren

Die US-Medien Ã¼ben wegen seiner brachialen Vorgehensweise nun heftige Kritik an Trump

"Die Geschichte hat gezeigt: Je lÃ¤nger wir eine Bedrohung ignorieren, umso grÃ¶ÃŸer wird diese Bedrohung."

Dieses ominÃ¶se Zitat wurde nicht Ã¼ber, sondern von Donald Trump gesagt. Es war die BegrÃ¼ndung des US-PrÃ¤sidenten dafÃ¼r, dem Iran mit neuen Sanktionen zu drohen und das Atomabkommen mit dem Land nicht mehr zertifizieren zu wollen.

Trump trat nicht aus dem Iran-Deal aus, wie es lange befÃ¼rchtet worden war - aber er machte ihn aus US-Sicht wirkungslos. Und erntete dafÃ¼r prompt Kritik.

Von verbÃ¼ndeten Nationen wie Deutschland, Frankreich und GroÃŸbritannien, aber auch von dem GroÃŸteil der US-Medien.

"Trump hÃ¤ndigt dem Iran einen Sieg aus"



Gleich zwei Journalisten kommentierten so etwa in der "New York Times" Trumps Entscheidung, den Iran-Deal herabzustufen. Der Redakteur Antony J. Blinken glaubt, Trump "vergrault die VerbÃ¼ndeten der USA und hÃ¤ndigt dem Iran einen Sieg aus."

Schon Trumps Analyse der Lage im Iran sei vollkommen falsch gewesen, schreibt Blinken. Wie viele Republikaner behauptet Trump, dass das Regime in Teheran lÃ¤ngst kollabiert wÃ¤re, hÃ¤tte sein VorgÃ¤nger Barack Obama den Iran-Deal nicht abgeschlossen - und so die Sanktionen gegen das Land aufgehoben.

Blinken meint: "Eine Behauptung, die TagtrÃ¤umer in Washington seit vier Jahrzehnten jedes Jahr machen." Trumps harte Linie gegen die Islamische Republik helfe nur den Hardlinern in der iranischen Regierung. TatsÃ¤chlich gefÃ¤hrde sie auÃŸerdem sowohl die GlaubwÃ¼rdigkeit als auch die Sicherheit der USA, schlussfolgert Blinken.

Sein Kollege Bret Stephens formuliert es drastischer: "Donald Trump hat eine Geisel genommen." Gemeint ist der Iran-Deal, dessen Scheitern der PrÃ¤sident durch seine rabiate Vorgehensweise in Kauf nehme.

Stephens rÃ¤umt ein, dass die US-Politik gegenÃ¼ber dem Iran zu festgefahren sei und Trump durch seine Entscheidung Bewegung in die Beziehungen der beiden LÃ¤nder gebracht habe. Gleichzeitig fÃ¼rchtet er aber das Risiko eines ausbrechenden Krieges - und die Tatsache, dass es an einer instabilen Person wie Donald Trump ist, einen solchen zu verhindern.

"Trumps 'neue Strategie' zum Iran ist weder neu noch eine Strategie"

Das Nachrichtenportal "Vox" beurteilt Trumps Attacke auf den Iran-Deal noch kritischer als die "New York Times". Es bezeichnet die VorstÃ¶ÃŸe des US-PrÃ¤sidenten gegen den Iran als "Abrechnung des Grolls". "Trumps 'neue Strategie' zum Iran ist weder neu noch eine Strategie", schreibt "Vox".

Weder die Sanktionen gegen die Nationalgarde des Irans, die Trump angekÃ¼ndigt hatte, noch die Blockade des Iran-Deals seien Schritte, die ein klares Ziel im Umgang mit der Islamischen Republik definieren wÃ¼rden. "Vox" zitiert hierzu den Iran-Experten Hussein Banai, einen Politikwissenschaftler von der University of Indiana: "Das ist ein ausgestreckter Mittelfinger an den Anspruch der USA auf eine FÃ¼hrungsrolle in der Welt."

Die "Washington Post" schreibt in dieser Hinsicht von einer "Dummheit" Trumps. Der US-PrÃ¤sident habe sich mit Teheran auf ein gefÃ¤hrliches und sinnloses Spiel mit dem Feuer eingelassen. Jetzt sei es am US-Kongress, nicht die gleiche Dummheit wie Trump zu begehen, indem er dessen Politik mittrÃ¤gt: "Der Kongress sollte den Status Quo, so viele Fehler dieser auch hat, nicht verletzen - denn er verhindert eine weitere nukleare Krise."

Trump bleibt sorglos

Vor dieser fÃ¼rchtet sich auch die Londoner Zeitung "The Guardian". "Die nun entstehende diplomatische Lage ist beispiellos", schreibt die US-Redaktion des Blattes. "Ein US-PrÃ¤sident streitet sich nicht nur mit seinen eigenen engsten Beratern, sondern zugleich mit allen entscheidenden Akteuren einer ernsten Krise der internationalen Sicherheit - einschlieÃŸlich sÃ¤mtlicher europÃ¤ischer VerbÃ¼ndeter."

Aus "Amerika zuerst" wÃ¼rde derzeit "Amerika allein" - "und das in einem Moment, in dem klar wird, dass die USA allein weit weniger Macht hat, als sie denkt."

Donald Trump scheint dies noch nicht klar geworden zu sein. Er feiert seine harte Linie gegen den Iran als Erfolg und Korrektur der aus seiner Sicht laschen Politik seines VorgÃ¤ngers Barack Obama. Bei einer Rede am Freitagabend ging Trump so weit, zu behaupten: "Meine PrÃ¤sidentschaft ist dem Zeitplan weit voraus."

Angesichts der bisherigen katastrophalen Fehler Trumps in der AuÃŸenpolitik lÃ¤sst sich sagen: Das hat etwas von Ignoranz.





(lm)
TITLE: "Ein ausgestreckter Mittelfinger": US-Medien kritisieren Donald Trump fÃ¼r seine Entscheidung zum Iran-Deal

TEXT:
Acht Jahre lang soll Marc Anthony (49, "El Cantante") Ã¼ber den Tisch gezogen worden sein. Denn wie das US-Portal "TMZ" berichtet, habe sich der SÃ¤nger mit puerto-ricanischen Wurzeln unwissentlich in die HÃ¤nde eines BetrÃ¼gers begeben, der bei einer WirtschaftsprÃ¼fungsfirma in New York arbeiten soll. Ihm vertraute der SÃ¤nger den direkten Zugang zu all seinen Bankkonten und Kreditkarten an. Ein Fehler, der Anthony letztendlich um ganze 2,5 Millionen US-Dollar (mehr als 2,1 Millionen Euro) gebracht haben soll.

Seit 2009 soll sich der Angestellte illegal an den American Express Kreditkarten des SÃ¤ngers bedient haben. Ein luxuriÃ¶ser Lebensstil sowie nÃ¤chtliche Etablissement-Besuche zahlen sich schlieÃŸlich nicht von alleine. Anthony selbst, habe von dem jahrelangen Betrug nichts mitbekommen. Erst durch eine interne ÃœberprÃ¼fung des Wirtschaftsunternehmens seien die UnregelmÃ¤ÃŸigkeiten auf den Konten des 49-JÃ¤hrigen ans Licht gekommen. Sollte sich der Verdacht gegen den Mann erhÃ¤rten, droht diesem eine Haftstrafe von bis zu 25 Jahren.

TEXT:
A British man on the final leg of a so-called â€œmiddle-aged gap yearâ€ with his wife has fallen to his death in India.

Local reports said Roger Stotesbury was trying to take a selfie at a temple in Orchha, about 160 miles south of the Taj Mahal, when he plummeted roughly 30ft on Friday.

Press Association Roger Stotesbury and his wife Hilary

The Times of India said Stotesbury, from Oxford, was â€œstanding almost on the edge of a wall on the second floor of the templeâ€ when he fell, the Press Association reports.

Heading into the Australian Outback - latest leg of my round-the-world gap year pic.twitter.com/vXtOBrewFE â€” Roger Stotesbury (@RogerStotesbury) August 4, 2017

The documentary-maker, a father-of-two who said he wanted to â€œdie young as late as possibleâ€, was in the last few weeks of his travels around the world with his wife Hilary.

A Foreign Office spokesman said: â€œWe are providing assistance to the family of a British man following his tragic death in India on October 13.

â€œOur thoughts are with the family at this sad time.â€

Writing on their blog, ourmiddleagedgapyear.wordpress.com, the couple said they were renting out their home and trying to live on Â£100 a day.

They said: â€œWe are Hilary and Roger a married couple from England/Scotland who are in their mid fifties.

â€œHilaryâ€™s motto is â€˜just do itâ€™ whilst Rogerâ€™s is â€˜to die young as late as possibleâ€™.

â€œWe took the view that on your deathbed you never wish youâ€™d spent more time in the office.

â€œWeâ€™ve seen our two kids off into the wider world and we have no more caring responsibilities for our parents.

â€œSo we thought now is the time to take a gap year and travel whilst we still have the health and energy. After all you only live once.â€

The couple started with a two-month tour of Italy before taking in south and north America, Australia, and several Asian countries. India was intended to be their final stop, according to the blog.

Maybe the windiest place in the world. Glacier Grey at Torres del Paine #chile pic.twitter.com/g8GXoISgFW â€” Roger Stotesbury (@RogerStotesbury) January 29, 2017

Describing their motivations for the project, they said: â€œRather than drift into comfortable retirement we wanted to do something different.

â€œAlso there are many parts of the world we want to see and we figured continual travel would be more of a switch off and better value for money.

â€œOne aim is to experience countries as travellers rather than time-conscious tourists.

â€œWe had kids soon after we married so hadnâ€™t travelled much as a couple and wanted to experience living abroad for an extended time.â€

The couple posted pictures of their visit to the Taj Mahal on their website, a day before the tragedy.
TITLE: Briton Roger Stotesbury Dies 'After Falling From Indian Temple Trying To Take Selfie'

SUMMARY:
The call would have cost some Universal Credit claimants more than 11 percent of their weekly allowance, which is meant to â€œhelp with living costsâ€.
HuffPost UK Calls to the Universal Credit helpline are charged at up to 55p per minute from mobiles in England.
Universal Credit claimants without children and aged under 25 take home just Â£62.94 a week, according to the governmentâ€™s website.
It has also been revealed that calls to the Universal Credit helpline are free for Welsh language speakers.
Universal Credit is due to be rolled out more widely in the coming months, despite persistent reports of problems.
TEXT:
Universal Credit claimants languish on hold to a government helpline while racking up bills as high as Â£16, without the option of an immediate call back, contradicting claims made by Downing Street.

One call placed by HuffPost UK to the dedicated 0345 number on Wednesday afternoon took 12 and a half minutes to be answered in person, at which point an advisor refused to call back straight away due to data protection rules.

The call would have cost some Universal Credit claimants more than 11 percent of their weekly allowance, which is meant to â€œhelp with living costsâ€.

It came amid a growing row over the policy, as Theresa May was earlier forced to defend the up to 55p per minute call charges during Prime Ministerâ€™s Questions.

HuffPost UK Calls to the Universal Credit helpline are charged at up to 55p per minute from mobiles in England. Welsh language calls are free

Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn urged the PM to â€œshow some humanityâ€ and scrap the cost altogether.

The PMâ€™s official spokesperson later suggested there was an immediate call back option, with advisors able to return calls at no cost to the claimant â€œstraight awayâ€.

But Downing Streetâ€™s claim prompted derision from Labour, with Corbynâ€™s spokesperson saying: â€œThe No.10 line that you can ask for a â€˜call backâ€™ is a joke as theyâ€™ve cut so many staff you canâ€™t get through and are held in a queue.â€

And during HuffPostâ€™s call, our reporter was asked to input information via an automated answering service, yet at no time did the service ask for a telephone number for a call back.

After three minutes and 11 seconds, the call was placed in a queue as â€˜Springâ€™ from Vivaldiâ€™s Four Seasons played on loop.

â€˜You can call back laterâ€™

Automatic messages heard in the queue also undermined Number 10â€²s defence.

â€œAll our lines are still busy. Please hold and we will answer your call as soon as we can. Or if you prefer you can call back later,â€ a voice said at regular intervals.

After 12 minutes and 30 seconds, the call was eventually answered by an advisor who said they could not call the reporter back straight away due to data protection rules.

â€œFirstly, I need to know if you are registered with us and complete necessary security checks,â€ they said.

HuffPostâ€™s call ended after 13 minutes and 40 seconds - a total cost to callers on some mobile phone networks of Â£7.51.

Universal Credit claimants without children and aged under 25 take home just Â£62.94 a week, according to the governmentâ€™s website.

The helpline assists those who are confused by the new system or who need to register changes in circumstances.

Some 55,000 calls a week were made to the helpline during August, according to a freedom of information request (pdf).

The request revealed callers have experienced a â€œmaximumâ€ wait time of 29 minutes, costing Â£15.95 to those on mobiles.

â€˜Money I could be using for foodâ€™

â€˜Sueâ€™, a 54-year-old claimant explained to Citizens Advice Bureau (pdf) that she phoned the helpline because she couldnâ€™t use a computer.

â€œThe process is complicated if you arenâ€™t very good at using computers,â€ she said. â€œGoing to the job centre and using wifi all costs money I could be using for food.â€

Some 30 percent of respondents to a Citizens Advice survey of claimants reported calling the helpline more than 10 times.

An earlier call made by HuffPost dropped out unexpectedly after two minutes and 11 seconds, at a cost of Â£1.20 to those on a mobile.

It has also been revealed that calls to the Universal Credit helpline are free for Welsh language speakers.

Criticism has mounted of the new benefit system, which replaces Job Seekerâ€™s Allowance and combines all welfare entitlements into one monthly payment.

Trials of the policy have seen many claimants fall into arrears with rent payments and face homelessness as delays in the first payments of Universal Credit force others to use loan sharks and food banks.

It has been widely condemned by politicians on both sides of the House of Commons, and the issue dominated Wednesdayâ€™s PMQs.

Universal Credit is due to be rolled out more widely in the coming months, despite persistent reports of problems.

It comes as Tory minister Liz Truss appeared on the BBCâ€™s Daily Politics, urging people to go to a job centre to seek advice if they could not afford the charge.

In an awkward exchange, presenter Andrew Neil pointed out hard-pressed families could not afford the time.
TITLE: Revealed: What Really Happens When You Call The Universal Credit Helpline

El riesgo estÃ¡ en que parte de los nitratos que se ingieren pueden transformarse en nitritos en el organismo y estos reaccionan con los aminoÃ¡cidos presentes en el estÃ³mago dando lugar a la formaciÃ³n de nitrosaminas, que son sustancias cancerÃ­genas.

TEXT:
La OrganizaciÃ³n de Consumidores y Usuarios (OCU) ha pedido que se revise a la baja las cantidades de algunos aditivos â€”nitratos y nitritosâ€” en productos cÃ¡rnicos cocidos y curados tras analizar casi medio centenar de este tipo de alimentos y constatar que son seguros.

En un comunicado, la OCU explica que en el caso de los productos cÃ¡rnicos cocidos y curados estos aditivos se utilizan para garantizar la higiene, debido a que estos alimentos requieren un cuidado "muy especial" durante todo el proceso de elaboraciÃ³n y conservaciÃ³n.

El riesgo estÃ¡ en que parte de los nitratos que se ingieren pueden transformarse en nitritos en el organismo y estos reaccionan con los aminoÃ¡cidos presentes en el estÃ³mago dando lugar a la formaciÃ³n de nitrosaminas, que son sustancias cancerÃ­genas.

El cocinar productos cÃ¡rnicos con nitritos aÃ±adidos tambiÃ©n se pueden formar nitrosaminas, aunque en este caso se produce en menor proporciÃ³n que durante la digestiÃ³n.

Por ello, la OCU ha analizado 48 productos cÃ¡rnicos y el nivel de este tipo de aditivos, y ha comprobado que los fuets, el jamÃ³n curado y los chorizos son los que mÃ¡s nitratos tienen, mientras que las salchichas cocidas son las que contienen mÃ¡s nitritos.

Los fuets, el jamÃ³n curado y los chorizos son los que mÃ¡s nitratos tienen, mientras que las salchichas cocidas son las que contienen mÃ¡s nitritos

No obstante, el "valor mÃ¡ximo encontrado en cada uno de ellos en ningÃºn caso superaba el lÃ­mite legal establecido" y en 22 de ellos el producto final no contenÃ­a ni nitratos, ni nitritos.

SegÃºn la organizaciÃ³n de consumidores, de los productos analizados no solo los que contienen estos aditivos han resultado seguros, "sino tambiÃ©n los que no los llevan, cuya higiene y conservaciÃ³n no se han visto mermados en ningÃºn caso".

La OCU ha instado a los fabricantes a que hagan lo posible por mejorar los procesos de producciÃ³n "evitando aditivos innecesarios y potencialmente peligrosos para la salud".

A las personas que consuman este tipo de productos, les pide que lo hagan con moderaciÃ³n ya que algunos contienen aditivos y mucha sal y "a pesar de que los niveles no sobrepasan los lÃ­mites legales, deben ser considerados como un alimento de consumo ocasional".
TITLE: La seria advertencia de la OCU sobre el fuet y las salchichas cocidas

TEXT:

FOOTBALL - Nasser Al-KhelaÃ¯fi, PDG de beIN Media et patron du PSG, se retrouve sous les feux croisÃ©s de la police italienne, pour une villa en Sardaigne -moyen de corrompre JÃ©rÃ´me Valcke, ex-N.2 de la Fifa- et de la Fifa elle mÃªme, qui a ouvert une enquÃªte visant le Qatari.

Une troisiÃ¨me personne visÃ©e par l'enquÃªte suisse

Valcke, 57 ans, mis en examen, avait quittÃ© libre jeudi soir les bureaux du MPC Ã  Berne. Il dÃ©clare dans le quotidien franÃ§ais L'Ã‰quipe de vendredi n'avoir "rien reÃ§u de Nasser": "il n'y a jamais eu d'Ã©change entre Nasser et moi. Jamais".

L'Ã©pouse de Valcke, qui l'accompagnait en Suisse, "a Ã©galement Ã©tÃ© entendue par les enquÃªteurs mais Ã  Lausanne", avait-on appris d'une autre source judiciaire. Le couple Valcke devait ensuite rejoindre Barcelone dÃ¨s jeudi soir oÃ¹ il est dÃ©sormais domiciliÃ©, selon les conseils du couple.

Une troisiÃ¨me personne, active "dans le domaine des droits sportifs", est Ã©galement visÃ©e mais le MPC n'a pas communiquÃ© son identitÃ©. Selon Le Parisien il s'agit de l'homme d'affaires grec Konstantinos Nteris. La police grecque Ã©voque juste des perquisitions jeudi, sans donner de nom.

Les ennuis s'accumulent pour Al-KhelaÃ¯fi, puisque le PSG, qu'il prÃ©side depuis le rachat du club par un fond souverain du Qatar en 2011, fait l'objet d'une enquÃªte de l'UEFA. Le club est soupÃ§onnÃ© d'avoir enfreint les rÃ¨gles du fair-play financier - ne pas dÃ©penser plus qu'on ne gagne mÃªme en prÃ©sence d'un actionnaire/mÃ©cÃ¨ne richissime - avec les acquisitions de Neymar (222 M EUR) et MbappÃ© (180 M EUR).

MEDIAS - Emmanuel Macron offre Ã  David Pujadas une double revanche, en accordant au groupe TF1 l'exclusivitÃ© de sa premiÃ¨re interview tÃ©lÃ©visÃ©e en direct de l'ElysÃ©e, ce dimanche 15 octobre. EvincÃ© de la prÃ©sentation du 20-Heures de France 2, le nouveau prÃ©sentateur de la tranche 18h-20h sur LCI profitera, aux cÃ´tÃ©s d'Anne-Claire Coudray et de Gilles Bouleau pour TF1, d'une primeur refusÃ©e Ã  son ancien employeur.

Outre ce camouflet infligÃ© au service public de l'information, le choix de l'ElysÃ©e semble aller Ã  contre-courant de... son propre porte-parole, Bruno Roger-Petit, qui avant de rejoindre officiellement le ChÃ¢teau dÃ©but septembre, Ã©trillait rÃ©guliÃ¨rement David Pujadas dans ses tweets (subitement supprimÃ©s) et ses chroniques. Se faisant plus mordant quelques jours plus tard sur le plateau de Yann BarthÃ¨s sur TMC, David Pujadas a renvoyÃ© les accusations de complaisance journalistique Ã  l'expÃ©diteur. Comble de l'ironie, c'est Ã  Bruno Roger-Petit que revint la tÃ¢che d'annoncer sur Twitter ce vendredi 13 octobre que le journaliste honni recueillera finalement "la pensÃ©e complexe" prÃ©sidentielle.

SUMMARY:
Inside 'Molar City'Most of the residents and employees I met during my research in Los Algdones were grateful for the much-needed economic benefits of the dental tourism industry.
For example, employees work long hours to promote Los Algodones' reputation for their employers as an ideal site to purchase dental care.
Local residents struggle to access dental careMy research also revealed that dental clinic owners' concerns about reputation can decrease access to dental care for local residents.
Overall, the "dental Shangri-la of the Mexican desert" is only an oasis for those able and willing to travel and pay for dental care.
It suggests the need for better global regulation of dental tourism and medical tourism more widely.
TEXT:
By Krystyna Adams, Simon Fraser University

The town of Los Algodones in Mexico is nicknamed "Molar City." It has a population of just 6,000 people and, shockingly, it has more than 500 practising dentists. This has produced an intense clustering of dental clinics within a four-block radius.

Many of these dentists chose to work in this town because of the tourist traffic, given its proximity to the Mexico-United States border. Thousands of Canadian and American tourists park their cars and walk across the border into Los Algodones to spend the day souvenir shopping, eating and drinking in the local restaurants, and purchasing alcohol, prescription drugs and dental care at lower costs than available back home.

Less than a block after crossing into Mexico, U.S. tourists are bombarded with billboards touting the dental services in Los Algodones, Mexico, as pictured here March 2, 2009.

In 2015 and 2016, I spent four months living in Los Algodones conducting interviews and participating in local events for a doctoral research project in health sciences at Simon Fraser University. My work investigates dental travel as part of the wider phenomenon of "medical tourism" â€” an industry that is growing rapidly as more and more patients seek access to new or more affordable medical treatments outside of their countries of residence.

My research raises concerns about exploitative industry practices in Los Algodones, Mexico. These include poor working conditions and discriminatory practices for employees in dental clinics, harassment of Indigenous street vendors and lack of access to dental care for local residents.

Inside 'Molar City'

Most of the residents and employees I met during my research in Los Algdones were grateful for the much-needed economic benefits of the dental tourism industry. But I also heard concerns and frustrations from members of the local population. They felt that many of the industry activities were unfair and difficult to change.

One interviewee explained how dental tourists often come with prejudiced assumptions about Mexico, stating: "We see a lot of racism [...] people trying to come here and saying, 'OK, it is Mexico. I can ask for anything and pay you less.'"

Local residents and industry employees felt that dental tourists' perceptions of Mexico as unsafe and underdeveloped are driving poor working conditions and discriminatory practices.

For example, employees work long hours to promote Los Algodones' reputation for their employers as an ideal site to purchase dental care. Some also said they had experienced harassment from dental tourists negotiating lower prices and faster care.

Harassment of Indigenous vendors

Clinic employees and local residents also experience stressful interactions in the industry to meet the expectations of clinic owners. Some owners encourage employees to minimize their Mexican accents. This is done to distance Los Algodones from prejudiced perceptions of Mexico as an underdeveloped place with inferior medical care.

One participant described how a dental clinic owner offered to pay him to dump buckets of water on the heads of Indigenous souvenir vendors working near his clinic. Along with harassment, clinic owners also encourage Indigenous vendors to "stay cool, sell stuff cheap and smile to people." Many owners worry that the presence of Indigenous vendors might deter tourists by representing the underdeveloped Mexico of tourists' imaginations.

Most local residents cannot afford this type of care.

Local residents struggle to access dental care

My research also revealed that dental clinic owners' concerns about reputation can decrease access to dental care for local residents. Clinic owners suggested they're too busy marketing their services and treating foreign patients to treat many locals. Some owners are using free X-rays to entice tourists, who shop around for their ideal care.

Most of the dental services in Los Algodones are also focused on the provision of major restorative treatment rather than preventative care, given the needs of dental tourists. Most local residents cannot afford this type of care. This is concerning as there are limited publicly funded dental care options available in this region of Mexico.

Overall, the "dental Shangri-la of the Mexican desert" is only an oasis for those able and willing to travel and pay for dental care. For many, the industry provides much-needed employment. But this might be stressful, unfair work for individuals unable to use the dental oasis for their own health needs.

The need for global regulation

Participation in the global medical tourism industry is increasing and research shows that this growth raises serious ethical challenges, at least in the industry's current form. Researchers have raised concerns about the negative impacts on the health of local people who live and work in these medical tourism destinations.

My in-depth investigation of industry practices in the town of Los Algodones provides more evidence to support these concerns. It suggests the need for better global regulation of dental tourism and medical tourism more widely.

This regulation is needed to avoid competition between industry sites driving down labour standards in the global industry and diverting health resources away from populations in need. This regulation could enforce acceptable work conditions to avoid a race-to-the-bottom effect as industry sites try to attract customers to lower-cost, desirable medical care.

More information about these concerns could also help individuals participating in the industry to avoid harmful practices. It could remind medical tourists that cost savings for care might come at a cost to fair labour standards â€” and that they should allow sufficient time for treatment and be prepared to pay fair prices.

Krystyna Adams, Doctoral student in Health Sciences and SFU Medical Tourism Research Group, Simon Fraser University

A version of this article was originally published on The Conversation. Read the original article.

Follow HuffPost Canada Blogs on Facebook
TITLE: There's Another Word For Canadian Dental Tourism: Exploitation

Ce sont des images fortes, je ne vois pas pourquoi on devrait s'en passer Â», s'empresse de renchÃ©rir JosÃ©-Louis Bocquet qui a aussi rÃ©digÃ© des biographies Ã©crites, dont une sur son parrain, le grand cinÃ©aste Henri-Georges Clouzot, loin d'Ãªtre traditionnelles. Â« Non ce qu'on veut Ã©viter ce sont les clichÃ©s mille fois racontÃ©s Â» prÃ©cise-t-il citant au passage l'exemple de la fameuse danse sauvage de la Revue nÃ¨gre qui lui a permis de triompher dans la Ville LumiÃ¨re. Ce qui nous permettait d'aborder sa jeunesse Ã  Saint-Louis et ses premiers pas dans le show-business. Â» L'anecdote devient alors le prÃ©texte pour explorer d'autres facettes de son excitante vie.

Excitant, le mot est juste d'autant plus que dans son cas, il est difficile de diffÃ©rencier le vrai du faux, tant la lÃ©gende s'est substituÃ©e Ã  la rÃ©alitÃ©. SUMMARY:
One of those issues is ocean pollution and in particular the damage we are doing by the vast amounts of plastic washing up all over our shores.
According to The Ellen MacArthur Foundation, without change, all the plastic in the ocean could weigh more than all the fish by 2050.
As a start we have removed plastic bottles, cups, cutlery and straws from all our sites and replaced them with corn starch, or paper alternatives.
You wouldn't start mopping up the water... you would turn off the tap.
Start by turning off the plastic tap.
TEXT:
Last week, politicians, business leaders and environmental groups from over 100 countries gathered in Malta for the EU's Our Ocean conference.



It was the fourth annual conference, having begun in 2014 as a response to the dire state of our ocean's health and the recognition of the importance of the seas and oceans in our lives.



With over three billion people directly depending on our oceans for their livelihoods the issue of ocean health cannot be ignored. Yet if you look around the world you cannot escape the fact that the state of our oceans has never been more precarious.



So at Malta, it was encouraging to hear from many people who wanted to take action; pledging a series of wide-ranging commitments to start reversing the damage done to our oceans.



HRH The Prince of Wales announced a bold blue economy initiative, with policies to support sustainable development. China committed to the creation of 66 'blue bays' around its coastline to protect marine life. And Carrefour announced that by 2020, half of all fish that it sells will come from sustainable sources.



The worrying truth is that the oceans face a range of issues, largely man made. One of those issues is ocean pollution and in particular the damage we are doing by the vast amounts of plastic washing up all over our shores. Our oceans are now drowning in plastic.



According to The Ellen MacArthur Foundation, without change, all the plastic in the ocean could weigh more than all the fish by 2050. The average UK household uses one rubbish truck's worth of single use plastics a year - contributing to the eight million tonnes of plastic that enters our oceans annually.



This is both dire and depressing, and the duty to act never so urgent.



At Sky we are determined to make a stand. Our Sky Ocean Rescue campaign will continue to shine a spotlight on the issues our oceans face, why they are happening and what can be done about it.



We have committed to transform our business and eradicate all single-use plastics from our operations, products and supply chains by 2020. As a start we have removed plastic bottles, cups, cutlery and straws from all our sites and replaced them with corn starch, or paper alternatives. Everyday stuff that soon adds up - we've already reduced our plastic bottle use by 300,000 in just nine months



We are also creating an Ocean Rescue Innovation Fund, anchored by our own capital to help spur innovation in this area. The fund will look for businesses and start-ups that are developing ideas and technology to eradicate single-use plastics from supply chains right across the globe and to stop plastic from ending up in the ocean.



We are inviting others to co-invest with us because we believe that by finding and funding the best ideas from around the world, we will discover new ways to help to solve this problem. By harnessing the capital, expertise and voice of the business community we can, together, accelerate innovation to reverse some of the damage already done.



The reality is not enough is being done by enough businesses. It needs us all to play our part. As an island nation, we are never more than 70 miles from the coast. This could not be more important. Three million people live on the coastline, hundreds of thousands more rely on the ocean for employment and almost every one of us for the food it provides.



This is a vast and complex issue, but what gives me hope is that there are some relatively easy, everyday things businesses can do. If you walked into a bathroom overflowing with water, what would you do? You wouldn't start mopping up the water... you would turn off the tap. So what can businesses do? Start by turning off the plastic tap. We have started. But we need more businesses to join us - now.
TITLE: Why We Need To Turn Off The Plastic Tap

TEXT:
Las rÃ©plicas del terremoto que sacudiÃ³ Hollywood hace unos dÃ­as no dejan de sentirse. El desencadenante fue un artÃ­culo de The New York Times que destapaba el supuesto acoso y abuso sexual por parte del poderoso productor Harvey Weinstein a distintas actrices a lo largo de dos dÃ©cadas, al que rÃ¡pidamente se sumÃ³ rÃ¡pidamente otro reportaje de The New Yorker. Tras su publicaciÃ³n, mÃ¡s intÃ©rpretes de la talla de Angelina Jolie, Gwyneth Paltrow o Cara Delevingne lo han seÃ±alado y la lista de mujeres que lo acusan supera la veintena.

Las reacciones en la meca del cine no han cesado y numerosas voces han asegurado que estos comportamientos no son infrecuentes. Personalidades que han trabajado con Ã©l, desde PenÃ©lope Cruz a Meryl Streep, hasta George Clooney o Ben Affleck, pasando por Hillary Clinton se han pronunciado al respecto. AdemÃ¡s, han comenzado a salir a la luz no pocos guiÃ±os velados en distintas entrevistas y eventos de los Ãºltimos aÃ±os que dan a entender que la industria conocÃ­a los rumores sobre el productor y su conducta.

Estas son las claves para entender el caso que a Weinstein, quien ha reconocido los hechos, le ha costado su trabajo y su matrimonio y que podrÃ­a suponerle la expulsiÃ³n de la Academia de Hollywood.

QUIÃ‰N ES HARVEY WEINSTEIN

QuizÃ¡ su cara no te suene demasiado, pero este productor cinematogrÃ¡fico de 65 aÃ±os es una de las personas mÃ¡s poderosas de Hollywood. Junto a su hermano Bob fundÃ³ las productoras Miramax y The Weinstein Company.

EstÃ¡ detrÃ¡s de pelÃ­culas tan conocidas como Pulp Fiction, Shakespeare in Love, El indomable Will Hunting, Chicago o las sagas Kill Bill, Scream y Scary Movie, entre muchas otras (en Imdb figuran 331 tÃ­tulos de los que es productor).

POR QUÃ‰ SE HABLA DE Ã‰L ESTOS DÃAS

Por un artÃ­culo publicado en The New York Times el jueves 5 de octubre titulado Harvey Weinstein pagÃ³ para poner fin a denuncias por acoso sexual durante dÃ©cadas. En el texto se documentaban hasta ocho acuerdos extrajudiciales en demandas interpuestas por antiguas empleadas y asociadas, como las actrices Ashley Judd (Heat, Divergente) y Rose McGowan (Scream, Death Proof).

Judd relatÃ³ al diario que hace 20 aÃ±os Weinstein la invitÃ³ a lo que ella pensaba que era un desayuno de trabajo en un hotel en Beverly Hills, pero Ã©l la hizo subir a su habitaciÃ³n, donde apareciÃ³ en albornoz y le preguntÃ³ si le podÃ­a dar un masaje o mirarlo mientras se duchaba.

El artÃ­culo tambiÃ©n hablaba de un acuerdo alcanzado en 1997 entre Weinstein y Rose McGowan, cuando Ã©sta tenÃ­a 23 aÃ±os, tras un episodio en la habitaciÃ³n de un hotel durante el Festival de Sundance del que no se daban mÃ¡s detalles.

LA DISCULPA DE WEINSTEIN

El mismo 5 de octubre Harvey Weinstein enviÃ³ un comunicado a The New York Times en respuesta al artÃ­culo. En Ã©l, seÃ±alaba que alcanzÃ³ "la mayorÃ­a de edad en los 60 y los 70, cuando las normas de comportamiento en los lugares de trabajo eran diferentes". "Me doy cuenta de que el modo en el que me he comportado con mis colegas en el pasado ha causado mucho daÃ±o y me disculpo sinceramente por ello", aÃ±adiÃ³.

Weistein tambiÃ©n apuntÃ³ que se habÃ­a puesto en manos de terapeutas y reiterÃ³ que "respetaba a las mujeres y lamentaba lo que pasÃ³". TambiÃ©n citÃ³ una letra de una canciÃ³n del rapero Jay Z para pedir "una segunda oportunidad".

WEINSTEIN, DESPEDIDO

The Weinstein Company despidiÃ³ a Harvey Weinstein el domingo 7 de octubre "tras las informaciones acerca de su mala conducta". La decisiÃ³n la tomaron los cuatro miembros de la junta de la compaÃ±Ã­a (incluido Bob Weinstein, su hermano). Un quinto socio habÃ­a dimitido el dÃ­a anterior.

SegÃºn recoge The Independent, en las horas previas Weinstein se habÃ­a dirigido por email a los grandes ejecutivos de Hollywood, suplicÃ¡ndoles que lo ayudaran porque su empresa lo iba a despedir: "Permitidme resucitar con una segunda oportunidad [...] Si podÃ©is, necesito que enviÃ©is una carta a mi Gmail personal. La carta serÃ­a para la junta y no la verÃ­a nadie mÃ¡s. Lo que el consejo estÃ¡ tratando de hacer no sÃ³lo estÃ¡ mal, sino que podrÃ­a ser ilegal y destruirÃ­a la empresa".

LA REACCIÃ“N DE HOLLYWOOD

Tras las publicaciÃ³n del artÃ­culo se han sucedido multitud de reacciones en la industria. Muchos actores, algunos que habÃ­an trabajado codo con codo con Weinstein, otros que habÃ­an oÃ­do rumores sobre su comportamiento hace tiempo y algunas actrices que han vivido acoso en Hollywood, se han pronunciado sobre el caso. AquÃ­ puedes repasar los principales testimonios de manera cronolÃ³gica:

LENA DUNHAM

El lunes 9 de octubre la actriz y creadora de la serie Girls escribiÃ³ una carta en The New York Times lamentÃ¡ndose del silencio de los hombres de la industria a la hora de condenar el acoso sexual en Hollywood. "El abuso, las amenazas y la coerciÃ³n han sido la norma para muchas mujeres que trataban de hacer negocio o de hacer arte [...] Hollywood tiene otra oportunidad de hacer una declaraciÃ³n ruidosa sobre lo que debemos y no debemos tolerar como sociedad". Dunham tambiÃ©n recordÃ³ que ella misma habÃ­a vivido un episodio de acoso por parte de un director.

MERYL STREEP

La oscarizada Meryl Streep enviÃ³â€‹â€‹â€‹ una declaraciÃ³n a la ediciÃ³n estadounidense del HuffPost el martes 10 de octubre. Streep, que habÃ­a trabajado con Ã©l en pelÃ­culas como Agosto y La dama de hierro, asegurÃ³ que no estaba al tanto de su comportamiento: "Yo no sabÃ­a nada de los mencionados agravios: no me constaban sus compensaciones econÃ³micas a otras actrices y compaÃ±eras, no sabÃ­a nada de sus reuniones en sus habitaciones de hotel, en su cuarto de baÃ±o ni tampoco de cualquier otro comportamiento inapropiado y coercitivo". La actriz calificÃ³ de "heroÃ­nas" a las mujeres que habÃ­an dado su testimonio para destapar el caso.

JENNIFER LAWRENCE

La actriz consiguiÃ³ el Oscar a Mejor actriz en 2013 por El lado bueno de las cosas, cinta producida por Weinstein. DespuÃ©s de que se destapara el escÃ¡ndalo, Lawrence ha asegurado en un comunicado emitido el 9 de octubre que no sabÃ­a nada: "TrabajÃ© con Weinstein hace cinco aÃ±os y no experimentÃ© ninguna forma de acoso [...] Mi corazÃ³n estÃ¡ con todas esas mujeres afectadas por esas desagradables acciones. Y quiero darles las gracias por haber dado un valiente paso adelante".

KATE WINSLET

Winslet tambiÃ©n consiguiÃ³ el Oscar gracias a una producciÃ³n de The Weinstein Company, El lector (2009). En un comunicado enviado a Variety el lunes 9, seÃ±alÃ³: "Esperaba que esas historias fueran rumores, tal vez hemos sido todos ingenuos. Eso me enfada mucho. No se debe tolerar este trato degradante y vil a las mujeres en ningÃºn lugar de trabajo en ningÃºn lugar del mundo".

GLENN CLOSE

"Estoy aquÃ­, profundamente molesta, reconociÃ©ndome a mÃ­ misma que sÃ­, que durante muchos aÃ±os he sido consciente de los vagos rumores de que Harvey Weinstein tenÃ­a un patrÃ³n de comportamiento inadecuado hacia las mujeres. Harvey siempre ha sido decente conmigo pero ahora que los rumores se corroboran me siento enojada y profundamente triste", dijo Glenn Close a The New York Times el 9 de octubre.

JESSICA CHASTAIN

A travÃ©s de un tuit, la actriz â€”que nunca ha trabajado con Weinsteinâ€” afirmÃ³ el lunes 9: "Estaba avisada desde el principio. Las historias estaban por todas partes. Negarlo es crear el ambiente para que vuelva a ocurrir".

I was warned from the beginning. The stories were everywhere. To deny that is to create an enviornment for it to happen again. â€” Jessica Chastain (@jes_chastain) 9 de octubre de 2017

Desde entonces no ha parado de tuitear acerca del caso, haciÃ©ndose eco de las crÃ­ticas a Weinstein, y de mostrarse del lado de las vÃ­ctimas.

DONNA KARAN

La diseÃ±adora realizÃ³ unas polÃ©micas declaraciones el domingo 8 de las que se retractÃ³ al dÃ­a siguiente. La modista, amiga de la mujer de Weinstein â€”Georgina Chapman, tambiÃ©n diseÃ±adoraâ€”, afirmÃ³ en una alfombra roja: "Mira cÃ³mo se han vestido las mujeres hoy y lo que estÃ¡n pidiendo con sÃ³lo presentarse de esa manera. Â¿QuÃ© estÃ¡n pidiendo? Problemas". El dÃ­a despuÃ©s matizÃ³ sus palabras y asegurÃ³ que sus palabras se habÃ­an sacado de contexto. "Creo que el acoso sexual no es aceptable y este es un tema que debe ser abordado de una vez por todas, independientemente del individuo", apuntÃ³.

ASIA ARGENTO

El 10 de octubre The New Yorker publicÃ³ un amplio reportaje que incluÃ­a varios testimonios de mujeres que relataban los abusos recibidos por parte de Weinstein, entre ellas, la intÃ©rprete Mira Sorvino y la actriz y directora de origen italiano Asia Argento. Ã‰sta acusa al productor de violaciÃ³n y asegura que la forzÃ³ a tener sexo oral. "SÃ© que ha aplastado a mucha mÃ¡s gente antes", asegura Argento.

En su cuenta de Twitter, Argento recuperÃ³ una escena que dirigiÃ³ en 1999 inspirada en la historia de Rosanna Arquette, actriz a la que Weinstein tambiÃ©n recibiÃ³ en albornoz "diciendo que le dolÃ­a el cuello y que necesitaba un masaje".

En ese artÃ­culo tambiÃ©n se cuentan los casos de otras actrices como Lucia Evans, que asegura que la forzÃ³ a tener sexo oral, y Louisette Geiss, que sostiene que Weinstein le dijo que la ayudarÃ­a en su carrera si le miraba masturbarse.

ANGELINA JOLIE Y GWYNETH PALTROW

Un reportaje de The New York Times publicado el dÃ­a 10 recogÃ­a el testimonio de dos pesos pesados de la gran pantalla: las actrices Angelina Jolie y Gwyneth Paltrow.

Sobre esta Ãºltima se cuenta que antes de empezar el rodaje de Emma, cuando Paltrow tenÃ­a 22 aÃ±os, Weinstein la citÃ³ en un hotel. La reuniÃ³n transcurriÃ³ con normalidad hasta que Ã©l intentÃ³ tocarla y le sugiriÃ³ que debÃ­an darse unos masajes. La actriz rechazÃ³ las intentonas del productor y se lo contÃ³ a su pareja por aquel entonces, el actor Brad Pitt, que se peleÃ³ con el productor. "PensÃ© que me iba a despedir", cuenta. Ahora ha resurgido un vÃ­deo de una entrevista de 1998 en la que lo llama coercer (quien ejerce coacciÃ³n).

Por su parte, Angelina Jolie recuerda un episodio durante la promociÃ³n de Jugando con el corazÃ³n en 1998, cuando tenÃ­a 23 aÃ±os: "Tuve una mala experiencia con Harvey Weinstein en mi juventud y, como resultado, decidÃ­ no volver a trabajar con Ã©l nunca mÃ¡s y advertir a otros cuando asÃ­ lo hicieran".

GEORGE CLOONEY

El actor, que conoce a Harvey Weinstein desde hace 20 aÃ±os, ha asegurado que "es indefendible". "Me dio mi primer gran papel en pelÃ­culas como Abierto hasta el amanecer y mi primera oportunidad como director en Confesiones de una mente peligrosa. Hemos compartido cenas, hemos ido junto a localizaciones, hemos discutido pero puedo decir que nunca le he visto este tipo de comportamiento, nunca", asegurÃ³ a Daily Beast el martes 10.

JEFF BRIDGES

El actor, que trabajÃ³ con Weinstein en 2014 en The Giver, seÃ±alÃ³ en Hollywood Reporter este martes que el productor "se enfrenta ahora a sus demonios". "Espero que se apoye en esos demonios para pasar al otro lado siendo una persona mejor. Le deseo lo mejor", prosiguiÃ³.

BEN AFFLECK

Facebook ha sido la vÃ­a elegida por Ben Affleck. "Estoy triste y enfadado porque un hombre con el que he trabajado [produjo El indomable Will Hunting] usara su posiciÃ³n de poder para intimidar, acosar sexualmente y manipular a muchas mujeres durante dÃ©cadas", afirmÃ³ este martes. "Necesitamos mejorar en la protecciÃ³n de nuestras hermanas, amigas, compaÃ±eras e hijas", aÃ±adiÃ³.

Unas horas despuÃ©s Rose McGowan â€”una de las actrices que aparecÃ­an en el artÃ­culo que destapÃ³ el escÃ¡ndaloâ€” le acusÃ³ de mentir. "Le dije que dejara de hacerlo', me dijiste a la cara. La rueda de prensa a la que me hicieron ir despuÃ©s del asalto. Mientes", afirmÃ³ en un tuit, sugiriendo que el actor tenÃ­a conocimiento del comportamiento de Weinstein. En un mensaje posterior la actriz escribiÃ³: "Que te j****, Ben Affleck".

CHARLIZE THERON

La actriz y Weinstein trabajaron juntos en varias pelÃ­culas, como Las normas de la casa de la sidra. En un comunicado enviado a BuzzFeed este martes, asegurÃ³ que "desafortunadamente" no podÃ­a decir que se sorprendiera. "Esta cultura ha existido siempre, no sÃ³lo en Hollywood sino en todo el mundo. Y muchos hombres con puestos de poder han campado a sus anchas durante mucho tiempo. No podemos culpar a las vÃ­ctimas", apostillÃ³.

JAMIE LEE CURTIS

La actriz escribiÃ³ un artÃ­culo para el HuffPost el 10 de octubre en el que criticaba las palabras de la diseÃ±adora Donna Karan y en el que aseguraba que habÃ­a sufrido sus propias "versiones, privadas y personales, de acoso sexual en el trabajo". "Â¿Lo pedÃ­? No. Lo Ãºnico que pedÃ­ fue un trabajo, y lo que vino con ese trabajo fue el acoso sexual", reflexionaba.

LINDSAY LOHAN

La actriz y cantante ha sido una de las pocas defensoras del productor. "Me siento muy mal por Harvey Weinstein", asegurÃ³ a travÃ©s de Instagram Stories. "No creo que lo que estÃ¡ pasando estÃ© bien". En su publicaciÃ³n, que despuÃ©s borrÃ³ pero circula por internet, escribiÃ³ el nombre del productor junto a un emoji con halo de santo.

lindsay lohan (and her whack accent) is defending Harvey Weinstein on her insta rn. GOODBYE TO YOU FOREVER. pic.twitter.com/aMzvAOXPYp â€” lauren yap (@itslaurenyap) 11 de octubre de 2017

LEONARDO DICAPRIO

El actor, que ha participado en varias pelÃ­culas de Weinstein como Gangs of New York, El aviador y Django Desencadenado, tambiÃ©n ha recurrido a Facebook para expresarse. Este miÃ©rcoles 11 escribiÃ³: "No hay excusa para el acoso y el abuso sexual, sin importar quiÃ©n eres ni quÃ© profesiÃ³n tienes. Aplaudo la fuerza y el coraje de las mujeres que han dado un paso al frente y han hecho que su voz se escuche".

TOM HANKS

El actor nunca ha trabajado con Weinstein pero no se ha cortado a la hora de opinar sobre su disculpa. "Oh, bueno, crecÃ­ en los 60 y los 70 y por lo tanto...' Yo tambiÃ©n. Creo que se trata de quÃ© es lo que quieres desde esa posiciÃ³n de poder. Conozco a todo tipo de personas a las que les encanta machacar o hacerle la vida imposible a sus subalternos porque pueden hacerlo", seÃ±alÃ³ en una entrevista en The New York Times el miÃ©rcoles 11. "No soy la primera persona que dice que Harvey es un poco cabrÃ³n".

PENÃ‰LOPE CRUZ

La actriz espaÃ±ola â€”que ganÃ³ el Oscar a Mejor actriz de reparto por Vicky Cristina Barcelona, producida por The Weinstein Companyâ€” seÃ±alÃ³ este 12 de octubre que las informaciones sobre el productor aparecidas en los Ãºltimos dÃ­as la habÃ­an dejado "extremadamente triste y asombrada".

"Hemos trabajado juntos en diferentes pelÃ­culas e, incluso si Ã©l ha sido respetuoso conmigo y personalmente nunca he sido testigo de ese tipo de actitudes, necesito expresar mi apoyo a las mujeres que han tenido esas horribles experiencias", seÃ±alÃ³. Cruz recalcÃ³ que "ese tipo de abuso de poder es absolutamente inaceptable".

RYAN GOSLING

El actor recurriÃ³ a Twitter este jueves, donde seÃ±alÃ³ que, como la mayor parte de Hollywood, habÃ­a trabajado con el productor. "Estoy profundamente decepcionado conmigo por estar tan ajeno a estas devastadoras experiencias de acoso sexual y abuso [...] Los hombres deben apoyar a las mujeres y trabajar juntos hasta que haya verdadera responsabilidad y cambio", apuntÃ³.

OLIVER STONE

El director de cine Oliver Stone asegurÃ³ el viernes 13 que "no es fÃ¡cil por lo que estÃ¡ pasando" Harvey Weinstein. "Creo que un hombre no deberÃ­a ser condenado por un sistema de justicieros [...] He oÃ­do historias de terror sobre casi todo el mundo en este negocio, asÃ­ que no voy a comentar sobre chismorreos", aÃ±adiÃ³.

QUENTIN TARANTINO

HabÃ­a expectaciÃ³n por conocer la reacciÃ³n del director, cuya filmografÃ­a ha sido producida por Weinstein. No ha hablado directamente, sino que se ha expresado a travÃ©s de la actriz Amber Tamblyn. "Anoche cenÃ© con mi amigo Quentin Tarantino. Me ha pedido que comparta con vosotros una declaraciÃ³n respecto a Harvey Weinstein", publicÃ³ Ã©sta en Twitter el 13 de octubre. "En la Ãºltima semana he asistido conmocionado y descorazonado a las revelaciones que han salido a la luz sobre mi amigo desde hace 25 aÃ±os, Harvey Weinstein. Necesito unos cuantos dÃ­as mÃ¡s para procesar el dolor, las emociones, la rabia y los recuerdos y, entonces, hablarÃ© pÃºblicamente sobre ello".

EMMA THOMPSON

En una entrevista en BBC2 este viernes, la actriz llamÃ³ a Weinstein "depredador". "Uno de los grandes problemas del sistema que tenemos es que hay demasiados ojos ciegos y no podemos seguir haciendo responsables a las mujeres a las que les pasa esto", aÃ±adiÃ³. "PasÃ© mi veintena tratando de sacar la lengua de los viejos de mi boca porque pensaban: 'Bueno, ella estÃ¡ dispuesta'. AsÃ­ que imagino que eso ocurre muy frecuentemente y quizÃ¡ Ã©ste es un momento en el que podemos decir a hombres y mujeres: 'Â¡Abrid vuestros ojos y vuestras bocas y decid algo!".

REACCIONES POLÃTICAS

El escÃ¡ndalo ha sobrepasado Hollywood y ha entrado en la esfera polÃ­tica. Hillary Clinton y su partido recibieron dinero del productor para su campaÃ±a electoral. Clinton enviÃ³ un comunicado a la CNN este miÃ©rcoles 11 en el que asegura estar "impactada y paralizada". "El comportamiento descrito por las mujeres que le han denunciado no puede ser tolerado. Su valentÃ­a y el apoyo de los demÃ¡s es fundamental para ayudar a frenar este tipo de actitudes", aÃ±adiÃ³.

El expresidente Barack Obama y su mujer, Michelle, han afirmado, tambiÃ©n a travÃ©s de un comunicado, que se declaran "disgustados". "Cualquier hombre que degrada a las mujeres de tal manera debe ser condenado y responsabilizado, independientemente de su riqueza o estatus", aÃ±aden.

Â¿Y LA MUJER DE WEINSTEIN?

El escÃ¡ndalo tambiÃ©n ha tenido consecuencias en la vida personal de Weinstein. Su mujer, Georgina Chapman â€”de 41 aÃ±os y diseÃ±adora y fundadora de la firma Marchesaâ€” lo ha dejado. "Mi corazÃ³n se rompe por todas las mujeres que han sufrido un daÃ±o terrible por sus imperdonables acciones. He decidido dejar a mi marido. SUMMARY:
Hanging Out On The Fringes - Labour Conference 2017 The Labour Party has a tradition of inviting pre-eminent international speakers to address its conference.
Labour activist and Chair of LGBT Labour WalesOn World Mental Health Day, We Must Commit To Fair Funding For Mental Health Care Mental health is on the TV.
Labour MP for Bootle and Shadow Chief Sec to the TreasuryOnly Labour Can Deliver The Transport Investment Britain Needs The Conservatives are refusing to say precisely where the Â£400 million of transport investment will be spent.
Labour MP for Blaenau Gwent and party whipDisability Activists Challenging Labour Disabled people are making sure their voices and viewpoints are heard.
Labour MP for Birmingham YardleyTory Conference Diary, Day 2: More Evidence That The Government Have Run Out Of Ideas Party Conferences are traditionally an opportunity for each side to have their moment in the sun.
TEXT:
Hanging Out On The Fringes - Labour Conference 2017 The Labour Party has a tradition of inviting pre-eminent international speakers to address its conference. President Bill Clinton did it twice in 2002 and 2006, and the late, great, Nelson Mandela addressed the conference in Brighton in 2000. Acting Senior UK Political Adviser at Christian Aid. Previously worked in health policy, UK Parliament & UK civil service.

Why Coming Out Still Matters This Wednesday, 11th October, is National Coming Out Day, a date popularised in the USA but frequently marked here in the UK too. People use it as an opportunity to come out for the first time, to share their coming out story, or just to promote being out and being part of the LGBT community. But why do we still need to come out? It's 2017. Aren't we done with all that? Labour activist and Chair of LGBT Labour Wales

On World Mental Health Day, We Must Commit To Fair Funding For Mental Health Care Mental health is on the TV. On the radio. In the tabloids, in the broadsheets, in the magazines. Online. Mental health is on everyone's lips; Prime Ministers and future kings. Mental health is what everyone seems to be talking about. It's time to talk. It's good to talk. That really is something to celebrate. We are all talking about mental health - and yet ... and yet the talk is increasingly of crisis. We must ring-fence mental health spending to close the gap between the rhetoric of parity and the reality of cuts on the front-line. We must keep talking. But if we want to see real equality for mental health now is the time for action. Labour and Co-operative MP for Liverpool Wavertree, President of Labourâ€™s Campaign for Mental Health

No Hope For Young People From Hapless Hammond The reality is that young people in this country have felt the brunt of seven years of Tory austerity. Rising house prices, slow economic growth, and a lack of stable employment have entrenched huge economic inequality between the younger and older generations. Under the Conservatives, the levels of debt young people find themselves in has risen dramatically. The decision to triple tuition fees and end grants for students attending university now means that young people are leaving university with on average Â£40,000 worth of debt. Labour MP for Bootle and Shadow Chief Sec to the Treasury

Only Labour Can Deliver The Transport Investment Britain Needs The Conservatives are refusing to say precisely where the Â£400 million of transport investment will be spent. Why make an announcement without a plan? The reason is that this is a government without a plan, and merely shows how out of the touch the Tories are with the needs and ambitions of the North. Shadow transport secretary and Labour MP for Middlesborough

7,000 Words And Not A Single Mention Of Wales After this conference season, it's becoming increasingly clear that Theresa May is content with providing "second best" solutions to the issues which face communities across Wales and the UK as a whole. Member of Parliament for Ogmore

Tory Conference Diary, Day 4: May's Disaster Of A Speech Proved The Tories Have No Plan As Tory Conference comes to a close many of the papers and broadcast channels have obviously focused in on the mishaps which plagued Theresa May's speech. But aside from the cough and the falling backdrop, the true disaster of the speech lies in the fact that we had final confirmation that the Tories really do have no plan. Labour MP for Hemsworth and Shadow Minister for the Cabinet

Southern Rail Dispute And Uber Debacle Shows Labour Will Fight For The Unions, Not You The strikes on Tuesday and Thursday by the RMT Union have caused yet more indignation for so many of my constituents in East Surrey who commute into London for work and all the other passengers reliant on the service. What makes it all the more galling for the passengers is the persistent support the unions receive from Jeremy Corbyn. Rather than condemning the union bosses for playing games, the Labour leader has made it abundantly clear he stands with the union barons. Prisons and probation minister and Conservative MP for East Surrey

Tory Conference Diary, Day 3: Do They Have Even A Semblance Of A Plan For Britain? With one day left, it's down to Theresa May to put forward her vision for the future and prove she has a semblance of a plan. If the last three days are anything to go by, I think the Tory faithful are going to be leaving Manchester very disappointed. Labour MP for Hemsworth and Shadow Minister for the Cabinet

Amazon's Tax Crackdown Is The First Step To Fairness This one-off payment means hundreds of millions more for public services and taxpayers across the continent. Schools, hospitals, front line services and infrastructure all benefiting from the success of these big companies. Surely that's how it should always work, and a state of affairs worth striving for? Labour MP for Blaenau Gwent and party whip

Disability Activists Challenging Labour Disabled people are making sure their voices and viewpoints are heard. There is no excuse for lack of accessibility and a failure to consult. Disabled people must advise on conference planning. I am involved in both groups, we are working together. Our activism and solidarity will enable us to succeed. Disability Blogger Activist & Information Guru. Wheelchair user passionate about equality inclusion & education. Lover of books & cats.

Help To Buy Will Help To Bury Home Ownership, And The Tories' Hopes For A Political Resurgence With It Tackling the housing crisis will take time, reform won't deliver immediate benefits and will need longer than one parliamentary term to make a real difference. Yet instead of offering the bold reform needed the Conservatives have gone for the easy option. But Help to Buy is not the answer, instead it will help to bury the next generation's aspirations for home ownership and the Tories' hopes for a political resurgence with it. Senior Research Fellow at IPPR, specialising in housing and infrastructure

The Conservatives Have Run Out Of Ideas Of How To Repair Our Broken Justice System Crisis after crisis rocked the justice system this summer. Conservative Justice Secretary David Lidington had an opportunity to show that he was getting a grip during his keynote speech at Conservative Party conference. Sadly for the millions who depend on a properly functioning justice system, he fluffed his chance. Labour MP for East Leeds, Shadow Justice Secretary

The Road To Hell Is Paved With Good Intentions On the face of it, Universal Credit is a good idea. The benefits system is ridiculously complex, simplifying it is common sense. Except people are not simple, they don't fit into boxes. My sister-in-law and my brother could not have more different needs, experiences and circumstances. The idea that one (fairly inflexible) thing could simply suit them both is a system designed by someone who has not met a very broad range of people. If the variation in my immediate family is so wide, imagine how many iterations are possible. Labour MP for Birmingham Yardley

Tory Conference Diary, Day 2: More Evidence That The Government Have Run Out Of Ideas Party Conferences are traditionally an opportunity for each side to have their moment in the sun. The Party presents their new policy ideas and sets out their vision on how they can take the country forward and tackle the great challenges ahead. Measured against this, it was clear the Tories had another bad day. Labour MP for Hemsworth and Shadow Minister for the Cabinet
TITLE: Labour Party

TEXT:
WASHINGTON, DC - OCTOBER 10: U.S. President Donald Trump answers questions from the press during a meeting with former U.S. Secretary of State Henry Kissinger in the Oval Office October 10, 2017 in Washington, DC. Trump answered a range of questions during the portion of the meeting that was open to the press, including queries on Secretary of State Rex Tillerson. (Photo by Win McNamee/Getty Images)

U.S. President Donald Trump pauses after speaking during a meeting with Henry Kissinger, former U.S. secretary of state, not pictured, in the Oval Office of the White House in Washington, D.C., U.S., on Tuesday, Oct. 10, 2017.
